original: vaicitravīrye nṛpatau samācarati nityadā
analyzed: vaicitravīrye nṛpatau samācarati nityadā
translated: The Kuru, the extender of the Kuru lineage, always did what was pleasing, not what was displeasing,🔽to the king Vichitravirya.

original: yad yad brūte ca kiṃ cit sa dhṛtarāṣṭro narādhipaḥ
analyzed: yat yat brūte ca kim cit sa dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ narādhipaḥ
translated: Whatever the king Dhritarashtra said,

original: guru vā laghu vā kāryaṃ gāndhārī ca yaśasvinī
analyzed: guru vā laghu vā kāryam gāndhārī ca yaśasvinī
translated: whether the task was important or minor, and the illustrious Gandhari,

original: tat sa rājā mahārāja pāṇḍavānāṃ dhuraṃdharaḥ
analyzed: tat sa rājā mahā rāja pāṇḍavānām dhuraṃdharaḥ
translated: that king, the great king, the leader of the Pandavas,

original: pūjayitvā vacas tat tad akārṣīt paravīrahā
analyzed: pūjayitvā vacaḥ tat tat akārṣīt para vīra hā
translated: having honored those words, had them carried out, that slayer of enemy heroes.

original: tena tasyābhavat prīto vṛttena sa narādhipaḥ
analyzed: tena tasya abhavat prītaḥ vṛttena sa narādhipaḥ
translated: By that conduct, the king, that lord of men, was pleased with him.

original: anvatapyac ca saṃsmṛtya putraṃ mandam acetasam
analyzed: anvatapyat ca saṃsmṛtya putram mandam acetasam
translated: And remembering his slow-witted son, he always felt remorse.

original: sadā ca prātar utthāya kṛtajapyaḥ śucir nṛpaḥ
analyzed: sadā ca prātar utthāya kṛta japyaḥ śuciḥ nṛpaḥ
translated: And every morning, rising up, having performed his prayers and being pure, the king

original: āśāste pāṇḍuputrāṇāṃ samareṣv aparājayam
analyzed: āśāste pāṇḍu putrāṇām samareṣu a parājayam
translated: Blesses the sons of Pandu for their invincibility in battle.

original: brāhmaṇān vācayitvā ca hutvā caiva hutāśanam
analyzed: brāhmaṇān vācayitvā ca hutvā ca eva hutāśanam
translated: And having caused the Brahmanas to recite (blessings) and having offered oblations to the sacrificial fire,

original: āyuṣyaṃ pāṇḍuputrāṇām āśāste sa narādhipaḥ
analyzed: āyuṣyam pāṇḍu putrāṇām āśāste sa narādhipaḥ
translated: That lord of men blesses the lives of the sons of Pandu.

original: na tāṃ prītiṃ parām āpa putrebhyaḥ sa mahīpatiḥ
analyzed: na tām prītim parām āpa putrebhyaḥ sa mahīpatiḥ
translated: That lord of the earth did not obtain that highest joy from his sons

original: yāṃ prītiṃ pāṇḍuputrebhyaḥ samavāpa tadā nṛpaḥ🔽brāhmaṇānāṃ ca vṛddhānāṃ kṣatriyāṇāṃ ca bhārata
analyzed: yām prītim pāṇḍu putrebhyaḥ samavāpa tadā nṛpaḥ  brāhmaṇānām ca vṛddhānām kṣatriyāṇām ca bhārata
translated: Which joy that king obtained from the sons of Pandu.🔽And he became greatly beloved of the aged Brahmanas, of the Kshatriyas, O Bharata,

original: tathā viṭśūdrasaṃghānām abhavat supriyas tadā
analyzed: tathā viś śūdra saṃghānām abhavat su priyaḥ tadā
translated: And of the multitudes of Vaishyas and Shudras.

original: yac ca kiṃ cit purā pāpaṃ dhṛtarāṣṭrasutaiḥ kṛtam
analyzed: yat ca kim cit purā pāpam dhṛtarāṣṭra sutaiḥ kṛtam
translated: And whatever sin had been committed by the sons of Dhritarashtra,

original: akṛtvā hṛdi tad rājā taṃ nṛpaṃ so 'nvavartata
analyzed: a kṛtvā hṛdi tat rājā tam nṛpam saḥ nvavartata
translated: The king, not keeping it in his heart, followed that king.

original: yaś ca kaś cin naraḥ kiṃ cid apriyaṃ cāmbikāsute
analyzed: yaḥ ca kaḥ cit naraḥ kim cit apriyam ca ambikāsute
translated: And whatever man did anything displeasing to the son of Ambika,

original: kurute dveṣyatām eti sa kaunteyasya dhīmataḥ🔽na rājño dhṛtarāṣṭrasya na ca duryodhanasya vai
analyzed: kurute dveṣya tām eti sa kaunteyasya dhīmataḥ  na rājñaḥ dhṛtarāṣṭrasya na ca duryodhanasya vai
translated: He became an object of hatred to the wise son of Kunti.🔽And no man, out of fear of Yudhishthira, said anything about the evil deeds

original: uvāca duṣkṛtaṃ kiṃ cid yudhiṣṭhirabhayān naraḥ
analyzed: uvāca duṣkṛtam kim cit yudhiṣṭhira bhayāt naraḥ
translated: Of either king Dhritarashtra or Duryodhana.

original: dhṛtyā tuṣṭo narendrasya gāndhārī viduras tathā🔽śaucena cājātaśatror na tu bhīmasya śatruhan
analyzed: dhṛtyā tuṣṭaḥ narendrasya gāndhārī viduraḥ tathā  śaucena ca ajātaśatroḥ na tu bhīmasya śatru han
translated: Gandhari and Vidura were pleased with the king's fortitude,🔽but not with Bhima, O slayer of enemies, with Ajatashatru's purity.

original: anvavartata bhīmo 'pi niṣṭanan dharmajaṃ nṛpam
analyzed: anvavartata bhīmaḥ pi niṣṭanan dharmajam nṛpam
translated: Bhima also followed King Yudhishthira, sighing,

original: dhṛtarāṣṭraṃ ca saṃprekṣya sadā bhavati durmanāḥ
analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭram ca saṃprekṣya sadā bhavati durmanāḥ
translated: and always became sorrowful when looking at Dhritarashtra.

original: rājānam anuvartantaṃ dharmaputraṃ mahāmatim
analyzed: rājānam anuvartantam dharmaputram mahāmatim
translated: When the greatly wise son of Dharma, following the king,

original: anvavartata kauravyo hṛdayena parāṅmukhaḥ
analyzed: anvavartata kauravyaḥ hṛdayena parāṅmukhaḥ
translated: the descendant of Kuru followed him, his heart turned away.

original: vaiśaṃpāyana uvāca🔽yudhiṣṭhirasya nṛpater duryodhanapitus tathā
analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca  yudhiṣṭhirasya nṛpateḥ duryodhana pituḥ tathā
translated: Vaishampayana said:🔽The men saw no difference, O king, in the affection of King Yudhishthira

original: nāntaraṃ dadṛśū rājan puruṣāḥ praṇayaṃ prati
analyzed: na antaram dadṛśuḥ rājan puruṣāḥ praṇayam prati
translated: and the father of Duryodhana towards each other.

original: yadā tu kauravo rājā putraṃ sasmāra bāliśam
analyzed: yadā tu kauravaḥ rājā putram sasmāra bāliśam
translated: But when the Kuru king remembered his foolish son,

original: tadā bhīmaṃ hṛdā rājann apadhyāti sa pārthivaḥ🔽tathaiva bhīmaseno 'pi dhṛtarāṣṭraṃ janādhipam
analyzed: tadā bhīmam hṛdā rājan apadhyāti sa pārthivaḥ  tathā eva bhīmasenaḥ u pi dhṛtarāṣṭram janādhipam
translated: then, O king, that lord of the earth inwardly despised Bhima.🔽In the same way, Bhimasena also, O lord of kings,

original: nāmarṣayata rājendra sadaivātuṣṭavad dhṛdā
analyzed: na amarṣayata rāja indra sadā eva a tuṣṭa vat dhṛdā
translated: could not bear the lord of men Dhritarashtra, always being dissatisfied in his heart.

original: kauravaś caiva bhīmaś ca hṛdānyonyam amṛṣyatām
analyzed: kauravaḥ ca eva bhīmaḥ ca hṛdā anyonyam amṛṣyatām
translated: The descendant of Kuru and Bhima could not bear each other in their hearts,

original: dhyāyantau ślakṣṇayā vācā anyonyām abhitiṣṭhatām
analyzed: dhyāyantau ślakṣṇayā vācā anyonyām abhitiṣṭhatām
translated: thinking of each other, they spoke to each other with gentle words.

original: aprakāśāny apriyāṇi cakārāsya vṛkodaraḥ
analyzed: aprakāśāni apriyāṇi cakāra asya vṛkodaraḥ
translated: Vrikodara did unpleasant things to him that were not in the light.

original: ājñāṃ pratyaharac cāpi kṛtakaiḥ puruṣaiḥ sadā
analyzed: ājñām pratyaharat ca api kṛtakaiḥ puruṣaiḥ sadā
translated: And he always thwarted his commands through deceitful men.

original: saṃvatsarāṇy athaivaṃ te vṛttavantaś ca kāni cit
analyzed: saṃvatsarāṇi athā evam te vṛttavantaḥ ca kāni cit
translated: And in this way, they spent some years.

original: smaran durmantritaṃ tasya vṛttāny apy asya kāni cit
analyzed: smaran durmantritam tasya vṛttāni api asya kāni cit
translated: Remembering his evil counsel, he sometimes even acted against him.

original: asakṛc cāpy uvācedaṃ hatās te mandacetasaḥ
analyzed: asakṛt ca api uvāca idam hatāḥ te manda cetasaḥ
translated: And he often said this: Those evil-minded ones are killed.

original: atha bhīmaḥ suhṛnmadhye bāhuśabdaṃ tathākarot
analyzed: atha bhīmaḥ suhṛd madhye bāhu śabdam tathā akarot
translated: Then Bhima, in the midst of his well-wishers, made a sound with his arms

original: saṃśrave dhṛtarāṣṭrasya gāndhāryāś cāpy amarṣaṇaḥ
analyzed: saṃśrave dhṛtarāṣṭrasya gāndhāryāḥ ca api amarṣaṇaḥ
translated: within the hearing of Dhritarashtra and the intolerant Gandhari,

original: smṛtvā duryodhanaṃ śatruṃ karṇaduḥśāsanāv api
analyzed: smṛtvā duryodhanam śatrum karṇa duḥśāsanau api
translated: remembering his enemies Duryodhana, Karna and Duhshasana,

original: provācātha susaṃrabdho bhīmaḥ sa paruṣaṃ vacaḥ🔽andhasya nṛpateḥ putrā mayā parighabāhunā
analyzed: provāca atha su saṃrabdhaḥ bhīmaḥ sa paruṣam vacaḥ  andhasya nṛpateḥ putrāḥ mayā parigha bāhunā
translated: Bhima, greatly enraged, then spoke these harsh words:🔽By me, with arms like iron clubs, all the sons of the blind king

original: nītā lokam amuṃ sarve nānāśastrāttajīvitāḥ
analyzed: nītāḥ lokam amum sarve nānā śastra ātta jīvitāḥ
translated: have been led to the other world, their lives taken away by various weapons.

original: asakṛc cāpy uvācedaṃ hatās te mandacetasaḥ
analyzed: asakṛt ca api uvāca idam hatāḥ te manda cetasaḥ
translated: And he often said this: Those evil-minded ones are killed.

original: imau tau parighaprakhyau bhujau mama durāsadau
analyzed: imau tau parigha prakhyau bhujau mama durāsadau
translated: These two arms of mine, which are like iron clubs and difficult to resist,

original: yayor antaram āsādya dhārtarāṣṭrāḥ kṣayaṃ gatāḥ
analyzed: yayoḥ antaram āsādya dhārtarāṣṭrāḥ kṣayam gatāḥ
translated: having approached the space between them, the sons of Dhritarashtra have been destroyed.

original: imau pīnau suvṛttau me nāgarājakaropamau
analyzed: imau pīnau su vṛttau me nāga rāja kara upamau
translated: These two of mine, which are plump and well-rounded, like the trunks of the king of elephants,

original: yāv āsādya raṇe mūḍhā dhārtarāṣṭrāḥ kṣayaṃ gatāḥ
analyzed: yau āsādya raṇe mūḍhāḥ dhārtarāṣṭrāḥ kṣayam gatāḥ
translated: Having approached whom in battle, the foolish sons of Dhritarashtra have met with destruction,

original: tāv imau candanenāktau vandanīyau ca me bhujau
analyzed: tau imau candanena aktau vandanīyau ca me bhujau
translated: These two arms of mine should be worshipped, anointed with sandalwood paste,

original: yābhyāṃ duryodhano nītaḥ kṣayaṃ sasutabāndhavaḥ
analyzed: yābhyām duryodhanaḥ nītaḥ kṣayam sa suta bāndhavaḥ
translated: By whom Duryodhana was led to destruction along with his sons and relatives.

original: etāś cānyāś ca vividhāḥ śalyabhūtā janādhipaḥ
analyzed: etāḥ ca anyāḥ ca vividhāḥ śalya bhūtāḥ janādhipaḥ
translated: And these and various other things, like thorns to the king,

original: vṛkodarasya tā vācaḥ śrutvā nirvedam āgamat
analyzed: vṛkodarasya tāḥ vācaḥ śrutvā nirvedam āgamat
translated: Having heard those words of Vrikodara, the king became despondent.

original: śrutvā nirvedam āpede bhīmavāgbāṇacoditaḥ
analyzed: śrutvā nirvedam āpede bhīma vāc bāṇa coditaḥ
translated: Having heard them, he became despondent, goaded by the arrows of Bhima's words.

original: sā ca buddhimatī devī kālaparyāyavedinī
analyzed: sā ca buddhimatī devī kāla paryāya vedinī
translated: And that wise queen, who knew the course of time,

original: gāndhārī sarvadharmajñā tāny alīkāni śuśruve
analyzed: gāndhārī sarva dharma jñā tāni alīkāni śuśruve
translated: Gandhari, who knew all dharma, heard those false words.

original: kuntyāḥ saparyāṃ saṃvīkṣya śāpe nāsyākaron matim🔽tataḥ pañcadaśe varṣe samatīte narādhipaḥ
analyzed: kuntyāḥ saparyām saṃvīkṣya śāpe na asya akarot matim  tatas pañcadaśe varṣe samatīte narādhipaḥ
translated: Seeing Kunti's hospitality, she did not set her mind on cursing her.🔽Then, after fifteen years had passed, the king,

original: rājā nirvedam āpede bhīmavāgbāṇapīḍitaḥ
analyzed: rājā nirvedam āpede bhīma vāc bāṇa pīḍitaḥ
translated: Afflicted by the arrows of Bhima's words, became despondent.

original: sukhāsaktaṃ kṛcchraparaṃ jñātvā caiva yudhiṣṭhiram
analyzed: sukha āsaktam kṛcchra param jñātvā ca eva yudhiṣṭhiram
translated: Knowing that Yudhishthira was attached to pleasure and in difficulty,

original: tapoyogāt tapas taptuṃ manaś cakre mahāmatiḥ
analyzed: tapaḥ yogāt tapaḥ taptum manaḥ cakre mahāmatiḥ
translated: The greatly wise one resolved to practice austerities through the yoga of austerities.

original: nānvabudhyata tad rājā kuntīputro yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
analyzed: na anvabudhyata tat rājā kuntī putraḥ yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
translated: King Yudhishthira, the son of Kunti, did not understand that.

original: śvetāśvo vātha kuntī vā draupadī vā yaśasvinī
analyzed: śvetāśvaḥ vā atha kuntī vā draupadī vā yaśasvinī
translated: Nor did the one with white horses, nor Kunti, nor the illustrious Draupadi,

original: mādrīputrau ca bhīmasya cittajñāv anvamodatām
analyzed: mādrī putrau ca bhīmasya citta jñau anvamodatām
translated: The two sons of Madri, who knew Bhima's mind, approved of it,

original: rājñas tu cittaṃ rakṣantau nocatuḥ kiṃ cid apriyam
analyzed: rājñaḥ tu cittam rakṣantau na ūcatuḥ kim cit apriyam
translated: but out of regard for the king's feelings, they did not say anything unpleasant.

original: tataḥ samānayām āsa dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ suhṛjjanam🔽bāṣpasaṃdigdham atyartham idam āha vaco bhṛśam
analyzed: tatas samānayām āsa dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ suhṛd janam  bāṣpa saṃdigdham atyartham idam āha vacaḥ bhṛśam
translated: Then Dhritarashtra summoned his well-wishers🔽and with a voice choked with tears, spoke these words:

original: sa bhīmavākyāgnividīpitāṅgo
analyzed: sa bhīma vākya agni vidīpita aṅgaḥ
translated: With his body ignited by the fire of Bhima's words,

original: nirviṇṇacetā nṛpatiḥ saśokaḥ
analyzed: nirviṇṇa cetāḥ nṛpatiḥ sa śokaḥ
translated: the king, his mind despondent and full of sorrow,

original: sapaurabhṛtyaṃ janam ānināya
analyzed: sa paura bhṛtyam janam ānināya
translated: brought the people of the city and his servants

original: vanaṃ yiyāsur vacanaṃ babhāṣe
analyzed: vanam yiyāsuḥ vacanam babhāṣe
translated: and, wishing to go to the forest, spoke these words:

original: dhṛtarāṣṭra uvāca
analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ uvāca
translated: Dhritarashtra said:

original: vartamāneṣu sadvṛttiṃ pāṇḍaveṣu mahātmasu
analyzed: vartamāneṣu sat vṛttim pāṇḍaveṣu mahātmasu
translated: While the great-souled Pandavas were conducting themselves righteously,

original: prītimānam abhavad rājā kuntīputro yudhiṣṭhiraḥ🔽viditaṃ bhavatām etad yathā vṛttaḥ kurukṣayaḥ
analyzed: prītimān abhavat rājā kuntī putraḥ yudhiṣṭhiraḥ  viditam bhavatām etat yathā vṛttaḥ kuru kṣayaḥ
translated: King Yudhishthira, the son of Kunti, was pleased.🔽You know how the destruction of the Kurus took place.

original: mamāparādhāt tat sarvam iti jñeyaṃ tu kauravāḥ🔽yo 'haṃ duṣṭamatiṃ mūḍhaṃ jñātīnāṃ bhayavardhanam
analyzed: mama aparādhāt tat sarvam iti jñeyam tu kauravāḥ  yaḥ ham duṣṭa matim mūḍham jñātīnām bhaya vardhanam
translated: Know that all that happened because of my transgression, O Kauravas.🔽I who, out of folly, consecrated the wicked-minded Duryodhana,

original: duryodhanaṃ kauravāṇām ādhipatye 'bhyaṣecayam
analyzed: duryodhanam kauravāṇām ādhipatye bhyaṣecayam
translated: who increased the fear of his kinsmen, as the lord of the Kauravas,

original: yac cāhaṃ vāsudevasya vākyaṃ nāśrauṣam arthavat
analyzed: yat ca aham vāsudevasya vākyam na aśrauṣam arthavat
translated: and I who did not listen to the meaningful words of Vasudeva,

original: vadhyatāṃ sādhv ayaṃ pāpaḥ sāmātya iti durmatiḥ
analyzed: vadhyatām sādhu ayam pāpaḥ sa amātyaḥ iti durmatiḥ
translated: thinking, Let this wicked-minded one be killed along with his ministers!

original: putrasnehābhibhūtaś ca hitam ukto manīṣibhiḥ
analyzed: putra sneha abhibhūtaḥ ca hitam uktaḥ manīṣibhiḥ
translated: Overwhelmed by affection for my son, I did not heed the beneficial words spoken by the wise

original: vidureṇātha bhīṣmeṇa droṇena ca kṛpeṇa ca
analyzed: vidureṇa atha bhīṣmeṇa droṇena ca kṛpeṇa ca
translated: Vidura, Bhishma, Drona, Kripa,

original: pade pade bhagavatā vyāsena ca mahātmanā
analyzed: pade pade bhagavatā vyāsena ca mahātmanā
translated: and at every step by the illustrious and great-souled Vyasa,

original: saṃjayenātha gāndhāryā tad idaṃ tapyate 'dya mām🔽yac cāhaṃ pāṇḍuputreṇa guṇavatsu mahātmasu
analyzed: saṃjayena atha gāndhāryā tat idam tapyate mām  yat ca aham pāṇḍu putreṇa guṇavatsu mahātmasu
translated: and by Sanjaya and Gandhari. That is what torments me now.🔽And that I did not bestow upon the sons of Pandu, those virtuous and great-souled ones,

original: na dattavāñ śriyaṃ dīptāṃ pitṛpaitāmahīm imām
analyzed: na dattavām śriyam dīptām pitṛpaitāmahīm imām
translated: this blazing prosperity inherited from my father and grandfather.

original: vināśaṃ paśyamāno hi sarvarājñāṃ gadāgrajaḥ
analyzed: vināśam paśyamānaḥ hi sarva rājñām gadāgrajaḥ
translated: Seeing the destruction of all the kings, the elder brother of Gada

original: etac chreyaḥ sa paramam amanyata janārdanaḥ
analyzed: etat śreyaḥ sa paramam amanyata janārdanaḥ
translated: considered this to be the highest good, O Janardana.

original: tasya trailokyanāthasya samupetyābhiyācataḥ
analyzed: tasya trailokya nāthasya samupetya abhiyācataḥ
translated: When he, the lord of the three worlds, approached and requested me,

original: akṛtvā vacanaṃ paścāt tapsyāmy adya sudurmatiḥ
analyzed: a kṛtvā vacanam paścāt tapsyāmi adya su durmatiḥ
translated: not having done what he said, I, the extremely evil-minded one, will now be tormented.

original: so 'ham etāny alīkāni nivṛttāny ātmanaḥ sadā
analyzed: saḥ ham etāni alīkāni nivṛttāni ātmanaḥ sadā
translated: I always bear these false and averted things of mine

original: hṛdaye śalyabhūtāni dhārayāmi sahasraśaḥ
analyzed: hṛdaye śalya bhūtāni dhārayāmi sahasraśas
translated: in my heart as a thousand stakes.

original: viśeṣatas tu dahyāmi varṣaṃ pañcadaśaṃ hi vai
analyzed: viśeṣataḥ tu dahyāmi varṣam pañcadaśam hi vai
translated: But especially I am burning in the fifteenth year,

original: asya pāpasya śuddhyarthaṃ niyato 'smi sudurmatiḥ
analyzed: asya pāpasya śuddhi artham niyataḥ smi su durmatiḥ
translated: for the purification of this sin, I, the extremely evil-minded one, am restrained.

original: caturthe niyate kāle kadā cid api cāṣṭame
analyzed: caturthe niyate kāle kadā cit api ca aṣṭame
translated: Sometimes, at the fourth or even the eighth fixed time,

original: tṛṣṇāvinayanaṃ bhuñje gāndhārī veda tan mama
analyzed: tṛṣṇā vinayanam bhuñje gāndhārī veda tat mama
translated: I eat to control my thirst, Gandhari knows that about me.

original: karoty āhāram iti māṃ sarvaḥ parijanaḥ sadā
analyzed: karoti āhāram iti mām sarvaḥ parijanaḥ sadā
translated: All the servants always think that I am eating.

original: yudhiṣṭhirabhayād vetti bhṛśaṃ tapyati pāṇḍavaḥ
analyzed: yudhiṣṭhira bhayāt vetti bhṛśam tapyati pāṇḍavaḥ
translated: The Pandava (Yudhisthira) knows that I am greatly tormented out of fear of Yudhisthira.

original: bhūmau śaye japyaparo darbheṣv ajinasaṃvṛtaḥ
analyzed: bhūmau śaye japya paraḥ darbheṣu ajina saṃvṛtaḥ
translated: I sleep on the ground, devoted to japa, covered with deerskin on darbha grass.

original: niyamavyapadeśena gāndhārī ca yaśasvinī🔽hataṃ putraśataṃ śūraṃ saṃgrāmeṣv apalāyinam
analyzed: niyama vyapadeśena gāndhārī ca yaśasvinī  hatam putra śatam śūram saṃgrāmeṣu apalāyinam
translated: And the illustrious Gandhari, under the pretext of observances,🔽(sleeps) on a bed of darbha grass, covered with a single piece of cloth.🔽The two of them, whose one hundred brave sons did not flee in battle,

original: hataṃ śataṃ tu putrāṇāṃ yayor yuddhe 'palāyinām
analyzed: hatam śatam tu putrāṇām yayoḥ yuddhe palāyinām
translated: whose one hundred sons were killed in battle without fleeing,

original: nānutapyāmi tac cāhaṃ kṣatradharmaṃ hi taṃ viduḥ
analyzed: na anutapyāmi tat ca aham kṣatra dharmam hi tam viduḥ
translated: I do not regret that, for they know that is the duty of a kshatriya.

original: ity uktvā dharmarājānam abhyabhāṣata kauravaḥ
analyzed: iti uktvā dharmarājānam abhyabhāṣata kauravaḥ
translated: Having said this, the Kourava (Dhritarashtra) spoke to Dharmaraja (Yudhisthira):

original: bhadraṃ te yādavīmātar vākyaṃ cedaṃ nibodha me
analyzed: bhadram te yādavī mātar vākyam ca idam nibodha me
translated: Good fortune to you, son of Yadu's daughter, listen to these words of mine.

original: sukham asmy uṣitaḥ putra tvayā suparipālitaḥ
analyzed: sukham asmi uṣitaḥ putra tvayā su paripālitaḥ
translated: O son, I have lived happily, well protected by you.

original: mahādānāni dattāni śrāddhāni ca punaḥ punaḥ
analyzed: mahā dānāni dattāni śrāddhāni ca punar punar
translated: Great gifts have been given, and many funeral ceremonies have been performed again and again.

original: prakṛṣṭaṃ me vayaḥ putra puṇyaṃ cīrṇaṃ yathābalam
analyzed: prakṛṣṭam me vayaḥ putra puṇyam cīrṇam yathābalam
translated: My age is advanced, O son, and I have performed meritorious deeds to the best of my ability.

original: gāndhārī hataputreyaṃ dhairyeṇodīkṣate ca mām
analyzed: gāndhārī hata putrā iyam dhairyeṇa udīkṣate ca mām
translated: This Gandhari, whose sons have been killed, looks at me with fortitude.

original: draupadyā hy apakartāras tava caiśvaryahāriṇaḥ
analyzed: draupadyāḥ hi apakartāraḥ tava ca aiśvarya hāriṇaḥ
translated: Those who have wronged Draupadi and robbed you of your prosperity,

original: samatītā nṛśaṃsās te dharmeṇa nihatā yudhi
analyzed: samatītāḥ nṛśaṃsāḥ te dharmeṇa nihatāḥ yudhi
translated: Those cruel ones have been killed in battle by Dharma.

original: na teṣu pratikartavyaṃ paśyāmi kurunandana
analyzed: na teṣu pratikartavyam paśyāmi kuru nandana
translated: O descendant of the Kuru lineage, I do not see any need for revenge against them.

original: sarve śastrajitāṃl lokān gatās te 'bhimukhaṃ hatāḥ
analyzed: sarve śastra jitān lokān gatāḥ te abhimukham hatāḥ
translated: All of them have gone to the worlds obtained by those killed while facing the enemy.

original: ātmanas tu hitaṃ mukhyaṃ pratikartavyam adya me
analyzed: ātmanaḥ tu hitam mukhyam pratikartavyam adya me
translated: But for myself, the foremost thing to do now is to repay the debt.

original: gāndhāryāś caiva rājendra tad anujñātum arhasi
analyzed: gāndhāryāḥ ca eva rāja indra tat anujñātum arhasi
translated: O lord of kings, you should grant permission for this, for Gandhari as well.

original: tvaṃ hi dharmabhṛtāṃ śreṣṭhaḥ satataṃ dharmavatsalaḥ
analyzed: tvam hi dharma bhṛtām śreṣṭhaḥ satatam dharma vatsalaḥ
translated: You are the best among those who uphold dharma, always devoted to dharma.

original: rājā guruḥ prāṇabhṛtāṃ tasmād etad bravīmy aham
analyzed: rājā guruḥ prāṇabhṛtām tasmāt etat bravīmi aham
translated: The king is the preceptor of living beings, therefore I speak this.

original: anujñātas tvayā vīra saṃśrayeyaṃ vanāny aham
analyzed: anujñātaḥ tvayā vīra saṃśrayeyam vanāni aham
translated: O hero, with your permission, I will retire to the forest.

original: cīravalkalabhṛd rājan gāndhāryā sahito 'nayā
analyzed: cīra valkala bhṛt rājan gāndhāryā sahitaḥ nayā
translated: Wearing bark garments and antelope skin, O king, together with this Gandhari.

original: tavāśiṣaḥ prayuñjāno bhaviṣyāmi vanecaraḥ
analyzed: tava āśiṣaḥ prayuñjānaḥ bhaviṣyāmi vanecaraḥ
translated: Wishing you well, I will wander in the forest.

original: ucitaṃ naḥ kule tāta sarveṣāṃ bharatarṣabha
analyzed: ucitam naḥ kule tāta sarveṣām bharata ṛṣabha
translated: O son, O bull among the Bharata lineage, this is proper for all of us in our family.

original: putreṣv aiśvaryam ādhāya vayaso 'nte vanaṃ nṛpa
analyzed: putreṣu aiśvaryam ādhāya vayasaḥ nte vanam nṛpa
translated: O king, having entrusted the kingdom to your sons, at the end of our lives, we will retire to the forest.

original: tatrāhaṃ vāyubhakṣo vā nirāhāro 'pi vā vasan
analyzed: tatra aham vāyubhakṣaḥ vā vasan
translated: There, O hero, living with this wife of mine, subsisting on air or even fasting,

original: patnyā sahānayā vīra cariṣyāmi tapaḥ param
analyzed: patnyā saha anayā vīra cariṣyāmi tapaḥ param
translated: I will practice the highest austerities.

original: tvaṃ cāpi phalabhāk tāta tapasaḥ pārthivo hy asi
analyzed: tvam ca api phala bhāj tāta tapasaḥ pārthivaḥ hi asi
translated: And you too, O son, will enjoy the fruits of austerities, for you are a king.

original: phalabhājo hi rājānaḥ kalyāṇasyetarasya vā
analyzed: phala bhājaḥ hi rājānaḥ kalyāṇasya itarasya vā
translated: For kings are the enjoyers of the fruits, good or bad, of their subjects' actions.

original: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ
analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: tarasā manasā dhyātvā gamanaṃ sa vanaṃ prati
analyzed: tarasā manasā dhyātvā gamanam sa vanam prati
translated: Having quickly thought in his mind about going to the forest,

original: tasya rājñas tadā rājā provācedaṃ vacaḥ śubham
analyzed: tasya rājñaḥ tadā rājā provāca idam vacaḥ śubham
translated: the king then spoke these auspicious words to that king:

original: yudhiṣṭhira uvāca
analyzed: yudhiṣṭhiraḥ uvāca
translated: Yudhishthira said:

original: na māṃ prīṇayate rājyaṃ tvayy evaṃ duḥkhite nṛpa
analyzed: na mām prīṇayate rājyam tvayi evam duḥkhite nṛpa
translated: O king, this kingdom does not please me when you are so unhappy.

original: dhiṅ mām astu sudurbuddhiṃ rājyasaktaṃ pramādinam🔽yo 'haṃ bhavantaṃ duḥkhārtam upavāsakṛśaṃ nṛpa
analyzed: dhik mām astu su durbuddhim rājya saktam pramādinam  yaḥ ham bhavantam duḥkha ārtam upavāsa kṛśam nṛpa
translated: Shame on me, a very foolish one attached to the kingdom and negligent,🔽who did not find you, O king, afflicted with grief, emaciated by fasting,

original: yatāhāraṃ kṣitiśayaṃ nāvindaṃ bhrātṛbhiḥ saha
analyzed: yata āhāram kṣiti śayam na avindam bhrātṛbhiḥ saha
translated: eating little, lying on the ground, along with my brothers.

original: aho 'smi vañcito mūḍho bhavatā gūḍhabuddhinā
analyzed: aho smi vañcitaḥ mūḍhaḥ bhavatā gūḍha buddhinā
translated: Alas, I am deceived, a fool, by you whose mind is hidden,

original: viśvāsayitvā pūrvaṃ māṃ yad idaṃ duḥkham aśnuthāḥ
analyzed: viśvāsayitvā pūrvam mām yat idam duḥkham aśnuthāḥ
translated: having first deceived me, that you are now experiencing this grief.

original: kiṃ me rājyena bhogair vā kiṃ yajñaiḥ kiṃ sukhena vā
analyzed: kim me rājyena bhogaiḥ vā kim yajñaiḥ kim sukhena vā
translated: What is my kingdom to me, or enjoyments, or sacrifices, or happiness,

original: yasya me tvaṃ mahīpāla duḥkhāny etāny avāptavān
analyzed: yasya me tvam mahīpāla duḥkhāni etāni avāptavān
translated: when I, O lord of the earth, have brought you to these sorrows?

original: pīḍitaṃ cāpi jānāmi rājyam ātmānam eva ca
analyzed: pīḍitam ca api jānāmi rājyam ātmānam eva ca
translated: And I know that the kingdom and myself are afflicted

original: anena vacasā tubhyaṃ duḥkhitasya janeśvara
analyzed: anena vacasā tubhyam duḥkhitasya janeśvara
translated: by these words of yours, O lord of people, who are unhappy.

original: bhavān pitā bhavān mātā bhavān naḥ paramo guruḥ
analyzed: bhavān pitā bhavān mātā bhavān naḥ paramaḥ guruḥ
translated: You are our father, you are our mother, you are our supreme guru,

original: bhavatā viprahīṇā hi kva nu tiṣṭhāmahe vayam
analyzed: bhavatā viprahīṇāḥ hi kva nu tiṣṭhāmahe vayam
translated: Separated from you, where will we stay?

original: auraso bhavataḥ putro yuyutsur nṛpasattama
analyzed: aurasaḥ bhavataḥ putraḥ yuyutsuḥ nṛpa sattama
translated: O best of kings, Yuyutsu is your son born of your loins.

original: astu rājā mahārāja yaṃ cānyaṃ manyate bhavān
analyzed: astu rājā mahā rāja yam ca anyam manyate bhavān
translated: Let him be the king, great king, or whoever else you think fit.

original: ahaṃ vanaṃ gamiṣyāmi bhavān rājyaṃ praśāstv idam
analyzed: aham vanam gamiṣyāmi bhavān rājyam praśāstu idam
translated: I will go to the forest, you rule this kingdom.

original: na mām ayaśasā dagdhaṃ bhūyas tvaṃ dagdhum arhasi
analyzed: na mām ayaśasā dagdham bhūyas tvam dagdhum arhasi
translated: You should not burn me again, already scorched by infamy.

original: nāhaṃ rājā bhavān rājā bhavatā paravān aham
analyzed: na aham rājā bhavān rājā bhavatā paravān aham
translated: I am not the king, you are the king, I am dependent on you.

original: kathaṃ guruṃ tvāṃ dharmajñam anujñātum ihotsahe
analyzed: katham gurum tvām dharma jñam anujñātum iha utsahe
translated: How can I dare to ask you, who know dharma, to give me permission?

original: na manyur hṛdi naḥ kaś cid duryodhanakṛte 'nagha
analyzed: na manyuḥ hṛdi naḥ kaḥ cit duryodhana kṛte nagha
translated: O sinless one, we do not have any anger in our hearts over what Duryodhana did.

original: bhavitavyaṃ tathā tad dhi vayaṃ te caiva mohitāḥ
analyzed: bhavitavyam tathā tat hi vayam te ca eva mohitāḥ
translated: That had to happen, we and they were all deluded.

original: vayaṃ hi putrā bhavato yathā duryodhanādayaḥ
analyzed: vayam hi putrāḥ bhavataḥ yathā duryodhana ādayaḥ
translated: We are your sons just as Duryodhana and the others are.

original: gāndhārī caiva kuntī ca nirviśeṣe mate mama
analyzed: gāndhārī ca eva kuntī ca nirviśeṣe mate mama
translated: Gandhari and Kunti are no different in my eyes.

original: sa māṃ tvaṃ yadi rājendra parityajya gamiṣyasi
analyzed: sa mām tvam yadi rāja indra parityajya gamiṣyasi
translated: O lord of kings, if you are going to abandon me and leave,

original: pṛṣṭhatas tvānuyāsyāmi satyenātmānam ālabhe
analyzed: pṛṣṭhatas tvā anuyāsyāmi satyena ātmānam ālabhe
translated: I will follow you, I swear this truthfully.

original: iyaṃ hi vasusaṃpūrṇā mahī sāgaramekhalā
analyzed: iyam hi vasu saṃpūrṇā mahī sāgara mekhalā
translated: This earth, full of wealth, with the ocean as its girdle,

original: bhavatā viprahīṇasya na me prītikarī bhavet
analyzed: bhavatā viprahīṇasya na me prīti karī bhavet
translated: will not bring me joy if I am separated from you.

original: bhavadīyam idaṃ sarvaṃ śirasā tvāṃ prasādaye
analyzed: bhavadīyam idam sarvam śirasā tvām prasādaye
translated: All this belongs to you. I bow my head to you and seek your favor.

original: tvadadhīnāḥ sma rājendra vyetu te mānaso jvaraḥ
analyzed: tvad adhīnāḥ sma rāja indra vyetu te mānasaḥ jvaraḥ
translated: We are under your control, O lord of kings. Let the fever in your mind be dispelled.

original: bhavitavyam anuprāptaṃ manye tvāṃ taj janādhipa
analyzed: bhavitavyam anuprāptam manye tvām tat janādhipa
translated: I think you have attained what was destined to happen, O lord of men.

original: diṣṭyā śuśrūṣamāṇas tvāṃ mokṣyāmi manaso jvaram
analyzed: diṣṭyā śuśrūṣamāṇaḥ tvām mokṣyāmi manasaḥ jvaram
translated: By good fortune, I will be able to serve you and remove the fever from your mind.

original: dhṛtarāṣṭra uvāca
analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ uvāca
translated: Dhritarashtra said:

original: tāpasye me manas tāta vartate kurunandana
analyzed: tāpasye me manaḥ tāta vartate kuru nandana
translated: O son, my mind is inclined towards asceticism, O descendant of Kuru.

original: ucitaṃ hi kule 'smākam araṇyagamanaṃ prabho
analyzed: ucitam hi kule smākam araṇya gamanam prabho
translated: O lord, it is proper for our family to go to the forest.

original: ciram asmy uṣitaḥ putra ciraṃ śuśrūṣitas tvayā
analyzed: ciram asmi uṣitaḥ putra ciram śuśrūṣitaḥ tvayā
translated: I have lived for a long time, O son, and have been served by you for a long time.

original: vṛddhaṃ mām abhyanujñātuṃ tvam arhasi janādhipa
analyzed: vṛddham mām abhyanujñātum tvam arhasi janādhipa
translated: You should grant permission to this old man, O lord of men.

original: vaiśaṃpāyana uvāca
analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: ity uktvā dharmarājānaṃ vepamānaḥ kṛtāñjalim
analyzed: iti uktvā dharmarājānam vepamānaḥ kṛta añjalim
translated: Having said this to Dharmaraja, who was trembling and had joined his palms,

original: uvāca vacanaṃ rājā dhṛtarāṣṭro 'mbikāsutaḥ
analyzed: uvāca vacanam rājā dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ mbikāsutaḥ
translated: King Dhritarashtra, the son of Ambika, spoke these words:

original: saṃjayaṃ ca mahāmātraṃ kṛpaṃ cāpi mahāratham
analyzed: saṃjayam ca mahāmātram kṛpam ca api mahā ratham
translated: I wish to request the great minister Sanjaya and the great warrior Kripa

original: anunetum ihecchāmi bhavadbhiḥ pṛthivīpatim
analyzed: anunetum iha icchāmi bhavadbhiḥ pṛthivīpatim
translated: to persuade the lord of the earth here.

original: glāyate me mano hīdaṃ mukhaṃ ca pariśuṣyati
analyzed: glāyate me manaḥ hi idam mukham ca pariśuṣyati
translated: My mind is distressed and my mouth is dry.

original: vayasā ca prakṛṣṭena vāgvyāyāmena caiva hi
analyzed: vayasā ca prakṛṣṭena vāc vyāyāmena ca eva hi
translated: And due to my advanced age and the exertion of speech,

original: ity uktvā sa tu dharmātmā vṛddho rājā kurūdvahaḥ
analyzed: iti uktvā sa tu dharma ātmā vṛddhaḥ rājā kuru udvahaḥ
translated: Having said this, the righteous king, the wise upholder of the Kuru lineage,

original: gāndhārīṃ śiśriye dhīmān sahasaiva gatāsuvat🔽taṃ tu dṛṣṭvā tathāsīnaṃ niśceṣṭaṃ kurupārthivam
analyzed: gāndhārīm śiśriye dhīmān sahasā eva gatāsu vat  tam tu dṛṣṭvā tathā āsīnam niśceṣṭam kuru pārthivam
translated: suddenly fell down dead, as if his life had departed, and clung to Gandhari.🔽Seeing the Kuru king sitting there motionless,

original: ārtiṃ rājā yayau tūrṇaṃ kaunteyaḥ paravīrahā
analyzed: ārtim rājā yayau tūrṇam kaunteyaḥ para vīra hā
translated: the king, the slayer of enemy heroes, the son of Kunti, quickly fell into despair.

original: yudhiṣṭhira uvāca
analyzed: yudhiṣṭhiraḥ uvāca
translated: Yudhishthira said:

original: yasya nāgasahasreṇa daśasaṃkhyena vai balam
analyzed: yasya nāga sahasreṇa daśa saṃkhyena vai balam
translated: He whose strength was equal to that of ten thousand elephants,

original: so 'yaṃ nārīm upāśritya śete rājā gatāsuvat🔽āyasī pratimā yena bhīmasenasya vai purā
analyzed: saḥ yam nārīm upāśritya śete rājā gatāsu vat  āyasī pratimā yena bhīmasenasya vai purā
translated: that king now lies dead, clinging to a woman.🔽The powerful one who reduced Bhimasena's iron image to dust in the past,

original: cūrṇīkṛtā balavatā sa balārthī śritaḥ striyam
analyzed: cūrṇīkṛtā balavatā sa bala arthī śritaḥ striyam
translated: he, seeking strength, now clings to a woman.

original: dhig astu mām adharmajñaṃ dhig buddhiṃ dhik ca me śrutam
analyzed: dhik astu mām a dharma jñam dhik buddhim dhik ca me śrutam
translated: Shame on me, who knows no dharma! Shame on my intelligence! Shame on my learning!

original: yatkṛte pṛthivīpālaḥ śete 'yam atathocitaḥ
analyzed: yad kṛte pṛthivīpālaḥ śete yam a tathā ucitaḥ
translated: For whose sake this lord of the earth lies here, undeserving of such treatment.

original: aham apy upavatsyāmi yathaivāyaṃ gurur mama
analyzed: aham api upavatsyāmi yathā eva ayam guruḥ mama
translated: I too will fast, just as my elder brother does,

original: yadi rājā na bhuṅkte 'yaṃ gāndhārī ca yaśasvinī
analyzed: yadi rājā na bhuṅkte yam gāndhārī ca yaśasvinī
translated: if the king will not eat, nor this illustrious Gandhari.

original: vaiśaṃpāyana uvāca🔽tato 'sya pāṇinā rājā jalaśītena pāṇḍavaḥ
analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca  tatas sya pāṇinā rājā jala śītena pāṇḍavaḥ
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: uro mukhaṃ ca śanakaiḥ paryamārjata dharmavit
analyzed: uraḥ mukham ca śanakais paryamārjata dharma vid
translated: Then the king, the son of Pandu, who knew dharma, gently wiped the chest and face of the king with his cold, watery hand.

original: tena ratnauṣadhimatā puṇyena ca sugandhinā
analyzed: tena ratna oṣadhimatā puṇyena ca sugandhinā
translated: By the touch of the king's hand, which was fragrant with auspicious herbs and jewels,

original: pāṇisparśena rājñas tu rājā saṃjñām avāpa ha
analyzed: pāṇi sparśena rājñaḥ tu rājā saṃjñām avāpa ha
translated: the king regained consciousness.

original: dhṛtarāṣṭra uvāca
analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ uvāca
translated: Dhritarashtra said:

original: spṛśa māṃ pāṇinā bhūyaḥ pariṣvaja ca pāṇḍava
analyzed: spṛśa mām pāṇinā bhūyas pariṣvaja ca pāṇḍava
translated: Touch me again with your hand and embrace me, Pandava.

original: uvāca rājadharmajño dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ śubhaṃ vacaḥ
analyzed: uvāca rāja dharma jñaḥ dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ śubham vacaḥ
translated: The one who knew the duties of kings, Dhritarashtra, spoke these auspicious words:

original: jīvāmīva hi saṃsparśāt tava rājīvalocana
analyzed: jīvāmi iva hi saṃsparśāt tava rājīva locana
translated: O lotus-eyed one, by your touch, I feel as if I am alive.

original: mūrdhānaṃ ca tavāghrātum icchāmi manujādhipa
analyzed: mūrdhānam ca tava āghrātum icchāmi manuja adhipa
translated: O lord of men, I wish to smell the crown of your head.

original: pāṇibhyāṃ ca parispraṣṭuṃ prāṇā hi na jahur mama
analyzed: pāṇibhyām ca parispraṣṭum prāṇāḥ hi na jahuḥ mama
translated: And to touch you with my hands, for my life has not left me.

original: aṣṭamo hy adya kālo 'yam āhārasya kṛtasya me
analyzed: aṣṭamaḥ hi adya kālaḥ yam āhārasya kṛtasya me
translated: This is the eighth hour since I ate,

original: yenāhaṃ kuruśārdūla na śaknomi viceṣṭitum
analyzed: yena aham kuru śārdūla na śaknomi viceṣṭitum
translated: by which, O tiger among the Kurus, I am unable to move.

original: vyāyāmaś cāyam atyarthaṃ kṛtas tvām abhiyācatā
analyzed: vyāyāmaḥ ca ayam atyartham kṛtaḥ tvām abhiyācatā
translated: And this exertion of supplicating you

original: tato glānamanās tāta naṣṭasaṃjña ivābhavam
analyzed: tatas glāna manāḥ tāta naṣṭa saṃjñaḥ iva abhavam
translated: has made me feel faint, as if I have lost consciousness.

original: tavāmṛtasamasparśaṃ hastasparśam imaṃ vibho
analyzed: tava amṛta sama sparśam hasta sparśam imam vibho
translated: O lord, having obtained this touch of your hand, which is like nectar,

original: labdhvā saṃjīvito 'smīti manye kurukulodvaha
analyzed: labdhvā saṃjīvitaḥ smi iti manye kuru kula udvaha
translated: I feel as if I have been revived, O perpetuator of the Kuru lineage.

original: vaiśaṃpāyana uvāca
analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: evam uktas tu kaunteyaḥ pitrā jyeṣṭhena bhārata
analyzed: evam uktaḥ tu kaunteyaḥ pitrā jyeṣṭhena bhārata
translated: Thus addressed by his elder father, O descendant of Bharata,

original: pasparśa sarvagātreṣu sauhārdāt taṃ śanais tadā
analyzed: pasparśa sarva gātreṣu sauhārdāt tam śanais tadā
translated: Out of affection, he slowly touched all his limbs.

original: upalabhya tataḥ prāṇān dhṛtarāṣṭro mahīpatiḥ
analyzed: upalabhya tatas prāṇān dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ mahīpatiḥ
translated: Then, regaining his senses, King Dhritarashtra

original: bāhubhyāṃ saṃpariṣvajya mūrdhny ājighrata pāṇḍavam
analyzed: bāhubhyām saṃpariṣvajya mūrdhni ājighrata pāṇḍavam
translated: embraced the Pāṇḍava with his arms and inhaled the fragrance of his head.

original: vidurādayaś ca te sarve rurudur duḥkhitā bhṛśam
analyzed: vidura ādayaḥ ca te sarve ruruduḥ duḥkhitāḥ bhṛśam
translated: Vidura and all the others, afflicted with grief, wept bitterly.

original: atiduḥkhāc ca rājānaṃ nocuḥ kiṃ cana pāṇḍavāḥ
analyzed: ati duḥkhāt ca rājānam na ūcuḥ kim cana pāṇḍavāḥ
translated: But the Pāṇḍavas, out of extreme sorrow, did not say anything to the king.

original: gāndhārī tv eva dharmajñā manasodvahatī bhṛśam
analyzed: gāndhārī tu eva dharma jñā manasā udvahatī bhṛśam
translated: Gandhāri alone, knowing dharma, deeply bearing it in her mind,

original: duḥkhāny avārayad rājan maivam ity eva cābravīt
analyzed: duḥkhāni avārayat rājan mā evam iti eva ca abravīt
translated: prevented the king from grieving, saying, Do not act like this.

original: itarās tu striyaḥ sarvāḥ kuntyā saha suduḥkhitāḥ
analyzed: itarāḥ tu striyaḥ sarvāḥ kuntyā saha su duḥkhitāḥ
translated: But all the other women, along with Kunti, were extremely sorrowful.

original: netrair āgatavikledaiḥ parivārya sthitābhavan
analyzed: netraiḥ āgata vikledaiḥ parivārya sthitāḥ abhavan
translated: They stood surrounding him, their eyes filled with distress.

original: athābravīt punar vākyaṃ dhṛtarāṣṭro yudhiṣṭhiram
analyzed: atha abravīt punar vākyam dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ yudhiṣṭhiram
translated: Then Dhritarashtra again spoke these words to Yudhishthira:

original: anujānīhi māṃ rājaṃs tāpasye bharatarṣabha
analyzed: anujānīhi mām rājan tāpasye bharata ṛṣabha
translated: O king, O bull among the Bharata lineage, give me permission to practice austerities.

original: glāyate me manas tāta bhūyo bhūyaḥ prajalpataḥ
analyzed: glāyate me manaḥ tāta bhūyas bhūyas prajalpataḥ
translated: My mind is weary, O son, from speaking again and again.

original: na mām ataḥ paraṃ putra parikleṣṭum ihārhasi
analyzed: na mām atas param putra parikleṣṭum iha arhasi
translated: You should not torment me any further, O son.

original: tasmiṃs tu kauravendre taṃ tathā bruvati pāṇḍavam
analyzed: tasmin tu kaurava indre tam tathā bruvati pāṇḍavam
translated: When the lord of the Kurus spoke thus to the Pāṇḍava,

original: sarveṣām avarodhānām ārtanādo mahān abhūt
analyzed: sarveṣām avarodhānām ārta nādaḥ mahān abhūt
translated: A great lamentation arose among all the kings

original: dṛṣṭvā kṛśaṃ vivarṇaṃ ca rājānam atathocitam
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā kṛśam vivarṇam ca rājānam a tathā ucitam
translated: Seeing the king emaciated, pale, and unlike himself,

original: upavāsapariśrāntaṃ tvagasthiparivāritam
analyzed: upavāsa pariśrāntam tvac asthi parivāritam
translated: Exhausted by fasting, surrounded by skin and bones

original: dharmaputraḥ sa pitaraṃ pariṣvajya mahābhujaḥ
analyzed: dharmaputraḥ sa pitaram pariṣvajya mahā bhujaḥ
translated: The mighty-armed son of Dharma embraced his father

original: śokajaṃ bāṣpam utsṛjya punar vacanam abravīt
analyzed: śoka jam bāṣpam utsṛjya punar vacanam abravīt
translated: And shedding tears born of sorrow, spoke these words again

original: na kāmaye naraśreṣṭha jīvitaṃ pṛthivīṃ tathā
analyzed: na kāmaye nara śreṣṭha jīvitam pṛthivīm tathā
translated: I do not desire life, O best of men, nor the earth,

original: yathā tava priyaṃ rājaṃś cikīrṣāmi paraṃtapa
analyzed: yathā tava priyam rājan cikīrṣāmi paraṃtapa
translated: As much as I wish to do what is pleasing to you, O king, O scorcher of enemies.

original: yadi tv aham anugrāhyo bhavato dayito 'pi vā
analyzed: yadi tu aham anugrāhyaḥ bhavataḥ vā
translated: If, however, I am to be favored by you, or if I am dear to you,

original: kriyatāṃ tāvad āhāras tato vetsyāmahe vayam
analyzed: kriyatām tāvat āhāraḥ tatas vetsyāmahe vayam
translated: Let food be taken first, then we shall know (what to do).

original: tato 'bravīn mahātejā dharmaputraṃ sa pārthivaḥ
analyzed: tatas bravīt mahā tejāḥ dharmaputram sa pārthivaḥ
translated: Then the greatly energetic king spoke to the son of Dharma

original: anujñātas tvayā putra bhuñjīyām iti kāmaye
analyzed: anujñātaḥ tvayā putra bhuñjīyām iti kāmaye
translated: With your permission, O son, I wish to eat.

original: iti bruvati rājendre dhṛtarāṣṭre yudhiṣṭhiram
analyzed: iti bruvati rāja indre dhṛtarāṣṭre yudhiṣṭhiram
translated: When Dhritarashtra, the lord of kings, was speaking to Yudhishthira

original: ṛṣiḥ satyavatīputro vyāso 'bhyetya vaco 'bravīt
analyzed: ṛṣiḥ satyavatī putraḥ vyāsaḥ abhyetya vacaḥ bravīt
translated: The sage Vyasa, the son of Satyavati, came and spoke these words

original: vyāsa uvāca🔽yudhiṣṭhira mahābāho yad āha kurunandanaḥ
analyzed: vyāsaḥ uvāca  yudhiṣṭhira mahā bāho yat āha kuru nandanaḥ
translated: Vyasa said

original: dhṛtarāṣṭro mahātmā tvāṃ tat kuruṣvāvicārayan
analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ mahātmā tvām tat kuruṣva a vicārayan
translated: O Yudhishthira of mighty arms, what the great-souled Dhritarashtra, the delighter of the Kurus, has said to you🔽Do that without hesitation.

original: ayaṃ hi vṛddho nṛpatir hataputro viśeṣataḥ
analyzed: ayam hi vṛddhaḥ nṛpatiḥ hata putraḥ viśeṣataḥ
translated: This aged king, especially with his sons slain,

original: nedaṃ kṛcchraṃ cirataraṃ sahed iti matir mama
analyzed: na idam kṛcchram cirataram sahet iti matiḥ mama
translated: will not be able to bear this calamity for long, that is my opinion.

original: gāndhārī ca mahābhāgā prājñā karuṇavedinī
analyzed: gāndhārī ca mahābhāgā prājñā karuṇa vedinī
translated: And the greatly fortunate Gandhari, wise and compassionate,

original: putraśokaṃ mahārāja dhairyeṇodvahate bhṛśam
analyzed: putra śokam mahā rāja dhairyeṇa udvahate bhṛśam
translated: bears the grief for her sons with fortitude, great king.

original: aham apy etad eva tvāṃ bravīmi kuru me vacaḥ
analyzed: aham api etat eva tvām bravīmi kuru me vacaḥ
translated: I too say this to you, do as I say.

original: anujñāṃ labhatāṃ rājā mā vṛtheha mariṣyati
analyzed: anujñām labhatām rājā mā vṛthā iha mariṣyati
translated: Let the king obtain permission, let him not die in vain here.

original: svastho bhavatv ayaṃ dhīmān vaneṣu madhugandhiṣu
analyzed: svasthaḥ bhavatu ayam dhīmān vaneṣu madhu gandhiṣu
translated: Let this wise one be at ease in the fragrant forests,

original: rājarṣīṇāṃ purāṇānām anuyātu gatiṃ nṛpaḥ
analyzed: rājarṣīṇām purāṇānām anuyātu gatim nṛpaḥ
translated: let the king follow the path of the ancient royal sages.

original: rājarṣīṇāṃ hi sarveṣām ante vanam upāśrayaḥ
analyzed: rājarṣīṇām hi sarveṣām ante vanam upāśrayaḥ
translated: For all royal sages in the end take to the forest,

original: vaiśaṃpāyana uvāca
analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: ity uktaḥ sa tadā rājā vyāsenādbhutakarmaṇā
analyzed: iti uktaḥ sa tadā rājā vyāsena adbhuta karmaṇā
translated: Thus addressed by Vyasa of wondrous deeds,

original: pratyuvāca mahātejā dharmarājo yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
analyzed: pratyuvāca mahā tejāḥ dharmarājaḥ yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
translated: the greatly radiant Dharmaraja Yudhishthira replied:

original: bhagavān eva no mānyo bhagavān eva no guruḥ
analyzed: bhagavān eva naḥ mānyaḥ bhagavān eva naḥ guruḥ
translated: The Blessed One is indeed to be honored by us, the Blessed One is indeed our teacher,

original: bhagavān asya rājyasya kulasya ca parāyaṇam
analyzed: bhagavān asya rājyasya kulasya ca parāyaṇam
translated: the Blessed One is the refuge of this kingdom and this dynasty.

original: ahaṃ tu putro bhagavān pitā rājā guruś ca me
analyzed: aham tu putraḥ bhagavān pitā rājā guruḥ ca me
translated: But I am the son, the Blessed One is the father, the king is my teacher,

original: nideśavartī ca pituḥ putro bhavati dharmataḥ
analyzed: nideśa vartī ca pituḥ putraḥ bhavati dharmataḥ
translated: and by dharma a son is subject to the commands of his father.

original: ity uktaḥ sa tu taṃ prāha vyāso dharmabhṛtāṃ varaḥ
analyzed: iti uktaḥ sa tu tam prāha vyāsaḥ dharma bhṛtām varaḥ
translated: Thus addressed, Vyasa, the best of the upholders of dharma,

original: yudhiṣṭhiraṃ mahātejāḥ punar eva viśāṃ pate
analyzed: yudhiṣṭhiram mahā tejāḥ punar eva viśām pate
translated: spoke again to Yudhishthira, O lord of the people, O king.

original: evam etan mahābāho yathā vadasi bhārata
analyzed: evam etat mahā bāho yathā vadasi bhārata
translated: Vyasa said, It is so, O mighty-armed one, as you say, O descendant of Bharata.

original: rājāyaṃ vṛddhatāṃ prāptaḥ pramāṇe parame sthitaḥ
analyzed: rājā ayam vṛddha tām prāptaḥ pramāṇe parame sthitaḥ
translated: This king has attained old age and is at the highest point of his life.

original: so 'yaṃ mayābhyanujñātas tvayā ca pṛthivīpate
analyzed: saḥ yam mayā abhyanujñātaḥ tvayā ca pṛthivīpate
translated: He has been permitted by me and by you, O lord of the earth.

original: karotu svam abhiprāyaṃ māsya vighnakaro bhava
analyzed: karotu svam abhiprāyam mā asya vighna karaḥ bhava
translated: Let him do what he desires. Do not be an obstacle to him.

original: eṣa eva paro dharmo rājarṣīṇāṃ yudhiṣṭhira
analyzed: eṣaḥ eva paraḥ dharmaḥ rājarṣīṇām yudhiṣṭhira
translated: This alone is the supreme dharma of the royal sages, O Yudhishthira.

original: samare vā bhaven mṛtyur vane vā vidhipūrvakam
analyzed: samare vā bhavet mṛtyuḥ vane vā vidhi pūrvakam
translated: Either death in battle or in the forest according to the rules.

original: pitrā tu tava rājendra pāṇḍunā pṛthivīkṣitā
analyzed: pitrā tu tava rāja indra pāṇḍunā pṛthivīkṣitā
translated: O lord of kings, by your father Pandu, the king of the earth,

original: śiṣyabhūtena rājāyaṃ guruvat paryupāsitaḥ
analyzed: śiṣya bhūtena rājā ayam guru vat paryupāsitaḥ
translated: this king was served by him as a teacher, though he was a disciple.

original: kratubhir dakṣiṇāvadbhir annaparvataśobhitaiḥ
analyzed: kratubhiḥ dakṣiṇāvadbhiḥ anna parvata śobhitaiḥ
translated: With sacrifices accompanied by gifts, adorned with mountains of food,

original: mahadbhir iṣṭaṃ bhogāś ca bhuktāḥ putrāś ca pālitāḥ
analyzed: mahadbhiḥ iṣṭam bhogāḥ ca bhuktāḥ putrāḥ ca pālitāḥ
translated: great sacrifices were performed, enjoyments were enjoyed, and sons were protected.

original: putrasaṃsthaṃ ca vipulaṃ rājyaṃ viproṣite tvayi
analyzed: putra saṃstham ca vipulam rājyam viproṣite tvayi
translated: And the vast kingdom was enjoyed by your sons while you were away.

original: trayodaśasamā bhuktaṃ dattaṃ ca vividhaṃ vasu
analyzed: trayodaśa samāḥ bhuktam dattam ca vividham vasu
translated: For thirteen years, wealth of various kinds was enjoyed and given.

original: tvayā cāyaṃ naravyāghra guruśuśrūṣayā nṛpaḥ
analyzed: tvayā ca ayam nara vyāghra guru śuśrūṣayā nṛpaḥ
translated: And by serving his elders, O tiger among men, this king

original: ārādhitaḥ sabhṛtyena gāndhārī ca yaśasvinī
analyzed: ārādhitaḥ sa bhṛtyena gāndhārī ca yaśasvinī
translated: and the illustrious Gandhari, along with her servants,

original: anujānīhi pitaraṃ samayo 'sya tapovidhau
analyzed: anujānīhi pitaram tapaḥ vidhau
translated: give permission to your father, it is time for him to practice austerities.

original: na manyur vidyate cāsya susūkṣmo 'pi yudhiṣṭhira
analyzed: na manyuḥ vidyate ca asya su sūkṣmaḥ yudhiṣṭhira
translated: And he has not the slightest trace of anger, O Yudhishthira.

original: etāvad uktvā vacanam anujñāpya ca pārthivam
analyzed: etāvat uktvā vacanam anujñāpya ca pārthivam
translated: Having spoken these words and obtained the king's permission,

original: tathāstv iti ca tenoktaḥ kaunteyena yayau vanam
analyzed: tathā astu iti ca tena uktaḥ kaunteyena yayau vanam
translated: and when the Kounteya said, So be it, he went to the forest.

original: gate bhagavati vyāse rājā pāṇḍusutas tataḥ
analyzed: gate bhagavati vyāse rājā pāṇḍu sutaḥ tatas
translated: When the Blessed Vyasa had departed, the king, Pandu's son,

original: provāca pitaraṃ vṛddhaṃ mandaṃ mandam ivānataḥ
analyzed: provāca pitaram vṛddham mandam mandam iva ānataḥ
translated: then spoke slowly and softly to his aged father, bowing down:

original: yad āha bhagavān vyāso yac cāpi bhavato matam
analyzed: yat āha bhagavān vyāsaḥ yat ca api bhavataḥ matam
translated: What the Blessed Vyasa has said and what you think,

original: yad āha ca maheṣvāsaḥ kṛpo vidura eva ca
analyzed: yat āha ca mahā iṣvāsaḥ kṛpaḥ viduraḥ eva ca
translated: and what the great archer Kripa and Vidura have said,

original: yuyutsuḥ saṃjayaś caiva tat kartāsmy aham añjasā
analyzed: yuyutsuḥ saṃjayaḥ ca eva tat kartāsmi aham añjasā
translated: and Yuyutsu and Sanjaya, I will quickly do.

original: sarve hy ete 'numānyā me kulasyāsya hitaiṣiṇaḥ
analyzed: sarve hi ete numānyāḥ me kulasya asya hita eṣiṇaḥ
translated: For all of them are to be respected by me, wishing for the welfare of this dynasty.

original: idaṃ tu yāce nṛpate tvām ahaṃ śirasā nataḥ
analyzed: idam tu yāce nṛpate tvām aham śirasā nataḥ
translated: But I beg this of you, O king, I bow my head to you:

original: kriyatāṃ tāvad āhāras tato gacchāśramaṃ prati
analyzed: kriyatām tāvat āhāraḥ tatas gaccha āśramam prati
translated: First eat, then go to the hermitage.

original: vaiśaṃpāyana uvāca
analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: tato rājñābhyanujñāto dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ pratāpavān
analyzed: tatas rājñā abhyanujñātaḥ dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ pratāpavān
translated: Then, permitted by the king, the powerful Dhritarashtra,

original: yayau svabhavanaṃ rājā gāndhāryānugatas tadā
analyzed: yayau sva bhavanam rājā gāndhāryā anugataḥ tadā
translated: the king went to his own abode, followed by Gandhari then.

original: mandaprāṇagatir dhīmān kṛcchrād iva samuddharan
analyzed: manda prāṇa gatiḥ dhīmān kṛcchrāt iva samuddharan
translated: The wise king, with slow and difficult steps, as if with difficulty raising himself,

original: padātiḥ sa mahīpālo jīrṇo gajapatir yathā
analyzed: padātiḥ sa mahīpālaḥ jīrṇaḥ gajapatiḥ yathā
translated: that king, on foot, like an aged lord of elephants.

original: tam anvagacchad viduro vidvān sūtaś ca saṃjayaḥ
analyzed: tam anvagacchat viduraḥ vidvān sūtaḥ ca saṃjayaḥ
translated: The learned Vidura followed him, and the charioteer Sanjaya,

original: sa cāpi parameṣvāsaḥ kṛpaḥ śāradvatas tathā
analyzed: sa ca api parama iṣvāsaḥ kṛpaḥ śāradvataḥ tathā
translated: and that great archer Kripa, the son of Sharādvat.

original: sa praviśya gṛhaṃ rājā kṛtapūrvāhṇikakriyaḥ
analyzed: sa praviśya gṛham rājā kṛta pūrvāhṇika kriyaḥ
translated: Having entered the house, the king, having performed his morning duties,

original: tarpayitvā dvijaśreṣṭhān āhāram akarot tadā
analyzed: tarpayitvā dvijaśreṣṭhān āhāram akarot tadā
translated: having satisfied the best of the twice-born, then took his meal.

original: gāndhārī caiva dharmajñā kuntyā saha manasvinī
analyzed: gāndhārī ca eva dharma jñā kuntyā saha manasvinī
translated: And the wise Gandhāri, knowledgeable in dharma, together with Kunti,

original: vadhūbhir upacāreṇa pūjitābhuṅkta bhārata
analyzed: vadhūbhiḥ upacāreṇa pūjitā abhuṅkta bhārata
translated: having been honored with service by her daughters-in-law, ate, O descendant of Bharata.

original: kṛtāhāraṃ kṛtāhārāḥ sarve te vidurādayaḥ
analyzed: kṛta āhāram kṛta āhārāḥ sarve te vidura ādayaḥ
translated: When they had finished their meals, all of them, Vidura and the others,

original: pāṇḍavāś ca kuruśreṣṭham upātiṣṭhanta taṃ nṛpam🔽tato 'bravīn mahārāja kuntīputram upahvare
analyzed: pāṇḍavāḥ ca kuru śreṣṭham upātiṣṭhanta tam nṛpam  tatas bravīt mahā rāja kuntī putram upahvare
translated: and the Pāṇḍavas, attended on that king, the best of the Kurus.🔽Then, O great king, the son of Ambikā, touching the back of Kunti's son with his hand,

original: niṣaṇṇaṃ pāṇinā pṛṣṭhe saṃspṛśann ambikāsutaḥ
analyzed: niṣaṇṇam pāṇinā pṛṣṭhe saṃspṛśan ambikāsutaḥ
translated: while he was seated on a couch, said:

original: apramādas tvayā kāryaḥ sarvathā kurunandana
analyzed: apramādaḥ tvayā kāryaḥ sarvathā kuru nandana
translated: You must be careful in every way, O descendant of Kuru.

original: aṣṭāṅge rājaśārdūla rājye dharmapuraskṛte
analyzed: aṣṭa aṅge rāja śārdūla rājye dharma puraskṛte
translated: In this eight-fold kingdom, O tiger among kings, where dharma is foremost,

original: tat tu śakyaṃ yathā tāta rakṣituṃ pāṇḍunandana
analyzed: tat tu śakyam yathā tāta rakṣitum pāṇḍu nandana
translated: That, O son, can be protected, O delighter of the Pandus,

original: rājyaṃ dharmaṃ ca kaunteya vidvān asi nibodha tat
analyzed: rājyam dharmam ca kaunteya vidvān asi nibodha tat
translated: O son of Kunti, you are wise. Listen to that.

original: vidyāvṛddhān sadaiva tvam upāsīthā yudhiṣṭhira
analyzed: vidyā vṛddhān sadā eva tvam upāsīthāḥ yudhiṣṭhira
translated: O Yudhishthira, you should always attend upon those who are wise and old.

original: śṛṇuyās te ca yad brūyuḥ kuryāś caivāvicārayan
analyzed: śṛṇuyāḥ te ca yat brūyuḥ kuryāḥ ca eva a vicārayan
translated: You should listen to what they say and do it without hesitation.

original: prātar utthāya tān rājan pūjayitvā yathāvidhi
analyzed: prātar utthāya tān rājan pūjayitvā yathāvidhi
translated: Rising in the morning, O king, having worshipped them according to the rules,

original: kṛtyakāle samutpanne pṛcchethāḥ kāryam ātmanaḥ
analyzed: kṛtya kāle samutpanne pṛcchethāḥ kāryam ātmanaḥ
translated: when the time for action has arrived, you should ask them about your duty.

original: te tu saṃmānitā rājaṃs tvayā rājyahitārthinā
analyzed: te tu saṃmānitāḥ rājan tvayā rājya hita arthinā
translated: Those who are honored by you, O king, desiring the welfare of the kingdom,

original: pravakṣyanti hitaṃ tāta sarvaṃ kauravanandana
analyzed: pravakṣyanti hitam tāta sarvam kaurava nandana
translated: will speak for your benefit, O son, O delighter of the Kurus.

original: indriyāṇi ca sarvāṇi vājivat paripālaya
analyzed: indriyāṇi ca sarvāṇi vāji vat paripālaya
translated: You should always protect all your senses like horses.

original: hitāya vai bhaviṣyanti rakṣitaṃ draviṇaṃ yathā
analyzed: hitāya vai bhaviṣyanti rakṣitam draviṇam yathā
translated: They will be for your welfare, like wealth that is protected.

original: amātyān upadhātītān pitṛpaitāmahāñ śucīn
analyzed: amātyān upadhā atītān pitṛpaitāmahām śucīn
translated: You should employ your principal ministers, who are beyond suspicion, who are pure, who are your father's and grandfather's,

original: dāntān karmasu sarveṣu mukhyān mukhyeṣu yojayeḥ
analyzed: dāntān karmasu sarveṣu mukhyān mukhyeṣu yojayeḥ
translated: who are self-controlled, in all your tasks, in the most important matters.

original: cārayethāś ca satataṃ cārair aviditaiḥ parān
analyzed: cārayethāḥ ca satatam cāraiḥ a viditaiḥ parān
translated: You should always have your enemies watched by unknown spies,

original: parīkṣitair bahuvidhaṃ svarāṣṭreṣu pareṣu ca
analyzed: parīkṣitaiḥ bahuvidham sva rāṣṭreṣu pareṣu ca
translated: thoroughly examined in various ways, in your own and others' kingdoms.

original: puraṃ ca te suguptaṃ syād dṛḍhaprākāratoraṇam
analyzed: puram ca te su guptam syāt dṛḍha prākāra toraṇam
translated: And your city should be well-guarded, with strong walls and gates,

original: aṭṭāṭṭālakasaṃbādhaṃ ṣaṭpathaṃ sarvatodiśam
analyzed: aṭṭa aṭṭālaka saṃbādham ṣaṣ patham sarvatodiśam
translated: crowded with towers and watchtowers, with six roads leading in all directions.

original: tasya dvārāṇi kāryāṇi paryāptāni bṛhanti ca
analyzed: tasya dvārāṇi kāryāṇi paryāptāni bṛhanti ca
translated: The gates should be made spacious and large,

original: sarvataḥ suvibhaktāni yantrair ārakṣitāni ca
analyzed: sarvatas su vibhaktāni yantraiḥ ārakṣitāni ca
translated: well-arranged on all sides, and guarded by machines.

original: puruṣair alam arthajñair viditaiḥ kulaśīlataḥ
analyzed: puruṣaiḥ alam artha jñaiḥ viditaiḥ kula śīlataḥ
translated: They should be well-known for their family and character,

original: ātmā ca rakṣyaḥ satataṃ bhojanādiṣu bhārata
analyzed: ātmā ca rakṣyaḥ satatam bhojana ādiṣu bhārata
translated: and one's own self should always be protected, O descendant of Bharata, in matters of food and so on.

original: vihārāhārakāleṣu mālyaśayyāsaneṣu ca
analyzed: vihāra āhāra kāleṣu mālya śayyā āsaneṣu ca
translated: In matters of recreation, food, garlands, beds and seats,

original: striyaś ca te suguptāḥ syur vṛddhair āptair adhiṣṭhitāḥ
analyzed: striyaḥ ca te su guptāḥ syuḥ vṛddhaiḥ āptaiḥ adhiṣṭhitāḥ
translated: and your women should be well-guarded, presided over by aged and trusted men.

original: śīlavadbhiḥ kulīnaiś ca vidvadbhiś ca yudhiṣṭhira
analyzed: śīlavadbhiḥ kulīnaiḥ ca vidvadbhiḥ ca yudhiṣṭhira
translated: O Yudhishthira, by those who are virtuous, of noble birth, and learned.

original: mantriṇaś caiva kurvīthā dvijān vidyāviśāradān
analyzed: mantriṇaḥ ca eva kurvīthāḥ dvijān vidyā viśāradān
translated: And you should appoint as ministers Brahmins who are skilled in learning,

original: vinītāṃś ca kulīnāṃś ca dharmārthakuśalān ṛjūn
analyzed: vinītān ca kulīnān ca dharma artha kuśalān ṛjūn
translated: humble, of noble birth, skilled in dharma and artha, and upright.

original: taiḥ sārdhaṃ mantrayethās tvaṃ nātyarthaṃ bahubhiḥ saha
analyzed: taiḥ sārdham mantrayethāḥ tvam na atyartham bahubhiḥ saha
translated: You should consult with them, not too much with many together,

original: samastair api ca vyastair vyapadeśena kena cit
analyzed: samastaiḥ api ca vyastaiḥ vyapadeśena kena cit
translated: but with all of them or some of them under some pretext.

original: susaṃvṛtaṃ mantragṛhaṃ sthalaṃ cāruhya mantrayeḥ
analyzed: su saṃvṛtam mantra gṛham sthalam ca āruhya mantrayeḥ
translated: You should ascend a well-guarded council chamber and consult there,

original: araṇye niḥśalāke vā na ca rātrau kathaṃ cana
analyzed: araṇye niḥśalāke vā na ca rātrau katham cana
translated: in a forest or a secluded place, but never at night.

original: vānarāḥ pakṣiṇaś caiva ye manuṣyānukāriṇaḥ
analyzed: vānarāḥ pakṣiṇaḥ ca eva ye manuṣya anukāriṇaḥ
translated: Monkeys, birds, and those who imitate human beings,

original: sarve mantragṛhe varjyā ye cāpi jaḍapaṅgukāḥ
analyzed: sarve mantra gṛhe varjyāḥ ye ca api jaḍa paṅgukāḥ
translated: All those who are in the mantra chamber should be avoided, as well as the dull and the lame.

original: mantrabhede hi ye doṣā bhavanti pṛthivīkṣitām
analyzed: mantra bhede hi ye doṣāḥ bhavanti pṛthivīkṣitām
translated: The faults that arise from the breach of counsel for the rulers of the earth

original: na te śakyāḥ samādhātuṃ kathaṃ cid iti me matiḥ
analyzed: na te śakyāḥ samādhātum katham cit iti me matiḥ
translated: cannot be remedied in any way, that is my opinion.

original: doṣāṃś ca mantrabhedeṣu brūyās tvaṃ mantrimaṇḍale
analyzed: doṣān ca mantra bhedeṣu brūyāḥ tvam mantri maṇḍale
translated: And you should speak of the faults in the breach of counsel in the circle of ministers,

original: abhede ca guṇān rājan punaḥ punar ariṃdama
analyzed: abhede ca guṇān rājan punar punar ariṃdama
translated: and of the virtues in the non-breach of counsel, O king, O chastiser of foes, again and again.

original: paurajānapadānāṃ ca śaucāśaucaṃ yudhiṣṭhira
analyzed: paura jānapadānām ca śauca āśaucam yudhiṣṭhira
translated: The purity and impurity of the citizens and country people, Yudhishthira,

original: yathā syād viditaṃ rājaṃs tathā kāryam ariṃdama
analyzed: yathā syāt viditam rājan tathā kāryam ariṃdama
translated: should be known, O king, and acted upon, O chastiser of foes, in that way.

original: dhṛtarāṣṭra uvāca🔽vyavahārāś ca te tāta nityam āptair adhiṣṭhitāḥ
analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ uvāca  vyavahārāḥ ca te tāta nityam āptaiḥ adhiṣṭhitāḥ
translated: Dhritarashtra said:🔽And your dealings, O son, should always be supervised by trusted men.

original: yojyās tuṣṭair hitai rājan nityaṃ cārair anuṣṭhitāḥ
analyzed: yojyāḥ tuṣṭaiḥ hitaiḥ rājan nityam cāraiḥ anuṣṭhitāḥ
translated: They should be employed, O king, by contented and beneficial spies who are always engaged.

original: alubdhaiś cāsya vyasanibhiḥ snigdhair ātmasamaiḥ sadā
analyzed: alubdhaiḥ ca asya vyasanibhiḥ snigdhaiḥ ātma samaiḥ sadā
translated: By those who are not greedy, who are not addicted to vices, who are affectionate and always equal to oneself.

original: parimāṇaṃ viditvā ca daṇḍaṃ daṇḍyeṣu bhārata
analyzed: parimāṇam viditvā ca daṇḍam daṇḍyeṣu bhārata
translated: And having ascertained the extent of punishment for those who deserve punishment, O Bharata,

original: praṇayeyur yathānyāyaṃ puruṣās te yudhiṣṭhira🔽ādānarucayaś caiva paradārābhimarśakāḥ
analyzed: praṇayeyuḥ yathānyāyam puruṣāḥ te yudhiṣṭhira  ādāna rucayaḥ ca eva para dāra abhimarśakāḥ
translated: those men should apply it in the proper manner, O Yudhishthira.🔽Those who delight in seizing, those who violate the wives of others,

original: ugradaṇḍapradhānāś ca mithyā vyāhāriṇas tathā
analyzed: ugra daṇḍa pradhānāḥ ca mithyā vyāhāriṇaḥ tathā
translated: those who are foremost in inflicting severe punishments, and those who speak falsely,

original: ākroṣṭāraś ca lubdhāś ca hantāraḥ sāhasapriyāḥ
analyzed: ākroṣṭāraḥ ca lubdhāḥ ca hantāraḥ sāhasa priyāḥ
translated: Those who revile, are greedy, kill, and delight in violence,

original: sabhāvihārabhettāro varṇānāṃ ca pradūṣakāḥ🔽hiraṇyadaṇḍyā vadhyāś ca kartavyā deśakālataḥ
analyzed: sabhā vihāra bhettāraḥ varṇānām ca pradūṣakāḥ  hiraṇya daṇḍyāḥ vadhyāḥ ca kartavyāḥ deśa kālataḥ
translated: Those who disrupt assemblies and leisure, and defile the castes,🔽Should be punished with a fine or death, according to the place and time.

original: avarodhabhūmau bhṛtyais tu saha pānaṃ vivarjayet🔽ākrośanty anumattās te kalatraṃ cāpi gṛhṇate
analyzed: avarodha bhūmau bhṛtyaiḥ tu saha pānam vivarjayet  ākrośanti anumattāḥ te kalatram ca api gṛhṇate
translated: But in the restricted area, one should avoid drinking with servants.🔽When intoxicated, they shout, take away the women,

original: jighāṃsanty api śastreṇa naṣṭāḥ krīḍanti cotkaṭāḥ
analyzed: jighāṃsanti api śastreṇa naṣṭāḥ krīḍanti ca utkaṭāḥ
translated: And even threaten with weapons, having lost their senses and become arrogant.

original: nānākṣepā vyāharanti gamyāgamyaṃ na jānate
analyzed: nānā ākṣepāḥ vyāharanti gamya agamyam na jānate
translated: They make various accusations and do not know what is proper and improper.

original: atipānena rājāpi sarvakośaṃ vināśayet
analyzed: atipānena rājā api sarva kośam vināśayet
translated: By excessive drinking, even a king can destroy the entire treasury.

original: vitared gāyakebhyaś ca pradhānadravyasaṃcayam🔽buddhvemān pānadoṣāṃs tu pibed ekaḥ svajāyayā
analyzed: vitaret gāyakebhyaḥ ca pradhāna dravya saṃcayam  buddhvā imān pāna doṣān tu pibet ekaḥ sva jāyayā
translated: And he would distribute the principal wealth to the singers.🔽Knowing these faults of drinking, one should drink alone with one's own wife.

original: yuktyā prakāśaṃ matimān svavīryasyābhivṛddhaye
analyzed: yuktyā prakāśam matimān sva vīryasya abhivṛddhaye
translated: The wise one should drink in public for the increase of his own strength, according to the rules.

original: prātar eva hi paśyethā ye kuryur vyayakarma te
analyzed: prātar eva hi paśyethāḥ ye kuryuḥ vyaya karma te
translated: In the morning itself, you should see those who do the expenditure work.

original: alaṃkāram atho bhojyam ata ūrdhvaṃ samācareḥ🔽paśyethāś ca tato yodhān sadā tvaṃ pariharṣayan
analyzed: alaṃkāram atho bhojyam atas ūrdhvam samācareḥ  paśyethāḥ ca tatas yodhān sadā tvam pariharṣayan
translated: Then you should do the decoration and food, and what follows after that.🔽And then you should always see the warriors, delighting them.

original: dūtānāṃ ca carāṇāṃ ca pradoṣas te sadā bhavet
analyzed: dūtānām ca carāṇām ca pradoṣaḥ te sadā bhavet
translated: And the evening should always be for you with the messengers and spies.

original: sadā cāpararātraṃ te bhavet kāryārthanirṇaye
analyzed: sadā ca apararātram te bhavet kārya artha nirṇaye
translated: And let the latter part of the night always be for you to decide on your duties.

original: madhyarātre vihāras te madhyāhne ca sadā bhavet
analyzed: madhyarātre vihāraḥ te madhyāhne ca sadā bhavet
translated: Your recreation should be at midnight and at midday always.

original: sarve tv ātyayikāḥ kālāḥ kāryāṇāṃ bharatarṣabha
analyzed: sarve tu ātyayikāḥ kālāḥ kāryāṇām bharata ṛṣabha
translated: But all times are proper for action, O best of the Bharatas.

original: tathaivālaṃkṛtaḥ kāle tiṣṭhethā bhūridakṣiṇaḥ
analyzed: tathā eva alaṃkṛtaḥ kāle tiṣṭhethāḥ bhūri dakṣiṇaḥ
translated: And thus adorned, you should stand at the proper time, O giver of abundant gifts.

original: na vṛthā vyavatiṣṭheta pārihāryādibhūṣaṇam
analyzed: na vṛthā vyavatiṣṭheta pārihārya ādi bhūṣaṇam
translated: The ornaments such as the Parihara should not be worn without purpose.

original: prayojyaṃ sarvadeveha māṅgalyaṃ pāpanāśanam
analyzed: prayojyam sarva deva iha māṅgalyam pāpa nāśanam
translated: In this world, all auspicious things that destroy sin should be used.

original: cakravat karmaṇāṃ tāta paryāyo hy eṣa nityaśaḥ
analyzed: cakra vat karmaṇām tāta paryāyaḥ hi eṣa nityaśas
translated: O son, this is the eternal cycle of actions, like a wheel.

original: kośasya saṃcaye yatnaṃ kurvīthā nyāyataḥ sadā
analyzed: kośasya saṃcaye yatnam kurvīthāḥ nyāyataḥ sadā
translated: You should always make efforts to accumulate your treasury righteously.

original: dvividhasya mahārāja viparītaṃ vivarjayeḥ
analyzed: dvividhasya mahā rāja viparītam vivarjayeḥ
translated: O great king, you should avoid the two kinds that are contrary to this.

original: cārair viditvā śatrūṃś ca ye te rājyāntarāyiṇaḥ
analyzed: cāraiḥ viditvā śatrūn ca ye te rājya antarāyiṇaḥ
translated: Having known your enemies through spies, those who obstruct your kingdom,

original: tān āptaiḥ puruṣair dūrād ghātayethāḥ parasparam
analyzed: tān āptaiḥ puruṣaiḥ dūrāt ghātayethāḥ parasparam
translated: you should have them killed by your trusted men from a distance, one against the other.

original: karmadṛṣṭyātha bhṛtyāṃs tvaṃ varayethāḥ kurūdvaha
analyzed: karma dṛṣṭyā atha bhṛtyān tvam varayethāḥ kuru udvaha
translated: O extender of the Kuru lineage, you should select your servants by examining their work.

original: kārayethāś ca karmāṇi yuktāyuktair adhiṣṭhitaiḥ🔽senāpraṇetā ca bhavet tava tāta dṛḍhavrataḥ
analyzed: kārayethāḥ ca karmāṇi yukta a yuktaiḥ adhiṣṭhitaiḥ  senā praṇetā ca bhavet tava tāta dṛḍha vrataḥ
translated: And you should have work done by those who are appointed to proper and improper tasks.🔽And let your general be one of firm vows, O son.

original: śūraḥ kleśasahaś caiva priyaś ca tava mānavaḥ
analyzed: śūraḥ kleśa sahaḥ ca eva priyaḥ ca tava mānavaḥ
translated: He should be brave, able to endure hardships, and dear to you, O man.

original: sarve jānapadāś caiva tava karmāṇi pāṇḍava
analyzed: sarve jānapadāḥ ca eva tava karmāṇi pāṇḍava
translated: All the citizens and the people of the countryside, O son of Pandu,

original: paurogavāś ca sabhyāś ca kuryur ye vyavahāriṇaḥ
analyzed: paurogavāḥ ca sabhyāḥ ca kuryuḥ ye vyavahāriṇaḥ
translated: the chief cooks, the members of the assembly, and those who conduct business,

original: svarandhraṃ pararandhraṃ ca sveṣu caiva pareṣu ca
analyzed: sva randhram para randhram ca sveṣu ca eva pareṣu ca
translated: your own weaknesses and those of your enemies, and those of your own and those of others,

original: upalakṣayitavyaṃ te nityam eva yudhiṣṭhira
analyzed: upalakṣayitavyam te nityam eva yudhiṣṭhira
translated: should always be observed by you, O Yudhishthira.

original: deśāntarasthāś ca narā vikrāntāḥ sarvakarmasu
analyzed: deśa antara sthāḥ ca narāḥ vikrāntāḥ sarva karmasu
translated: Men who are powerful in all actions, even if they are in other countries,

original: mātrābhir anurūpābhir anugrāhyā hitās tvayā
analyzed: mātrābhiḥ anurūpābhiḥ anugrāhyāḥ hitāḥ tvayā
translated: should be favored by you with appropriate measures.

original: guṇārthināṃ guṇaḥ kāryo viduṣāṃ te janādhipa
analyzed: guṇa arthinām guṇaḥ kāryaḥ viduṣām te janādhipa
translated: O lord of men, you should perform good deeds for those who seek good qualities.

original: avicālyāś ca te te syur yathā merur mahāgiriḥ
analyzed: a vicālyāḥ ca te te syuḥ yathā meruḥ mahā giriḥ
translated: They should be unshakable for you, like the great mountain Meru.

original: dhṛtarāṣṭra uvāca
analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ uvāca
translated: Dhritarashtra said:

original: maṇḍalāni ca budhyethāḥ pareṣām ātmanas tathā
analyzed: maṇḍalāni ca budhyethāḥ pareṣām ātmanaḥ tathā
translated: You should understand the circles of your enemies and of yourself,

original: udāsīnaguṇānāṃ ca madhyamānāṃ tathaiva ca
analyzed: udāsīna guṇānām ca madhyamānām tathā eva ca
translated: of the neutral qualities, and likewise of the middling ones.

original: caturṇāṃ śatrujātānāṃ sarveṣām ātatāyinām
analyzed: caturṇām śatru jātānām sarveṣām ātatāyinām
translated: Of the four kinds of enemies, all of whom are assassins,

original: mitraṃ cāmitramitraṃ ca boddhavyaṃ te 'rikarśana
analyzed: mitram ca amitra mitram ca boddhavyam te rikarśana
translated: you should know the friend and the friend of the enemy, O destroyer of enemies.

original: tathāmātyā janapadā durgāṇi viṣamāṇi ca
analyzed: tathā amātyāḥ janapadāḥ durgāṇi viṣamāṇi ca
translated: Likewise, the ministers, the people of the country, the forts, the difficult terrain,

original: balāni ca kuruśreṣṭha bhavanty eṣāṃ yathecchakam
analyzed: balāni ca kuruśreṣṭha bhavanti eṣām yathecchakam
translated: and the armies, O best of the Kurus, are as they wish.

original: te ca dvādaśa kaunteya rājñāṃ vai vividhātmakāḥ
analyzed: te ca dvādaśa kaunteya rājñām vai vividha ātmakāḥ
translated: And those twelve, O son of Kunti, are of various kinds for kings,

original: mantripradhānāś ca guṇāḥ ṣaṣṭir dvādaśa ca prabho
analyzed: mantri pradhānāḥ ca guṇāḥ ṣaṣṭiḥ dvādaśa ca prabho
translated: The chief ministers and the sixty-two qualities are the lords.

original: etan maṇḍalam ity āhur ācāryā nītikovidāḥ
analyzed: etat maṇḍalam iti āhuḥ ācāryāḥ nīti kovidāḥ
translated: The teachers who are skilled in policy call this the circle.

original: atra ṣāḍguṇyam āyattaṃ yudhiṣṭhira nibodha tat
analyzed: atra ṣāḍguṇyam āyattam yudhiṣṭhira nibodha tat
translated: Here, O Yudhishthira, the sixfold policy is based; understand that.

original: vṛddhikṣayau ca vijñeyau sthānaṃ ca kurunandana
analyzed: vṛddhi kṣayau ca vijñeyau sthānam ca kuru nandana
translated: And increase and decrease should be known, and stability, O descendant of Kuru.

original: dvisaptatyā mahābāho tataḥ ṣāḍguṇyacāriṇaḥ
analyzed: dvisaptatyā mahā bāho tatas ṣāḍguṇya cāriṇaḥ
translated: O mighty-armed one, with seventy-two, then those who practice the sixfold policy.

original: yadā svapakṣo balavān parapakṣas tathābalaḥ
analyzed: yadā sva pakṣaḥ balavān para pakṣaḥ tathā abalaḥ
translated: When one's own side is strong and the enemy's side is equally strong,

original: vigṛhya śatrūn kaunteya yāyāt kṣitipatis tadā
analyzed: vigṛhya śatrūn kaunteya yāyāt kṣitipatiḥ tadā
translated: then the king should go forth, O son of Kunti, having declared war on the enemy.

original: yadā svapakṣo 'balavāṃs tadā saṃdhiṃ samāśrayet
analyzed: yadā sva pakṣaḥ balavān tadā saṃdhim samāśrayet
translated: When one's own side is weak, then one should resort to peace.

original: svapakṣaś caiva durbalaḥ
analyzed: ca eva
translated: And one's own side is weak,

original: sārdhaṃ vidvāṃs tadā kṣīṇaḥ
analyzed: sārdham vidvān tadā kṣīṇaḥ
translated: then the wise one, being weak, should resort to peace.

original: dravyāṇāṃ saṃcayaś caiva kartavyaḥ syān mahāṃs tathā
analyzed: dravyāṇām saṃcayaḥ ca eva kartavyaḥ syāt mahān tathā
translated: And a great accumulation of wealth should be made.

original: yadā samartho yānāya nacireṇaiva bhārata
analyzed: yadā samarthaḥ yānāya nacireṇa eva bhārata
translated: When one is able to go forth, O Bharata, not in a long time,

original: tadā sarvaṃ vidheyaṃ syāt sthānaṃ ca na vibhājayet🔽bhūmir alpaphalā deyā viparītasya bhārata
analyzed: tadā sarvam vidheyam syāt sthānam ca na vibhājayet  bhūmiḥ alpa phalā deyā viparītasya bhārata
translated: then everything should be done, and one should not divide one's position.🔽Land with little fruit should be given, O Bharata, to the one who is the opposite.

original: hiraṇyaṃ kupyabhūyiṣṭhaṃ mitraṃ kṣīṇam akośavat
analyzed: hiraṇyam kupya bhūyiṣṭham mitram kṣīṇam a kośavat
translated: Gold with much wealth, a weak friend like one without a treasury.

original: viparītān na gṛhṇīyāt svayaṃ saṃdhiviśāradaḥ
analyzed: viparītān na gṛhṇīyāt svayam saṃdhi viśāradaḥ
translated: One who is skilled in making peace should not accept those who are adverse.

original: saṃdhyarthaṃ rājaputraṃ ca lipsethā bharatarṣabha
analyzed: saṃdhi artham rāja putram ca lipsethāḥ bharata ṛṣabha
translated: O best of the Bharata lineage! You should seek a prince for the sake of peace.

original: viparītas tu te 'deyaḥ putra kasyāṃ cid āpadi
analyzed: viparītaḥ tu te deyaḥ putra kasyām cit āpadi
translated: But one who is adverse should not be given to you in any calamity, O son.

original: tasya pramokṣe yatnaṃ ca kuryāḥ sopāyamantravit
analyzed: tasya pramokṣe yatnam ca kuryāḥ sa upāya mantra vid
translated: One who knows the means and mantras should make efforts to release him.

original: prakṛtīnāṃ ca kaunteya rājā dīnāṃ vibhāvayet
analyzed: prakṛtīnām ca kaunteya rājā dīnām vibhāvayet
translated: O Kounteya! The king should show compassion to the people.

original: krameṇa yugapad dvaṃdvaṃ vyasanānāṃ balābalam
analyzed: krameṇa yugapad dvaṃdvam vyasanānām balābalam
translated: In order, simultaneously, in pairs, the strength and weakness of vices,

original: pīḍanaṃ stambhanaṃ caiva kośabhaṅgas tathaiva ca
analyzed: pīḍanam stambhanam ca eva kośa bhaṅgaḥ tathā eva ca
translated: Oppression, paralysis, and also the breaking of the treasury,

original: kāryaṃ yatnena śatrūṇāṃ svarāṣṭraṃ rakṣatā svayam🔽na ca hiṃsyo 'bhyupagataḥ sāmanto vṛddhim icchatā
analyzed: kāryam yatnena śatrūṇām sva rāṣṭram rakṣatā svayam  na ca hiṃsyaḥ bhyupagataḥ sāmantaḥ vṛddhim icchatā
translated: Should be done with effort by one who protects his own kingdom from enemies.🔽One who desires prosperity should not harm a vassal who has submitted.

original: kaunteya taṃ na hiṃseta yo mahīṃ vijigīṣate
analyzed: kaunteya tam na hiṃseta yaḥ mahīm vijigīṣate
translated: O Kounteya! One who wishes to conquer the earth should not harm him.

original: gaṇānāṃ bhedane yogaṃ gacchethāḥ saha mantribhiḥ
analyzed: gaṇānām bhedane yogam gacchethāḥ saha mantribhiḥ
translated: You should go with your ministers to unite the groups.

original: sādhusaṃgrahaṇāc caiva pāpanigrahaṇāt tathā
analyzed: sādhu saṃgrahaṇāt ca eva pāpa nigrahaṇāt tathā
translated: And also by properly collecting the good and restraining the wicked,

original: durbalāś cāpi satataṃ nāvaṣṭabhyā balīyasā
analyzed: durbalāḥ ca api satatam na avaṣṭabhyāḥ balīyasā
translated: Even the weak should not always be oppressed by the strong.

original: tiṣṭhethā rājaśārdūla vaitasīṃ vṛttim āsthitaḥ
analyzed: tiṣṭhethāḥ rāja śārdūla vaitasīm vṛttim āsthitaḥ
translated: You should stand, O tiger among kings, adopting the conduct of the reed.

original: yady evam abhiyāyāc ca durbalaṃ balavān nṛpaḥ
analyzed: yadi evam abhiyāyāt ca durbalam balavān nṛpaḥ
translated: If a powerful king attacks a weak one,

original: sāmādibhir upāyais taṃ krameṇa vinivartayet
analyzed: sāma ādibhiḥ upāyaiḥ tam krameṇa vinivartayet
translated: he should try to turn him back gradually through conciliation and other means.

original: aśaknuvaṃs tu yuddhāya niṣpatet saha mantribhiḥ
analyzed: a śaknuvan tu yuddhāya niṣpatet saha mantribhiḥ
translated: But if he is unable to fight, he should flee with his ministers,

original: kośena paurair daṇḍena ye cānye priyakāriṇaḥ
analyzed: kośena pauraiḥ daṇḍena ye ca anye priya kāriṇaḥ
translated: his treasury, citizens, army, and others who are loyal to him.

original: asaṃbhave tu sarvasya yathāmukhyena niṣpatet
analyzed: asaṃbhave tu sarvasya yathāmukhyena niṣpatet
translated: If all this is not possible, he should flee with his principal men.

original: krameṇānena mokṣaḥ syāc charīram api kevalam
analyzed: krameṇa anena mokṣaḥ syāt śarīram api kevalam
translated: By this process, he may gain freedom, even if it is only of his body.

original: dhṛtarāṣṭra uvāca
analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ uvāca
translated: Dhritarashtra said:

original: saṃdhivigraham apy atra paśyethā rājasattama
analyzed: saṃdhi vigraham api atra paśyethāḥ rāja sattama
translated: O best of kings, you should also consider peace and war here,

original: dviyoniṃ trividhopāyaṃ bahukalpaṃ yudhiṣṭhira
analyzed: dvi yonim trividha upāyam bahu kalpam yudhiṣṭhira
translated: which have two sources, three means, and many alternatives, Yudhishthira.

original: rājendra paryupāsīthāś chittvā dvaividhyam ātmanaḥ
analyzed: rāja indra paryupāsīthāḥ chittvā dvaividhyam ātmanaḥ
translated: O lord of kings, you should attend to them after distinguishing between the two kinds of self.

original: tuṣṭapuṣṭabalaḥ śatrur ātmavān iti ca smaret
analyzed: tuṣṭa puṣṭa balaḥ śatruḥ ātmavān iti ca smaret
translated: You should remember that an enemy whose army is satisfied and strong is self-possessed.

original: paryupāsanakāle tu viparītaṃ vidhīyate
analyzed: paryupāsana kāle tu viparītam vidhīyate
translated: But at the time of attending to them, the opposite is prescribed.
