analyzed: bhīmasena arjunau ca eva nakulaḥ ca kuru udvaha  samādheyāḥ tvayā vīra tvayi adya kula dhūḥ gatā
translated: Bhimasena, Arjuna and Nakula, O upholder of the Kuru lineage,🔽should be comforted by you, O hero, for the burden of the family rests on you now.

original: śvaśrūśvaśurayoḥ pādāñ śuśrūṣantī vane tv aham
analyzed: śvaśrū śvaśurayoḥ pādām śuśrūṣantī vane tu aham
translated: I, serving the feet of my mother-in-law and father-in-law in the forest,

original: gāndhārīsahitā vatsye tāpasī malapaṅkinī
analyzed: gāndhārī sahitā vatsye tāpasī mala paṅkinī
translated: I will live with Gandhari, as an ascetic woman, covered in dirt and mud.

original: evam uktaḥ sa dharmātmā bhrātṛbhiḥ sahito vaśī
analyzed: evam uktaḥ sa dharma ātmā bhrātṛbhiḥ sahitaḥ vaśī
translated: Thus addressed, the self-controlled one, with dharma in his soul, together with his brothers,

original: viṣādam agamat tīvraṃ na ca kiṃ cid uvāca ha
analyzed: viṣādam agamat tīvram na ca kim cit uvāca ha
translated: became deeply distressed, but said nothing.

original: sa muhūrtam iva dhyātvā dharmaputro yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
analyzed: sa muhūrtam iva dhyātvā dharmaputraḥ yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
translated: Having meditated for a moment, Yudhishthira, the son of Dharma,

original: uvāca mātaraṃ dīnaś cintāśokaparāyaṇaḥ
analyzed: uvāca mātaram dīnaḥ cintā śoka parāyaṇaḥ
translated: spoke to his mother, dejected, overwhelmed by anxiety and sorrow:

original: kim idaṃ te vyavasitaṃ naivaṃ tvaṃ vaktum arhasi
analyzed: kim idam te vyavasitam na evam tvam vaktum arhasi
translated: What is this resolve of yours? You should not speak in this way.

original: na tvām abhyanujānāmi prasādaṃ kartum arhasi
analyzed: na tvām abhyanujānāmi prasādam kartum arhasi
translated: I do not approve of it. You should show favor.

original: vyarocayaḥ purā hy asmān utsāhya priyadarśane
analyzed: vyarocayaḥ purā hi asmān utsāhya priya darśane
translated: O one of beautiful appearance! You have previously encouraged us and approved of this.

original: vidurāyā vacobhis tvam asmān na tyaktum arhasi
analyzed: vidurāyāḥ vacobhiḥ tvam asmān na tyaktum arhasi
translated: You should not abandon us because of Vidura's words.

original: nihatya pṛthivīpālān rājyaṃ prāptam idaṃ mayā
analyzed: nihatya pṛthivīpālān rājyam prāptam idam mayā
translated: Having killed the lords of the earth, this kingdom has been obtained by me.

original: tava prajñām upaśrutya vāsudevān nararṣabhāt
analyzed: tava prajñām upaśrutya vāsudevāt nara ṛṣabhāt
translated: Having heard your wisdom from Vasudeva, the best of men,

original: kva sā buddhir iyaṃ cādya bhavatyā yā śrutā mayā
analyzed: kva sā buddhiḥ iyam ca adya bhavatyāḥ yā śrutā mayā
translated: where is that understanding of yours today, which I heard from you?

original: kṣatradharme sthitiṃ hy uktvā tasyāś calitum icchasi
analyzed: kṣatra dharme sthitim hi uktvā tasyāḥ calitum icchasi
translated: Having spoken of abiding by the dharma of kshatriyas, you wish to deviate from it.

original: asmān utsṛjya rājyaṃ ca snuṣāṃ cemāṃ yaśasvinīm
analyzed: asmān utsṛjya rājyam ca snuṣām ca imām yaśasvinīm
translated: Abandoning us, the kingdom, and this illustrious daughter-in-law,

original: kathaṃ vatsyasi śūnyeṣu vaneṣv amba prasīda me
analyzed: katham vatsyasi śūnyeṣu vaneṣu amba prasīda me
translated: how will you live in the empty forests, O mother? Be gracious to me.

original: iti bāṣpakalāṃ vācaṃ kuntī putrasya śṛṇvatī
analyzed: iti bāṣpa kalām vācam kuntī putrasya śṛṇvatī
translated: Hearing these words choked with tears of her son,

original: jagāmaivāśrupūrṇākṣī bhīmas tām idam abravīt
analyzed: jagāma eva aśru pūrṇa akṣī bhīmaḥ tām idam abravīt
translated: Kunti went away with eyes full of tears. Bhima said to her:

original: yadā rājyam idaṃ kunti bhoktavyaṃ putranirjitam
analyzed: yadā rājyam idam kunti bhoktavyam putra nirjitam
translated: When this kingdom, O Kunti, is to be enjoyed by your sons after conquering it,

original: prāptavyā rājadharmāś ca tadeyaṃ te kuto matiḥ
analyzed: prāptavyāḥ rāja dharmāḥ ca tadā iyam te kutas matiḥ
translated: and when the duties of a king are to be performed, then why do you have this idea?

original: kiṃ vayaṃ kāritāḥ pūrvaṃ bhavatyā pṛthivīkṣayam🔽kasya hetoḥ parityajya vanaṃ gantum abhīpsasi
analyzed: kim vayam kāritāḥ pūrvam bhavatyā pṛthivī kṣayam  kasya hetoḥ parityajya vanam gantum abhīpsasi
translated: Why were we formerly made by you to destroy the earth?🔽For whose sake do you wish to go to the forest, abandoning us?

original: vanāc cāpi kim ānītā bhavatyā bālakā vayam
analyzed: vanāt ca api kim ānītāḥ bhavatyā bālakāḥ vayam
translated: And why were we, the sons, brought from the forest by you?

original: duḥkhaśokasamāviṣṭau mādrīputrāv imau tathā
analyzed: duḥkha śoka samāviṣṭau mādrī putrau imau tathā
translated: And these two sons of Madri are full of sorrow and grief.

original: prasīda mātar mā gās tvaṃ vanam adya yaśasvini
analyzed: prasīda mātar mā gāḥ tvam vanam adya yaśasvini
translated: Be gracious, O mother, do not go to the forest today, O illustrious one.

original: śriyaṃ yaudhiṣṭhirīṃ tāvad bhuṅkṣva pārthabalārjitām
analyzed: śriyam yaudhiṣṭhirīm tāvat bhuṅkṣva pārtha bala arjitām
translated: Enjoy for the present the prosperity earned by the strength of the sons of Pritha.

original: iti sā niścitaivātha vanavāsakṛtakṣaṇā
analyzed: iti sā niścitā eva atha vana vāsa kṛtakṣaṇā
translated: Thus she, who had made up her mind to go to the forest,

original: lālapyatāṃ bahuvidhaṃ putrāṇāṃ nākarod vacaḥ🔽draupadī cānvayāc chvaśrūṃ viṣaṇṇavadanā tadā
analyzed: lālapyatām bahuvidham putrāṇām na akarot vacaḥ  draupadī ca anvayāt śvaśrūm viṣaṇṇa vadanā tadā
translated: though they lamented in various ways, did not pay heed to the words of her sons.🔽Draupadi also followed her mother-in-law, with a sorrowful face,

original: vanavāsāya gacchantīṃ rudatī bhadrayā saha
analyzed: vana vāsāya gacchantīm rudatī bhadrayā saha
translated: weeping along with Bhadra, as she was going to the forest.

original: sā putrān rudataḥ sarvān muhur muhur avekṣatī
analyzed: sā putrān rudataḥ sarvān muhur muhur avekṣatī
translated: She, looking again and again at all her weeping sons,

original: jagāmaiva mahāprājñā vanāya kṛtaniścayā
analyzed: jagāma eva mahā prājñā vanāya kṛta niścayā
translated: The greatly wise one, having made up her mind, went to the forest.

original: anvayuḥ pāṇḍavās tāṃ tu sabhṛtyāntaḥpurās tadā
analyzed: anvayuḥ pāṇḍavāḥ tām tu sa bhṛtya antaḥpurāḥ tadā
translated: The Pandavas, with their servants and women, followed her.

original: tataḥ pramṛjya sāśrūṇi putrān vacanam abravīt
analyzed: tatas pramṛjya sa aśrūṇi putrān vacanam abravīt
translated: Then, wiping away her tears, she spoke to her sons:

original: kunty uvāca
analyzed: kuntī uvāca
translated: Kunti said:

original: evam etan mahābāho yathā vadasi pāṇḍava
analyzed: evam etat mahā bāho yathā vadasi pāṇḍava
translated: O mighty-armed one, O Pandava, it is as you say.

original: kṛtam uddharṣaṇaṃ pūrvaṃ mayā vaḥ sīdatāṃ nṛpa
analyzed: kṛtam uddharṣaṇam pūrvam mayā vaḥ sīdatām nṛpa
translated: O king, I have already cheered you who were sinking down.

original: dyūtāpahṛtarājyānāṃ patitānāṃ sukhād api
analyzed: dyūta apahṛta rājyānām patitānām sukhāt api
translated: Your kingdoms were taken away through gambling, you fell from happiness,

original: jñātibhiḥ paribhūtānāṃ kṛtam uddharṣaṇaṃ mayā
analyzed: jñātibhiḥ paribhūtānām kṛtam uddharṣaṇam mayā
translated: and you were humiliated by your relatives - I have already cheered you.

original: kathaṃ pāṇḍor na naśyeta saṃtatiḥ puruṣarṣabhāḥ
analyzed: katham pāṇḍoḥ na naśyeta saṃtatiḥ puruṣa ṛṣabhāḥ
translated: O best of men, how can the lineage of Pandu not be destroyed?

original: yaśaś ca vo na naśyeta iti coddharṣaṇaṃ kṛtam
analyzed: yaśaḥ ca vaḥ na naśyeta iti ca uddharṣaṇam kṛtam
translated: And how can your fame not be destroyed - thus I have cheered you.

original: yūyam indrasamāḥ sarve devatulyaparākramāḥ
analyzed: yūyam indra samāḥ sarve deva tulya parākramāḥ
translated: All of you are like Indra, with valor equal to the gods.

original: mā pareṣāṃ mukhaprekṣāḥ sthety evaṃ tat kṛtaṃ mayā
analyzed: mā pareṣām mukha prekṣāḥ stha iti evam tat kṛtam mayā
translated: Do not look to the faces of others - thus it was done by me.

original: kathaṃ dharmabhṛtāṃ śreṣṭho rājā tvaṃ vāsavopamaḥ
analyzed: katham dharma bhṛtām śreṣṭhaḥ rājā tvam vāsava upamaḥ
translated: How can you, the best among the upholders of dharma, the king equal to Vasava,

original: punar vane na duḥkhī syā iti coddharṣaṇaṃ kṛtam
analyzed: punar vane na duḥkhī syāḥ iti ca uddharṣaṇam kṛtam
translated: not suffer again in the forest - thus I have cheered you.

original: nāgāyutasamaprāṇaḥ khyātavikramapauruṣaḥ
translated: Having the strength of ten thousand elephants, renowned for your valor and manliness,

original: nāyaṃ bhīmo 'tyayaṃ gacched iti coddharṣaṇaṃ kṛtam
analyzed: na ayam gacchet iti ca uddharṣaṇam kṛtam
translated: how can this Bhima not be overwhelmed - thus I have cheered you.

original: bhīmasenād avarajas tathāyaṃ vāsavopamaḥ
analyzed: bhīmasenāt avarajaḥ tathā ayam vāsava upamaḥ
translated: And this one, who is younger than Bhimasena and is like Indra,

original: vijayo nāvasīdeta iti coddharṣaṇaṃ kṛtam
analyzed: vijayaḥ na avasīdeta iti ca uddharṣaṇam kṛtam
translated: Was encouraged so that Vijaya would not be discouraged.

original: nakulaḥ sahadevaś ca tathemau guruvartinau
analyzed: nakulaḥ sahadevaḥ ca tathā imau guru vartinau
translated: And Nakula and Sahadeva, who are devoted to their elders,

original: kṣudhā kathaṃ na sīdetām iti coddharṣaṇaṃ kṛtam
analyzed: kṣudhā katham na sīdetām iti ca uddharṣaṇam kṛtam
translated: Were encouraged so that they would not be overcome by hunger.

original: iyaṃ ca bṛhatī śyāmā śrīmaty āyatalocanā
analyzed: iyam ca bṛhatī śyāmā śrīmatī āyata locanā
translated: And this tall, dark, beautiful, large-eyed one,

original: vṛthā sabhātale kliṣṭā mā bhūd iti ca tat kṛtam
analyzed: vṛthā sabhā tale kliṣṭāḥ mā bhūt iti ca tat kṛtam
translated: Was treated so that she would not be needlessly afflicted in the assembly hall.

original: prekṣantyā me tadā hīmāṃ vepantīṃ kadalīm iva
analyzed: prekṣantyāḥ me tadā hi imām vepantīm kadalīm iva
translated: When I saw her trembling like a plantain tree,

original: strīdharmiṇīm anindyāṅgīṃ tathā dyūtaparājitām
analyzed: strī dharmiṇīm anindya aṅgīm tathā dyūta parājitām
translated: That virtuous woman with a blameless body, thus defeated at gambling,

original: duḥśāsano yadā mauḍhyād dāsīvat paryakarṣata
analyzed: duḥśāsanaḥ yadā mauḍhyāt dāsī vat paryakarṣata
translated: When Duhshasana, out of folly, dragged her like a slave,

original: tadaiva viditaṃ mahyaṃ parābhūtam idaṃ kulam
analyzed: tadā eva viditam mahyam parābhūtam idam kulam
translated: Then I knew that this family had been defeated.

original: viṣaṇṇāḥ kuravaś caiva tadā me śvaśurādayaḥ
analyzed: viṣaṇṇāḥ kuravaḥ ca eva tadā me śvaśura ādayaḥ
translated: The Kurus, my fathers-in-law and others, were also distressed,

original: yadaiṣā nātham icchantī vyalapat kurarī yathā🔽keśapakṣe parāmṛṣṭā pāpena hatabuddhinā
analyzed: yadā eṣā nātham icchantī vyalapat kurarī yathā  keśa pakṣe parāmṛṣṭā pāpena hatabuddhinā
translated: When she, desiring a protector, lamented like a female osprey.🔽When she was seized by the hair by that sinful one of destroyed intellect,

original: yadā duḥśāsanenaiṣā tadā muhyāmy ahaṃ nṛpa
analyzed: yadā duḥśāsanena eṣā tadā muhyāmi aham nṛpa
translated: By Duhshasana, then I became confused, O king.

original: yuṣmattejovivṛddhyarthaṃ mayā hy uddharṣaṇaṃ kṛtam
analyzed: yuṣmad tejaḥ vivṛddhi artham mayā hi uddharṣaṇam kṛtam
translated: I encouraged her for the sake of increasing your energy.

original: tadānīṃ vidurāvākyair iti tad vitta putrakāḥ
analyzed: tadānīm vidura a vākyaiḥ iti tat vitta putrakāḥ
translated: Then, O sons, you know what happened by Vidura's words.

original: kathaṃ na rājavaṃśo 'yaṃ naśyet prāpya sutān mama
analyzed: katham na rāja vaṃśaḥ yam naśyet prāpya sutān mama
translated: How can this royal lineage not be destroyed, having obtained my sons?

original: pāṇḍor iti mayā putra tasmād uddharṣaṇaṃ kṛtam
analyzed: pāṇḍoḥ iti mayā putra tasmāt uddharṣaṇam kṛtam
translated: O son, therefore, I was delighted, thinking, 'Pandu's sons will be born in my womb.'

original: na tasya putraḥ pautrau vā kuta eva sa pārthiva
analyzed: na tasya putraḥ pautrau vā kutas eva sa pārthiva
translated: For he who destroys a family has no son, no grandson, and how can that king

original: labhate sukṛtāṃl lokān yasmād vaṃśaḥ praṇaśyati
analyzed: labhate su kṛtān lokān yasmāt vaṃśaḥ praṇaśyati
translated: attain the worlds of the virtuous, since the family is destroyed by him?

original: bhuktaṃ rājyaphalaṃ putrā bhartur me vipulaṃ purā
analyzed: bhuktam rājya phalam putrāḥ bhartuḥ me vipulam purā
translated: O sons, I have enjoyed the fruits of the kingdom, my husband's vast wealth,

original: mahādānāni dattāni pītaḥ somo yathāvidhi
analyzed: mahā dānāni dattāni pītaḥ somaḥ yathāvidhi
translated: great gifts have been given, soma has been drunk according to the rules.

original: sāhaṃ nātmaphalārthaṃ vai vāsudevam acūcudam
analyzed: sā aham na ātma phala artham vai vāsudevam acūcudam
translated: I did not urge Vasudeva for my own benefit,

original: vidurāyāḥ pralāpais taiḥ plāvanārthaṃ tu tat kṛtam
analyzed: vidurāyāḥ pralāpaiḥ taiḥ plāvana artham tu tat kṛtam
translated: but that was done by me for the sake of drowning them with Vidura's lamentations.

original: nāhaṃ rājyaphalaṃ putra kāmaye putranirjitam
analyzed: na aham rājya phalam putra kāmaye putra nirjitam
translated: O son, I do not desire the fruits of the kingdom conquered by my sons.

original: patilokān ahaṃ puṇyān kāmaye tapasā vibho
analyzed: pati lokān aham puṇyān kāmaye tapasā vibho
translated: O lord, I desire the meritorious worlds of my husband by austerities.

original: śvaśrūśvaśurayoḥ kṛtvā śuśrūṣāṃ vanavāsinoḥ
analyzed: śvaśrū śvaśurayoḥ kṛtvā śuśrūṣām vana vāsinoḥ
translated: Having served my mother-in-law and father-in-law, who live in the forest,

original: tapasā śoṣayiṣyāmi yudhiṣṭhira kalevaram
analyzed: tapasā śoṣayiṣyāmi yudhiṣṭhira kalevaram
translated: I will dry up my body by austerities, Yudhishthira.

original: nivartasva kuruśreṣṭha bhīmasenādibhiḥ saha
analyzed: nivartasva kuruśreṣṭha bhīmasena ādibhiḥ saha
translated: Return, O best of the Kurus, with Bhimasena and others.

original: dharme te dhīyatāṃ buddhir manas te mahad astu ca
analyzed: dharme te dhīyatām buddhiḥ manaḥ te mahat astu ca
translated: Let your mind be set on dharma, and let your heart be great.

original: vaiśaṃpāyana uvāca
analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: kuntyās tu vacanaṃ śrutvā pāṇḍavā rājasattama
analyzed: kuntyāḥ tu vacanam śrutvā pāṇḍavāḥ rāja sattama
translated: O best of kings, having heard Kunti's words,

original: vrīḍitāḥ saṃnyavartanta pāñcālyā sahitānaghāḥ
analyzed: vrīḍitāḥ saṃnyavartanta pāñcālyā sahita anaghāḥ
translated: the Pandavas, sinless ones, ashamed, turned back together with Panchali.

original: tataḥ śabdo mahān āsīt sarveṣām eva bhārata
analyzed: tatas śabdaḥ mahān āsīt sarveṣām eva bhārata
translated: Then there was a great sound of all,

original: antaḥpurāṇāṃ rudatāṃ dṛṣṭvā kuntīṃ tathāgatām
analyzed: antaḥpurāṇām rudatām dṛṣṭvā kuntīm tathāgatām
translated: of the women of the inner apartments, weeping, seeing Kunti in that state.

original: pradakṣiṇam athāvṛtya rājānaṃ pāṇḍavās tadā
analyzed: pradakṣiṇam atha āvṛtya rājānam pāṇḍavāḥ tadā
translated: Then the Pandavas, having circumambulated the king,

original: abhivādya nyavartanta pṛthāṃ tām anivartya vai
analyzed: abhivādya nyavartanta pṛthām tām a nivartya vai
translated: having saluted him, turned back, not being able to dissuade Pritha.

original: tato 'bravīn mahārājo dhṛtarāṣṭro 'mbikāsutaḥ
analyzed: tatas bravīt mahā rājaḥ dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ mbikāsutaḥ
translated: Then the great king Dhritarashtra, the son of Ambika,

original: gāndhārīṃ viduraṃ caiva samābhāṣya nigṛhya ca
analyzed: gāndhārīm viduram ca eva samābhāṣya nigṛhya ca
translated: having addressed Gandhari and Vidura, restraining them,

original: yudhiṣṭhirasya jananī devī sādhu nivartyatām
analyzed: yudhiṣṭhirasya jananī devī sādhu nivartyatām
translated: said: Let the queen, the mother of Yudhishthira, be well turned back.

original: yathā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ prāha tat sarvaṃ satyam eva hi
analyzed: yathā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ prāha tat sarvam satyam eva hi
translated: All that Yudhishthira said is indeed true.

original: putraiśvaryaṃ mahad idam apāsya ca mahāphalam
analyzed: putra aiśvaryam mahat idam apāsya ca mahā phalam
translated: Having abandoned this great prosperity of sons, this great fruit,

original: kā nu gacched vanaṃ durgaṃ putrān utsṛjya mūḍhavat
analyzed: kā nu gacchet vanam durgam putrān utsṛjya mūḍha vat
translated: which foolish woman would go to the impassable forest, abandoning her sons?

original: rājyasthayā tapas taptaṃ dānaṃ dattaṃ vrataṃ kṛtam
analyzed: rājya sthayā tapaḥ taptam dānam dattam vratam kṛtam
translated: Penance has been performed, charity has been given, vows have been observed by her while ruling the kingdom.

original: anayā śakyam adyeha śrūyatāṃ ca vaco mama
analyzed: anayā śakyam adyā iha śrūyatām ca vacaḥ mama
translated: By her it is possible to hear now my words here.

original: gāndhāri parituṣṭo 'smi vadhvāḥ śuśrūṣaṇena vai
analyzed: gāndhāri parituṣṭaḥ smi vadhvāḥ śuśrūṣaṇena vai
translated: O Gandhari, I am satisfied with the service of my daughter-in-law.

original: tasmāt tvam enāṃ dharmajñe samanujñātum arhasi
analyzed: tasmāt tvam enām dharma jñe samanujñātum arhasi
translated: Therefore, O you who know dharma, it is proper for you to give your permission to her.

original: ity uktā saubaleyī tu rājñā kuntīm uvāca ha
analyzed: iti uktā saubaleyī tu rājñā kuntīm uvāca ha
translated: Thus addressed, the daughter of Subala spoke to Kunti,

original: tat sarvaṃ rājavacanaṃ svaṃ ca vākyaṃ viśeṣavat
analyzed: tat sarvam rāja vacanam svam ca vākyam viśeṣavat
translated: all those words of the king and her own words in particular.

original: na ca sā vanavāsāya devīṃ kṛtamatiṃ tadā
analyzed: na ca sā vana vāsāya devīm kṛtamatim tadā
translated: And she was not able to turn back the queen who had made up her mind to live in the forest,

original: śaknoty upāvartayituṃ kuntīṃ dharmaparāṃ satīm
analyzed: śaknoti upāvartayitum kuntīm dharma parām satīm
translated: Kunti, who was devoted to dharma and was a chaste woman.

original: tasyās tu taṃ sthiraṃ jñātvā vyavasāyaṃ kurustriyaḥ
analyzed: tasyāḥ tu tam sthiram jñātvā vyavasāyam kuru striyaḥ
translated: But knowing her firm resolve, the Kuru women,

original: nivṛttāṃś ca kuruśreṣṭhān dṛṣṭvā prarurudus tadā
analyzed: nivṛttān ca kuru śreṣṭhān dṛṣṭvā praruruduḥ tadā
translated: and seeing that the best of the Kurus had turned back, wept then.

original: upāvṛtteṣu pārtheṣu sarveṣv antaḥpureṣu ca
analyzed: upāvṛtteṣu pārtheṣu sarveṣu antaḥpureṣu ca
translated: When all the Parthas and the women of the inner quarters had returned,

original: yayau rājā mahāprājño dhṛtarāṣṭro vanaṃ tadā
analyzed: yayau rājā mahā prājñaḥ dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ vanam tadā
translated: the greatly wise king Dhritarashtra went to the forest then.

original: pāṇḍavā api dīnās te duḥkhaśokaparāyaṇāḥ
analyzed: pāṇḍavāḥ api dīnāḥ te duḥkha śoka parāyaṇāḥ
translated: The Pandavas, who were miserable and overcome by grief and sorrow,

original: yānaiḥ strīsahitāḥ sarve puraṃ praviviśus tadā🔽tad ahṛṣṭam ivākūjaṃ gatotsavam ivābhavat
analyzed: yānaiḥ strī sahitāḥ sarve puram praviviśuḥ tadā  tat a hṛṣṭam iva a kūjam gata utsavam iva abhavat
translated: all entered the city with their wives in their vehicles then.

original: nagaraṃ hāstinapuraṃ sastrīvṛddhakumārakam
analyzed: nagaram hāstinapuram sa strī vṛddha kumārakam
translated: The city of Hastinapura, with its women, elders and young boys,🔽became as if cheerless, without any sound, as if a festival had passed.

original: sarve cāsan nirutsāhāḥ pāṇḍavā jātamanyavaḥ
analyzed: sarve ca āsan nirutsāhāḥ pāṇḍavāḥ jāta manyavaḥ
translated: And all the Pandavas, who had become angry, were dispirited.

original: kuntyā hīnāḥ suduḥkhārtā vatsā iva vinākṛtāḥ
analyzed: kuntyā hīnāḥ su duḥkha ārtāḥ vatsāḥ iva vinākṛtāḥ
translated: Deprived of Kunti, they were extremely miserable, like calves separated from their mother.

original: dhṛtarāṣṭras tu tenāhnā gatvā sumahad antaram
analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ tu tena ahnā gatvā su mahat antaram
translated: Dhritarashtra, having traveled a very long distance that day,

original: tato bhāgīrathītīre nivāsam akarot prabhuḥ
analyzed: tatas bhāgīrathī tīre nivāsam akarot prabhuḥ
translated: then made his abode on the banks of the Bhagirathi, O lord.

original: prāduṣkṛtā yathānyāyam agnayo vedapāragaiḥ
analyzed: prāduṣkṛtāḥ yathānyāyam agnayaḥ vedapāragaiḥ
translated: The fires were duly kindled by those who had mastered the Vedas.

original: vyarājanta dvijaśreṣṭhais tatra tatra tapodhanaiḥ🔽prāduṣkṛtāgnir abhavat sa ca vṛddho narādhipaḥ
analyzed: vyarājanta dvijaśreṣṭhaiḥ tatra tatra tapodhanaiḥ  prāduṣkṛta agniḥ abhavat sa ca vṛddhaḥ narādhipaḥ
translated: They shone there, those best of Brahmins, those ascetics rich in austerities.🔽And that aged king, with the fires kindled,

original: sa rājāgnīn paryupāsya hutvā ca vidhivat tadā
analyzed: sa rāja agnīn paryupāsya hutvā ca vidhivat tadā
translated: having attended to the fires and offered oblations according to rule,

original: saṃdhyāgataṃ sahasrāṃśum upātiṣṭhata bhārata
analyzed: saṃdhyā gatam sahasrāṃśum upātiṣṭhata bhārata
translated: worshipped the thousand-rayed sun as it set, O descendant of Bharata.

original: viduraḥ saṃjayaś caiva rājñaḥ śayyāṃ kuśais tataḥ
analyzed: viduraḥ saṃjayaḥ ca eva rājñaḥ śayyām kuśaiḥ tatas
translated: Vidura and Sanjaya then prepared a bed of kusha grass for the king,

original: cakratuḥ kuruvīrasya gāndhāryāś cāvidūrataḥ
analyzed: cakratuḥ kuru vīrasya gāndhāryāḥ ca avidūrataḥ
translated: not far from Gandhari, of that hero of the Kuru lineage.

original: gāndhāryāḥ saṃnikarṣe tu niṣasāda kuśeṣv atha
analyzed: gāndhāryāḥ saṃnikarṣe tu niṣasāda kuśeṣu atha
translated: Gandhari then sat down on the kusha grass near him,

original: yudhiṣṭhirasya jananī kuntī sādhuvrate sthitā🔽teṣāṃ saṃśravaṇe cāpi niṣedur vidurādayaḥ
analyzed: yudhiṣṭhirasya jananī kuntī sādhu vrate sthitā  teṣām saṃśravaṇe ca api niṣeduḥ vidura ādayaḥ
translated: Kunti, the mother of Yudhishthira, remained firm in her virtuous vows.🔽Vidura and the others sat down within their hearing,

original: yājakāś ca yathoddeśaṃ dvijā ye cānuyāyinaḥ
analyzed: yājakāḥ ca yathoddeśam dvijāḥ ye ca anuyāyinaḥ
translated: as did the priests and the Brahmins who were followers, in their respective places.

original: prādhītadvijamukhyā sā saṃprajvālitapāvakā
analyzed: prādhīta dvijamukhyā sā saṃprajvālita pāvakā
translated: With the foremost of Brahmins reciting, and the fires kindled,

original: babhūva teṣāṃ rajanī brāhmīva prītivardhanī
analyzed: babhūva teṣām rajanī brāhmī iva prīti vardhanī
translated: That night was like the night of Brahma, increasing their joy.

original: tato rātryāṃ vyatītāyāṃ kṛtapūrvāhṇikakriyāḥ🔽hutvāgniṃ vidhivat sarve prayayus te yathākramam
analyzed: tatas rātryām vyatītāyām kṛta pūrvāhṇika kriyāḥ  hutvā agnim vidhivat sarve prayayuḥ te yathākramam
translated: Then, when the night had passed and they had performed their morning rites,🔽having offered oblations into the fire according to the rules, they all proceeded in order.

original: udaṅmukhā nirīkṣanta upavāsaparāyaṇāḥ
analyzed: udak mukhāḥ nirīkṣante upavāsa parāyaṇāḥ
translated: Facing north, looking on, devoted to fasting,

original: sa teṣām atiduḥkho 'bhūn nivāsaḥ prathame 'hani
analyzed: sa teṣām ati duḥkhaḥ bhūt nivāsaḥ prathame hani
translated: That first day was extremely painful for them,

original: śocatāṃ śocyamānānāṃ paurajānapadair janaiḥ
analyzed: śocatām śocyamānānām paura jānapadaiḥ janaiḥ
translated: for those who mourned, being mourned by the people of the city and the countryside.

original: vaiśaṃpāyana uvāca
analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: tato bhāgīrathītīre medhye puṇyajanocite
analyzed: tatas bhāgīrathī tīre medhye puṇya jana ucite
translated: Then, on the sacred bank of the Bhagirathi, suitable for meritorious people,

original: nivāsam akarod rājā vidurasya mate sthitaḥ
analyzed: nivāsam akarot rājā vidurasya mate sthitaḥ
translated: the king made his abode, abiding by Vidura's advice.

original: tatrainaṃ paryupātiṣṭhan brāhmaṇā rāṣṭravāsinaḥ
analyzed: tatra enam paryupātiṣṭhan brāhmaṇāḥ rāṣṭra vāsinaḥ
translated: There the Brahmanas living in the kingdom surrounded him,

original: kṣatraviṭśūdrasaṃghāś ca bahavo bharatarṣabha
analyzed: kṣatra viś śūdra saṃghāḥ ca bahavaḥ bharata ṛṣabha
translated: and many groups of Kshatriyas, Vaishyas and Shudras, O best of the Bharata race.

original: sa taiḥ parivṛto rājā kathābhir abhinandya tān
analyzed: sa taiḥ parivṛtaḥ rājā kathābhiḥ abhinandya tān
translated: Surrounded by them, the king, having delighted them with stories,

original: anujajñe saśiṣyān vai vidhivat pratipūjya ca
analyzed: anujajñe sa śiṣyān vai vidhivat pratipūjya ca
translated: dismissed them with their disciples, having duly honored them.

original: sāyāhne sa mahīpālas tato gaṅgām upetya ha
analyzed: sāyāhne sa mahīpālaḥ tatas gaṅgām upetya ha
translated: In the evening, the king then approached the Ganga

original: cakāra vidhivac chaucaṃ gāndhārī ca yaśasvinī
analyzed: cakāra vidhivat śaucam gāndhārī ca yaśasvinī
translated: and performed his purification according to the rules, and the illustrious Gandhari

original: tathaivānye pṛthak sarve tīrtheṣv āplutya bhārata
analyzed: tathā eva anye pṛthak sarve tīrtheṣu āplutya bhārata
translated: and all the others separately, having bathed in the sacred fords, O Bharata,

original: cakruḥ sarvāḥ kriyās tatra puruṣā vidurādayaḥ🔽kṛtaśaucaṃ tato vṛddhaṃ śvaśuraṃ kuntibhojajā
analyzed: cakruḥ sarvāḥ kriyāḥ tatra puruṣāḥ vidura ādayaḥ  kṛta śaucam tatas vṛddham śvaśuram kuntibhoja jā
translated: Vidura and others performed all the rites there.🔽Then, O king, Pritha, the daughter of Kuntibhoja, brought her aged father-in-law, who had become pure,

original: gāndhārīṃ ca pṛthā rājan gaṅgātīram upānayat🔽rājñas tu yājakais tatra kṛto vedīparistaraḥ
analyzed: gāndhārīm ca pṛthā rājan gaṅgā tīram upānayat  rājñaḥ tu yājakaiḥ tatra kṛtaḥ vedī paristaraḥ
translated: and Gandhari to the banks of the Ganges.🔽There the sacrificial priests of the king had prepared the altar and the surrounding area.

original: juhāva tatra vahniṃ sa nṛpatiḥ satyasaṃgaraḥ
analyzed: juhāva tatra vahnim sa nṛpatiḥ satya saṃgaraḥ
translated: The king, firm in truth, offered oblations into the fire there.

original: tato bhāgīrathītīrāt kurukṣetraṃ jagāma saḥ
analyzed: tatas bhāgīrathī tīrāt kurukṣetram jagāma saḥ
translated: Then he went from the banks of the Bhagirathi to Kurukshetra,

original: sānugo nṛpatir vidvān niyataḥ saṃyatendriyaḥ
analyzed: sa anugaḥ nṛpatiḥ vidvān niyataḥ saṃyata indriyaḥ
translated: the wise king, with his followers, restrained and with his senses controlled.

original: tatrāśramapadaṃ dhīmān abhigamya sa pārthivaḥ
analyzed: tatra āśrama padam dhīmān abhigamya sa pārthivaḥ
translated: Having reached that hermitage, the wise king

original: āsasādātha rājarṣiḥ śatayūpaṃ manīṣiṇam
analyzed: āsasāda atha rājarṣiḥ śatayūpam manīṣiṇam
translated: met the royal sage Shatayupa, the wise one.

original: sa hi rājā mahān āsīt kekayeṣu paraṃtapaḥ
analyzed: sa hi rājā mahān āsīt kekayeṣu paraṃtapaḥ
translated: For he was a great king among the Kekayas, a scorcher of enemies.

original: sa putraṃ manujaiśvarye niveśya vanam āviśat
analyzed: sa putram manuja aiśvarye niveśya vanam āviśat
translated: Having installed his son in the lordship over men, he entered the forest.

original: tenāsau sahito rājā yayau vyāsāśramaṃ tadā🔽tatrainaṃ vidhivad rājan pratyagṛhṇāt kurūdvaham
analyzed: tena asau sahitaḥ rājā yayau vyāsa āśramam tadā  tatra enam vidhivat rājan pratyagṛhṇāt kuru udvaham
translated: Together with him, the king then went to Vyasa's hermitage.🔽There, O king, he duly received the perpetuator of the Kuru lineage.

original: sa dīkṣāṃ tatra saṃprāpya rājā kauravanandanaḥ
analyzed: sa dīkṣām tatra saṃprāpya rājā kaurava nandanaḥ
translated: Having received initiation there, the king, the delighter of the Kurus,

original: śatayūpāśrame tasmin nivāsam akarot tadā
analyzed: śatayūpa āśrame tasmin nivāsam akarot tadā
translated: made his abode in that hermitage of Shatayupa.

original: tasmai sarvaṃ vidhiṃ rājan rājācakhyau mahāmatiḥ
analyzed: tasmai sarvam vidhim rājan rājā ācakhyau mahāmatiḥ
translated: O king, the greatly wise king told him the entire procedure.

original: āraṇyakaṃ mahārāja vyāsasyānumate tadā
analyzed: āraṇyakam mahā rāja vyāsasya anumate tadā
translated: O great king, with Vyasa's approval, he then engaged in the Aranyaka.

original: evaṃ sa tapasā rājā dhṛtarāṣṭro mahāmanāḥ
analyzed: evam sa tapasā rājā dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ mahā manāḥ
translated: Thus, through austerities, the great-minded king Dhritarashtra

original: yojayām āsa cātmānaṃ tāṃś cāpy anucarāṃs tadā
analyzed: yojayām āsa ca ātmānam tān ca api anucarān tadā
translated: united himself and his followers.

original: tathaiva devī gāndhārī valkalājinavāsinī
analyzed: tathā eva devī gāndhārī valkala ajina vāsinī
translated: In the same way, the queen Gandhari, wearing bark garments and antelope skin,

original: kuntyā saha mahārāja samānavratacāriṇī
analyzed: kuntyā saha mahā rāja samāna vrata cāriṇī
translated: practiced the same vows as Kunti, O great king.

original: karmaṇā manasā vācā cakṣuṣā cāpi te nṛpa
analyzed: karmaṇā manasā vācā cakṣuṣā ca api te nṛpa
translated: With body, mind, speech and eyes, O king,

original: saṃniyamyendriyagrāmam āsthitāḥ paramaṃ tapaḥ🔽tvagasthibhūtaḥ pariśuṣkamāṃso /
analyzed: saṃniyamya indriya grāmam āsthitāḥ paramam tapaḥ  tvac asthi bhūtaḥ pariśuṣka māṃsaḥ
translated: they controlled their senses and engaged in the highest austerities.🔽His body reduced to skin and bones, his flesh dried up,

original: jaṭājinī valkalasaṃvṛtāṅgaḥ
translated: with matted hair and clad in bark garments,

original: sa pārthivas tatra tapaś cacāra /
analyzed: sa pārthivaḥ tatra tapaḥ cacāra
translated: the king practiced austerities there,

original: maharṣivat tīvram apetadoṣaḥ
analyzed: mahā ṛṣi vat tīvram apeta doṣaḥ
translated: like a great sage, intensely and without fault.

original: kṣattā ca dharmārthavid agryabuddhiḥ /
analyzed: kṣattā ca dharma artha vid agrya buddhiḥ
translated: The chamberlain, knowledgeable in dharma and artha, of excellent intellect,

original: sasaṃjayas taṃ nṛpatiṃ sadāram
analyzed: sa saṃjayaḥ tam nṛpatim sa dāram
translated: together with Sanjaya, served that king and his wife,

original: upācarad ghoratapo jitātmā /
analyzed: upācarat ghora tapaḥ jita ātmā
translated: with his self conquered, practicing terrible austerities.

original: tadā kṛśo valkalacīravāsāḥ
analyzed: tadā kṛśaḥ valkala cīra vāsāḥ
translated: Then, emaciated, clad in bark garments and rags,

original: vaiśaṃpāyana uvāca
analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: tatas tasmin muniśreṣṭhā rājānaṃ draṣṭum abhyayuḥ
analyzed: tatas tasmin muni śreṣṭhāḥ rājānam draṣṭum abhyayus
translated: Then, those best of sages went to see the king.

original: nāradaḥ parvataś caiva devalaś ca mahātapāḥ
analyzed: nāradaḥ parvataḥ ca eva devalaḥ ca mahā tapāḥ
translated: Narada, Parvata, Devala of great austerities,

original: dvaipāyanaḥ saśiṣyaś ca siddhāś cānye manīṣiṇaḥ
analyzed: dvaipāyanaḥ sa śiṣyaḥ ca siddhāḥ ca anye manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: Dvaipayana with his disciples, and other sages and wise men,

original: śatayūpaś ca rājarṣir vṛddhaḥ paramadhārmikaḥ
analyzed: śatayūpaḥ ca rājarṣiḥ vṛddhaḥ parama dhārmikaḥ
translated: And the royal sage Shatayupa, old and supremely righteous,

original: teṣāṃ kuntī mahārāja pūjāṃ cakre yathāvidhi
analyzed: teṣām kuntī mahā rāja pūjām cakre yathāvidhi
translated: Kunti, O great king, worshipped them all according to the rules.

original: te cāpi tutuṣus tasyās tāpasāḥ paricaryayā
analyzed: te ca api tutuṣuḥ tasyāḥ tāpasāḥ paricaryayā
translated: And those ascetics were pleased with her service.

original: tatra dharmyāḥ kathās tāta cakrus te paramarṣayaḥ
analyzed: tatra dharmyāḥ kathāḥ tāta cakruḥ te parama ṛṣayaḥ
translated: There, O son, those great sages spoke of righteous matters,

original: ramayanto mahātmānaṃ dhṛtarāṣṭraṃ janādhipam
analyzed: ramayantaḥ mahātmānam dhṛtarāṣṭram janādhipam
translated: Delighting the great-souled Dhritarashtra, the lord of men.

original: kathāntare tu kasmiṃś cid devarṣir nāradas tadā
analyzed: kathā antare tu kasmin cit deva ṛṣiḥ nāradaḥ tadā
translated: But at one time, the celestial sage Narada,

original: kathām imām akathayat sarvapratyakṣadarśivān
analyzed: kathām imām akathayat sarva pratyakṣa darśivān
translated: who had seen everything, told this story:

original: purā prajāpatisamo rājāsīd akutobhayaḥ
analyzed: purā prajāpati samaḥ rājā āsīt akutobhayaḥ
translated: In ancient times, there was a king equal to Prajapati, fearless,

original: sahasracitya ity uktaḥ śatayūpapitāmahaḥ
analyzed: sahasracityaḥ iti uktaḥ śatayūpa pitāmahaḥ
translated: called Sahasrachitya, the grandfather of Shatayupa.

original: sa putre rājyam āsajya jyeṣṭhe paramadhārmike🔽sahasracityo dharmātmā praviveśa vanaṃ nṛpaḥ
analyzed: sa putre rājyam āsajya jyeṣṭhe parama dhārmike  sahasracityaḥ dharma ātmā praviveśa vanam nṛpaḥ
translated: He, having entrusted the kingdom to his eldest son, who was supremely righteous,🔽King Sahasrachitya, with a righteous soul, entered the forest.

original: vanaṃ viveśa dharmātmā śatacityo mahīpatiḥ
analyzed: vanam viveśa dharma ātmā śatacityaḥ mahīpatiḥ
translated: King Sahasrachitya, with a righteous soul, entered the forest.

original: sa gatvā tapasaḥ pāraṃ dīptasya sa narādhipaḥ
analyzed: sa gatvā tapasaḥ pāram dīptasya sa narādhipaḥ
translated: Having reached the other shore of blazing austerities, that lord of men,

original: puraṃdarasya saṃsthānaṃ pratipede mahāmanāḥ
analyzed: puraṃdarasya saṃsthānam pratipede mahāmanāḥ
translated: The great-minded one attained the abode of Purandara.

original: dṛṣṭapūrvaḥ sa bahuśo rājan saṃpatatā mayā
analyzed: dṛṣṭa pūrvaḥ sa bahuśas rājan saṃpatatā mayā
translated: O king, he was seen by me many times while flying.

original: mahendrasadane rājā tapasā dagdhakilbiṣaḥ
analyzed: mahā indra sadane rājā tapasā dagdha kilbiṣaḥ
translated: The king, his sins burnt by austerities, was in the abode of the great Indra.

original: tathā śailālayo rājā bhagadattapitāmahaḥ
analyzed: tathā śailālayaḥ rājā bhagadatta pitāmahaḥ
translated: Similarly, King Shailalaya, the grandfather of Bhagadatta,

original: tapobalenaiva nṛpo mahendrasadanaṃ gataḥ
analyzed: tapaḥ balena eva nṛpaḥ mahā indra sadanam gataḥ
translated: the king went to the abode of the great Indra only through the power of austerities.

original: tathā pṛṣadhro nāmāsīd rājā vajradharopamaḥ
analyzed: tathā pṛṣadhraḥ nāma āsīt rājā vajradhara upamaḥ
translated: Similarly, there was a king named Prishadhra, equal to the wielder of the thunderbolt.

original: sa cāpi tapasā lebhe nākapṛṣṭham ito nṛpaḥ
analyzed: sa ca api tapasā lebhe nāka pṛṣṭham itas nṛpaḥ
translated: And that king also obtained heaven from here through austerities.

original: asminn araṇye nṛpate māndhātur api cātmajaḥ
analyzed: asmin araṇye nṛpate māndhātuḥ api ca ātmajaḥ
translated: O king, in this very forest, the son of Mandhatri,

original: purukutso nṛpaḥ siddhiṃ mahatīṃ samavāptavān
analyzed: purukutsaḥ nṛpaḥ siddhim mahatīm samavāptavān
translated: King Purukutsa, attained great success.

original: bhāryā samabhavad yasya narmadā saritāṃ varā
analyzed: bhāryā samabhavat yasya narmadā saritām varā
translated: His wife was Narmada, the best of rivers.

original: so 'sminn araṇye nṛpatis tapas taptvā divaṃ gataḥ
analyzed: saḥ smin araṇye nṛpatiḥ tapaḥ taptvā divam gataḥ
translated: That king, having performed austerities in this forest, went to heaven.

original: śaśalomā ca nāmāsīd rājā paramadhārmikaḥ
analyzed: śaśalomā ca nāma āsīt rājā parama dhārmikaḥ
translated: There was also a king named Shashaloma, supremely righteous.

original: sa cāpy asmin vane taptvā tapo divam avāptavān
analyzed: sa ca api asmin vane taptvā tapaḥ divam avāptavān
translated: And he too, having performed austerities in this forest, attained heaven.

original: dvaipāyanaprasādāc ca tvam apīdaṃ tapovanam
analyzed: dvaipāyana prasādāt ca tvam api idam tapaḥ vanam
translated: And through the grace of Dvaipayana, you too, O king,

original: rājann avāpya duṣprāpāṃ siddhim agryāṃ gamiṣyasi
analyzed: rājan avāpya duṣprāpām siddhim agryām gamiṣyasi
translated: having attained this difficult-to-attain hermitage, will attain the highest perfection.

analyzed: pāṇḍuḥ smarati nityam ca balahantuḥ samīpatas

original: tava śuśrūṣayā caiva gāndhāryāś ca yaśasvinī
analyzed: tava śuśrūṣayā ca eva gāndhāryāḥ ca yaśasvinī
translated: And through your service and that of the illustrious Gandhari,

analyzed: bhartuḥ salokatām kuntī gamiṣyati vadhūḥ tava

analyzed: yudhiṣṭhirasya jananī sa hi dharmaḥ sanātanaḥ
translated: The mother of Yudhishthira, for he is eternal Dharma.

original: vayam etat prapaśyāmo nṛpate divyacakṣuṣā
analyzed: vayam etat prapaśyāmaḥ nṛpate divya cakṣuṣā
translated: We see this, O king, with our divine sight.

analyzed: pravekṣyati mahātmānam viduraḥ ca yudhiṣṭhiram

original: saṃjayas tvadanudhyānāt pūtaḥ svargam avāpsyati
analyzed: saṃjayaḥ tvad anudhyānāt pūtaḥ svargam avāpsyati
translated: Sanjaya, through his meditation on you, will be purified and attain heaven.

original: etac chrutvā kauravendro mahātmā /
analyzed: etat śrutvā kaurava indraḥ mahātmā
translated: Having heard this, the great-souled lord of the Kurus,

original: sahaiva patnyā prītimān pratyagṛhṇāt
analyzed: saha eva patnyā prītimān pratyagṛhṇāt
translated: together with his wife, joyfully accepted it.

original: vidvān vākyaṃ nāradasya praśasya /
analyzed: vidvān vākyam nāradasya praśasya
translated: The wise one praised Narada's words

analyzed: cakre pūjām ca atulām nāradāya  tathā sarve nāradam vipra saṃghāḥ
translated: and made incomparable offerings to Narada.🔽In the same way, all the groups of Brahmins, O king,

original: saṃpūjayām āsur atīva rājan
analyzed: saṃpūjayām āsuḥ atīva rājan
translated: greatly honored Narada.

original: rājñaḥ prītyā dhṛtarāṣṭrasya te vai /
analyzed: rājñaḥ prītyā dhṛtarāṣṭrasya te vai
translated: They did so out of love for King Dhritarashtra.

original: punaḥ punaḥ samahṛṣṭās tadānīm
analyzed: punar punar sama hṛṣṭāḥ tadānīm
translated: And were repeatedly delighted at that time.

original: vaiśaṃpāyana uvāca
analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: nāradasya tu tad vākyaṃ praśaśaṃsur dvijottamāḥ
analyzed: nāradasya tu tat vākyam praśaśaṃsuḥ dvijottamāḥ
translated: The best of the twice-born praised the words of Narada.

analyzed: śatayūpaḥ tu rājarṣiḥ nāradam vākyam abravīt

analyzed: aho bhagavatā śraddhā kururājasya vardhitā

analyzed: sarvasya ca janasya asya mama ca eva mahā dyute

analyzed: asti kā cit vivakṣā tu mama tām gadataḥ śṛṇu

original: dhṛtarāṣṭraṃ prati nṛpaṃ devarṣe lokapūjita
analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭram prati nṛpam deva ṛṣe loka pūjita

analyzed: sarva vṛttānta tattva jñaḥ bhavān divyena cakṣuṣā
translated: You know the truth of all events, and with your divine eye

analyzed: yuktaḥ paśyasi deva ṛṣe gatīḥ vai vividhāḥ nṛṇām

analyzed: uktavān nṛpatīnām tvam mahā indrasya salokatām

translated: But the worlds of this king have not been described by you, O great sage.

analyzed: tvattaḥ kīdṛś kadā vā iti tat mama ācakṣva pṛcchataḥ  iti uktaḥ nāradaḥ tena vākyam sarva manonugam

analyzed: vyājahāra satām madhye divya darśī mahā tapāḥ

analyzed: dṛṣṭavān asmi rāja ṛṣe tatra pāṇḍum narādhipam

analyzed: mādryā saha mahātmānam indra ardhāsana saṃsthitam

original: tatreyaṃ dhṛtarāṣṭrasya kathā samabhavan nṛpa

analyzed: tapasaḥ duścarasya asya yat ayam tapyate nṛpaḥ

original: tatrāham idam aśrauṣaṃ śakrasya vadato nṛpa
analyzed: tatra aham idam aśrauṣam śakrasya vadataḥ nṛpa
translated: There, O king, I heard this being spoken by Shakra,

translated: That only three years remain of this king's life span.🔽Then, accompanied by Gandhari, King Dhritarashtra,

translated: Honored by the king of kings,🔽Adorned with divine ornaments, will roam

analyzed: sva chandena iti dharma ātmā yat mām tvam paripṛcchasi

analyzed: bhavantaḥ hi śruta dhanāḥ tapasā dagdha kilbiṣāḥ
translated: You are indeed wealthy in learning, your sins burnt away by austerities.

analyzed: iti te tasya tat śrutvā deva ṛṣeḥ madhuram vacaḥ
translated: Having heard these sweet words of the celestial sage,

analyzed: evam kathābhiḥ anvāsya dhṛtarāṣṭram manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: Thus, having attended to Dhritarashtra with such stories,

analyzed: viprajagmuḥ yathākāmam te siddha gatim āsthitāḥ
translated: those wise ones departed as they wished, resorting to the path of the perfected.

original: vaiśaṃpāyana uvāca🔽vanaṃ gate kauravendre duḥkhaśokasamāhatāḥ
analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca  vanam gate kaurava indre duḥkha śoka samāhatāḥ

analyzed: katham nu rājā vṛddhaḥ sa vane vasati nirjane

original: gāndhārī ca mahābhāgā sā ca kuntī pṛthā katham
analyzed: gāndhārī ca mahābhāgā sā ca kuntī pṛthā katham

analyzed: su duṣkaram kṛtavatī kuntī putrān a paśyatī

analyzed: rājya śriyam parityajya vana vāsam arocayat

analyzed: sa ca gāvalgaṇiḥ dhīmān bhartṛ piṇḍa anupālakaḥ

analyzed: ākumāram ca paurāḥ te cintā śoka samāhatāḥ

original: tatra tatra kathāś cakruḥ samāsādya parasparam
analyzed: tatra tatra kathāḥ cakruḥ samāsādya parasparam
translated: Met together here and there and spoke to each other

original: pāṇḍavāś caiva te sarve bhṛśaṃ śokaparāyaṇāḥ
analyzed: pāṇḍavāḥ ca eva te sarve bhṛśam śoka parāyaṇāḥ

analyzed: śocantaḥ mātaram vṛddhām ūṣuḥ na ati ciram pure
translated: Mourning their aged mother, lived in the city for not too long

analyzed: tathā eva pitaram vṛddham hata putram janeśvaram
translated: And likewise the aged father, the lord of men whose sons were slain

original: gāndhārīṃ ca mahābhāgāṃ viduraṃ ca mahāmatim
analyzed: gāndhārīm ca mahābhāgām viduram ca mahāmatim
translated: And the greatly fortunate Gandhāri, and the greatly wise Vidura

analyzed: nā eṣām babhūva saṃprītiḥ tān vicintayatām tadā
translated: They had no joy then, thinking of them

original: na rājye na ca nārīṣu na vedādhyayane tathā
analyzed: na rājye na ca nārīṣu na veda adhyayane tathā
translated: Neither in the kingdom, nor in women, nor in studying the Vedas

original: paraṃ nirvedam agamaṃś cintayanto narādhipam
analyzed: param nirvedam agaman cintayantaḥ narādhipam
translated: They became extremely detached, thinking of the king

original: tac ca jñātivadhaṃ ghoraṃ saṃsmarantaḥ punaḥ punaḥ
analyzed: tat ca jñāti vadham ghoram saṃsmarantaḥ punar punar
translated: And remembering again and again that terrible slaughter of their kinsmen

original: abhimanyoś ca bālasya vināśaṃ raṇamūrdhani
analyzed: abhimanyoḥ ca bālasya vināśam raṇa mūrdhani
translated: And the destruction of young Abhimanyu on the battlefield

original: karṇasya ca mahābāhoḥ saṃgrāmeṣv apalāyinaḥ
analyzed: karṇasya ca mahā bāhoḥ saṃgrāmeṣu apalāyinaḥ
translated: And of the mighty-armed Karna, who never retreated from battle,

original: tathaiva draupadeyānām anyeṣāṃ suhṛdām api
analyzed: tathā eva draupadeyānām anyeṣām suhṛdām api
translated: And likewise of the sons of Draupadi and other friends,

original: vadhaṃ saṃsmṛtya te vīrā nātipramanaso 'bhavan
analyzed: vadham saṃsmṛtya te vīrāḥ na ati pramanasaḥ bhavan
translated: Remembering their slaughter, those heroes became exceedingly dispirited.

original: hatapravīrāṃ pṛthivīṃ hataratnāṃ ca bhārata
analyzed: hata pravīrām pṛthivīm hata ratnām ca bhārata
translated: The earth, O Bharata, was shorn of its best heroes and its best jewels,

original: sadaiva cintayantas te na nidrām upalebhire
analyzed: sadā eva cintayantaḥ te na nidrām upalebhire
translated: And always thinking of this, they could not obtain sleep.

original: draupadī hataputrā ca subhadrā caiva bhāminī
analyzed: draupadī hata putrā ca subhadrā ca eva bhāminī
translated: And Draupadi, whose sons were slain, and the beautiful Subhadra,

analyzed: na ati prīti yute devyau tadā āstām a prahṛṣṭa vat
translated: Those two queens, though not greatly delighted, still remained there, not cheerful.

original: vairāṭyās tu sutaṃ dṛṣṭvā pitaraṃ te parikṣitam
analyzed: vairāṭyāḥ tu sutam dṛṣṭvā pitaram te parikṣitam

analyzed: dhārayanti sma te prāṇān tava pūrva pitāmahāḥ

original: te śokavegābhihatā vicetaso
analyzed: te śoka vega abhihatāḥ vicetasaḥ

original: dine dine taiḥ puravāsibhiḥ saha🔽vihāya bhogān pararāṣṭramardanāḥ
analyzed: dine dine taiḥ pura vāsibhiḥ saha  vihāya bhogān para rāṣṭra mardanāḥ
translated: Day after day, along with the citizens,🔽Abandoning pleasures and the conquest of other kingdoms,

original: pratyaktakāmās tv avatasthur ādṛtāḥ
analyzed: pratyakta kāmāḥ tu avatasthuḥ ādṛtāḥ
translated: They remained, their desires frustrated, but respectful.

original: vaiśaṃpāyana uvāca
analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

analyzed: evam te puruṣa vyāghrāḥ pāṇḍavāḥ mātṛ nandanāḥ

analyzed: smarantaḥ mātaram vīrāḥ babhūvuḥ bhṛśa duḥkhitāḥ

original: ye rājakāryeṣu purā vyāsaktā nityaśo 'bhavan
analyzed: ye rāja kāryeṣu purā vyāsaktāḥ nityaśas bhavan

original: saṃbhāṣyamāṇā api te na kiṃ cit pratyapūjayan
analyzed: saṃbhāṣyamāṇāḥ api te na kim cit pratyapūjayan
translated: Even when addressed, they did not respond at all.

original: te sma vīrā durādharṣā gāmbhīrye sāgaropamāḥ
analyzed: te sma vīrāḥ durādharṣāḥ gāmbhīrye sāgara upamāḥ
translated: Those invincible heroes, deep like the ocean,

original: śokopahatavijñānā naṣṭasaṃjñā ivābhavan
analyzed: śoka upahata vijñānāḥ naṣṭa saṃjñāḥ iva abhavan

original: anusmaranto jananīṃ tatas te kurunandanāḥ
analyzed: anusmarantaḥ jananīm tatas te kuru nandanāḥ
translated: Remembering their mother, those descendants of Kuru

analyzed: katham nu vṛddha mithunam vahati adya pṛthā kṛśā
translated: thought, How can Pritha, emaciated, support the aged couple now?

original: kathaṃ ca sa mahīpālo hataputro nirāśrayaḥ
analyzed: katham ca sa mahīpālaḥ hata putraḥ nirāśrayaḥ
translated: And how does that king, his sons slain and helpless,

original: patnyā saha vasaty eko vane śvāpadasevite🔽sā ca devī mahābhāgā gāndhārī hatabāndhavā
analyzed: patnyā saha vasati ekaḥ vane śvāpada sevite  sā ca devī mahābhāgā gāndhārī hata bāndhavā
translated: live alone in the forest frequented by beasts, with his wife?🔽And how does that illustrious queen Gandhari, whose kinsmen are slain,

original: patim andhaṃ kathaṃ vṛddham anveti vijane vane
analyzed: patim andham katham vṛddham anveti vijane vane
translated: follow her blind and aged husband in the desolate forest?

original: evaṃ teṣāṃ kathayatām autsukyam abhavat tadā
analyzed: evam teṣām kathayatām autsukyam abhavat tadā
translated: While they were thus conversing, they became anxious

original: gamane cābhavad buddhir dhṛtarāṣṭradidṛkṣayā
analyzed: gamane ca abhavat buddhiḥ dhṛtarāṣṭra didṛkṣayā
translated: and resolved to go and see Dhritarashtra.

original: sahadevas tu rājānaṃ praṇipatyedam abravīt
analyzed: sahadevaḥ tu rājānam praṇipatya idam abravīt
translated: Sahadeva, bowing to the king, said this:

original: aho me bhavato dṛṣṭaṃ hṛdayaṃ gamanaṃ prati
analyzed: aho me bhavataḥ dṛṣṭam hṛdayam gamanam prati
translated: Oh, I see that your heart is set on going.

original: na hi tvā gauraveṇāham aśakaṃ vaktum ātmanā
analyzed: na hi tvā gauraveṇa aham aśakam vaktum ātmanā
translated: O Indra among kings, I was unable to speak to you myself out of respect,

original: gamanaṃ prati rājendra tad idaṃ samupasthitam
analyzed: gamanam prati rāja indra tat idam samupasthitam
translated: but this has now come to pass.

original: diṣṭyā drakṣyāmi tāṃ kuntīṃ vartayantīṃ tapasvinīm
analyzed: diṣṭyā drakṣyāmi tām kuntīm vartayantīm tapasvinīm
translated: Fortunate it is that I will see Kunti, that ascetic woman,

original: jaṭilāṃ tāpasīṃ vṛddhāṃ kuśakāśaparikṣatām
analyzed: jaṭilām tāpasīm vṛddhām kuśa kāśa parikṣatām
translated: old, with matted hair, a female ascetic, wounded by kusha grass,

original: prāsādaharmyasaṃvṛddhām atyantasukhabhāginīm
analyzed: prāsāda harmya saṃvṛddhām atyanta sukha bhāginīm
translated: brought up in palaces and mansions, accustomed to the highest comforts,

original: kadā nu jananīṃ śrāntāṃ drakṣyāmi bhṛśaduḥkhitām
analyzed: kadā nu jananīm śrāntām drakṣyāmi bhṛśa duḥkhitām
translated: when will I see my mother, tired and extremely unhappy?

original: anityāḥ khalu martyānāṃ gatayo bharatarṣabha
analyzed: anityāḥ khalu martyānām gatayaḥ bharata ṛṣabha
translated: O bull among the Bharata lineage, the destinies of mortals are indeed transient,

original: kuntī rājasutā yatra vasaty asukhinī vane
analyzed: kuntī rāja sutā yatra vasati asukhinī vane
translated: where Princess Kunti lives in the forest, unhappy.

original: sahadevavacaḥ śrutvā draupadī yoṣitāṃ varā
analyzed: sahadeva vacaḥ śrutvā draupadī yoṣitām varā
translated: Hearing Sahadeva's words, Droupadi, the best of women,

original: uvāca devī rājānam abhipūjyābhinandya ca
analyzed: uvāca devī rājānam abhipūjya abhinandya ca
translated: the queen, having honored and congratulated the king, said:

original: kadā drakṣyāmi tāṃ devīṃ yadi jīvati sā pṛthā
analyzed: kadā drakṣyāmi tām devīm yadi jīvati sā pṛthā
translated: When will I see that goddess, if Pritha is still alive?

original: jīvantyā hy adya naḥ prītir bhaviṣyati narādhipa
analyzed: jīvantyāḥ hi adya naḥ prītiḥ bhaviṣyati narādhipa
translated: For today, O lord of men, we will have joy if she is alive.

original: eṣā te 'stu matir nityaṃ dharme te ramatāṃ manaḥ
analyzed: eṣā te stu matiḥ nityam dharme te ramatām manaḥ
translated: Let this always be your intention, let your mind delight in dharma,

original: yo 'dya tvam asmān rājendra śreyasā yojayiṣyasi
analyzed: yaḥ dya tvam asmān rāja indra śreyasā yojayiṣyasi
translated: since today, O Indra among kings, you will unite us with prosperity.

original: agrapādasthitaṃ cemaṃ viddhi rājan vadhūjanam
analyzed: agra pāda sthitam ca imam viddhi rājan vadhū janam
translated: Know, O king, that this group of daughters-in-law is standing at the threshold,

original: kāṅkṣantaṃ darśanaṃ kuntyā gāndhāryāḥ śvaśurasya ca
analyzed: kāṅkṣantam darśanam kuntyāḥ gāndhāryāḥ śvaśurasya ca
translated: Desiring to see Kunti, Gandhari and my father-in-law.

original: ity uktaḥ sa nṛpo devyā pāñcālyā bharatarṣabha
analyzed: iti uktaḥ sa nṛpaḥ devyā pāñcālyā bharata ṛṣabha
translated: O best of the Bharata race, thus addressed by the queen Panchali, the king

original: senādhyakṣān samānāyya sarvān idam athābravīt
analyzed: senādhyakṣān samānāyya sarvān idam atha abravīt
translated: summoned all the generals and said this to them:

original: niryātayata me senāṃ prabhūtarathakuñjarām
analyzed: niryātayata me senām prabhūta ratha kuñjarām
translated: Send out my army with many chariots and elephants.

original: drakṣyāmi vanasaṃsthaṃ ca dhṛtarāṣṭraṃ mahīpatim
analyzed: drakṣyāmi vana saṃstham ca dhṛtarāṣṭram mahīpatim
translated: I will see King Dhritarashtra dwelling in the forest.

original: stryadhyakṣāṃś cābravīd rājā yānāni vividhāni me
analyzed: stryadhyakṣān ca abravīt rājā yānāni vividhāni me
translated: The king also said to the superintendents of women: Prepare various vehicles for me,

original: sajjīkriyantāṃ sarvāṇi śibikāś ca sahasraśaḥ
analyzed: sajjīkriyantām sarvāṇi śibikāḥ ca sahasraśas
translated: and have all the palanquins ready in thousands.

original: śakaṭāpaṇaveśāś ca kośaśilpina eva ca
analyzed: śakaṭa āpaṇa veśāḥ ca kośa śilpinaḥ eva ca
translated: Carts, shops, garments, treasuries and artisans,

original: niryāntu kośapālāś ca kurukṣetrāśramaṃ prati
analyzed: niryāntu kośapālāḥ ca kurukṣetra āśramam prati
translated: let the treasurers go towards the hermitage in Kurukshetra.

original: yaś ca paurajanaḥ kaś cid draṣṭum icchati pārthivam
analyzed: yaḥ ca paura janaḥ kaḥ cit draṣṭum icchati pārthivam
translated: And whatever citizens wish to see the king,

original: anāvṛtaḥ suvihitaḥ sa ca yātu surakṣitaḥ🔽sūdāḥ paurogavāś caiva sarvaṃ caiva mahānasam
analyzed: anāvṛtaḥ su vihitaḥ sa ca yātu su rakṣitaḥ  sūdāḥ paurogavāḥ ca eva sarvam ca eva mahānasam
translated: let them go without obstruction, well-protected and well-guarded.🔽The cooks, the chief cooks, and the entire kitchen,

original: vividhaṃ bhakṣyabhojyaṃ ca śakaṭair uhyatāṃ mama
analyzed: vividham bhakṣya bhojyam ca śakaṭaiḥ uhyatām mama
translated: and various food and edibles, let them be carried by carts for me.

original: prayāṇaṃ ghuṣyatāṃ caiva śvobhūta iti mā ciram
analyzed: prayāṇam ghuṣyatām ca eva śvobhūte iti mā ciram
translated: And let the departure be announced: 'Tomorrow it will take place.' Do not delay.

original: kriyantāṃ pathi cāpy adya veśmāni vividhāni ca
analyzed: kriyantām pathi ca api adya veśmāni vividhāni ca
translated: And let various kinds of houses be built on the road today.

original: evam ājñāpya rājā sa bhrātṛbhiḥ saha pāṇḍavaḥ🔽śvobhūte niryayau rājā sastrībālapuraskṛtaḥ
analyzed: evam ājñāpya rājā sa bhrātṛbhiḥ saha pāṇḍavaḥ  śvobhūte niryayau rājā sa strī bāla puraskṛtaḥ
translated: Having thus commanded, the king, the son of Pandu, together with his brothers,🔽on the following day, the king set out, with women and children at the forefront.

original: sa bahir divasān evaṃ janaughaṃ paripālayan
analyzed: sa bahis divasān evam jana ogham paripālayan
translated: In this way, the king, protecting the multitude of people outside,

original: nyavasan nṛpatiḥ pañca tato 'gacchad vanaṃ prati
analyzed: nyavasat nṛpatiḥ pañca tatas gacchat vanam prati
translated: lived for five days and then went to the forest.

original: vaiśaṃpāyana uvāca
analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: ājñāpayām āsa tataḥ senāṃ bharatasattamaḥ
analyzed: ājñāpayām āsa tatas senām bharata sattamaḥ
translated: Then the best of the Bharata lineage commanded the army,

original: arjunapramukhair guptāṃ lokapālopamair naraiḥ
analyzed: arjuna pramukhaiḥ guptām lokapāla upamaiḥ naraiḥ
translated: protected by men led by Arjuna, who were like the guardians of the world.

original: yogo yoga iti prītyā tataḥ śabdo mahān abhūt
analyzed: yogaḥ yogaḥ iti prītyā tatas śabdaḥ mahān abhūt
translated: There was a great sound of yoga, yoga out of affection,

original: krośatāṃ sādināṃ tatra yujyatāṃ yujyatām iti
analyzed: krośatām sādinām tatra yujyatām yujyatām iti
translated: and the horsemen there shouted, Yoke, yoke.

original: ke cid yānair narā jagmuḥ ke cid aśvair manojavaiḥ
analyzed: ke cit yānaiḥ narāḥ jagmuḥ ke cit aśvaiḥ manojavaiḥ
translated: Some men went by vehicles, some by horses swift as thought,

original: rathaiś ca nagarākāraiḥ pradīptajvalanopamaiḥ🔽gajendraiś ca tathaivānye ke cid uṣṭrair narādhipa🔽padātinas tathaivānye nakharaprāsayodhinaḥ
analyzed: rathaiḥ ca nagara ākāraiḥ pradīpta jvalana upamaiḥ  gaja indraiḥ ca tathā eva anye ke cid uṣṭraiḥ narādhipa  padātinaḥ tathā eva anye nakhara prāsa yodhinaḥ
translated: by chariots shaped like cities, resembling blazing fires,🔽and by great elephants, and others by camels, O lord of men.🔽Others were on foot, fighting with claws and spears,

original: paurajānapadāś caiva yānair bahuvidhais tathā
analyzed: paura jānapadāḥ ca eva yānaiḥ bahuvidhaiḥ tathā
translated: and the citizens and country people also in various kinds of vehicles,

original: anvayuḥ kururājānaṃ dhṛtarāṣṭradidṛkṣayā
analyzed: anvayuḥ kuru rājānam dhṛtarāṣṭra didṛkṣayā
translated: followed the Kuru king with the desire to see Dhritarashtra.

original: sa cāpi rājavacanād ācāryo gautamaḥ kṛpaḥ
analyzed: sa ca api rāja vacanāt ācāryaḥ gautamaḥ kṛpaḥ
translated: And at the king's command, the teacher Gautama Kripa,

original: senām ādāya senānī prayayāv āśramaṃ prati
analyzed: senām ādāya senānīḥ prayayau āśramam prati
translated: Taking the army with him, the commander-in-chief went towards the hermitage.

original: tato dvijair vṛtaḥ śrīmān kururājo yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
analyzed: tatas dvijaiḥ vṛtaḥ śrīmān kururājaḥ yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
translated: Then the prosperous Kuru king Yudhishthira, surrounded by the Brahmins,

original: saṃstūyamāno bahubhiḥ sūtamāgadhabandibhiḥ
analyzed: saṃstūyamānaḥ bahubhiḥ sūta māgadha bandibhiḥ
translated: praised by many bards, genealogists and heralds,

original: pāṇḍureṇātapatreṇa dhriyamāṇena mūrdhani
analyzed: pāṇḍureṇa ātapatreṇa dhriyamāṇena mūrdhani
translated: with a white parasol held over his head,

original: rathānīkena mahatā niryayau kurunandanaḥ
analyzed: ratha anīkena mahatā niryayau kuru nandanaḥ
translated: the descendant of the Kuru lineage set out with a large army of chariots.

original: gajaiś cācalasaṃkāśair bhīmakarmā vṛkodaraḥ🔽sajjayantrāyudhopetaiḥ prayayau mārutātmajaḥ
analyzed: gajaiḥ ca acala saṃkāśaiḥ bhīma karmā vṛkodaraḥ  sajja yantra āyudha upetaiḥ prayayau mārutātmajaḥ
translated: Bhima, the performer of terrible deeds, with elephants resembling mountains,🔽the son of the Wind-god set out with machines and weapons ready.

original: mādrīputrāv api tathā hayārohaiḥ susaṃvṛtau
analyzed: mādrī putrau api tathā haya ārohaiḥ su saṃvṛtau
translated: The two sons of Madri, surrounded by excellent horsemen,

original: jagmatuḥ prītijananau saṃnaddhakavacadhvajau
analyzed: jagmatuḥ prīti jananau saṃnaddha kavaca dhvajau
translated: went, causing delight, with their armor, flags and banners ready.

original: arjunaś ca mahātejā rathenādityavarcasā
analyzed: arjunaḥ ca mahā tejāḥ rathena āditya varcasā
translated: And the greatly radiant Arjuna, with a chariot shining like the sun,

original: vaśī śvetair hayair divyair yuktenānvagaman nṛpam
analyzed: vaśī śvetaiḥ hayaiḥ divyaiḥ yuktena anvagamat nṛpam
translated: with well-trained white celestial horses, followed the king.

original: draupadīpramukhāś cāpi strīsaṃghāḥ śibikāgatāḥ🔽stryadhyakṣayuktāḥ prayayur visṛjanto 'mitaṃ vasu
analyzed: draupadī pramukhāḥ ca api strī saṃghāḥ śibikā gatāḥ  strī adhyakṣa yuktāḥ prayayuḥ visṛjantaḥ mitam vasu
translated: And the groups of women headed by Draupadi, seated in palanquins,🔽accompanied by the chief of the women, went forth, bestowing abundant wealth.

original: samṛddhanaranāgāśvaṃ veṇuvīṇānināditam
analyzed: samṛddha nara nāga aśvam veṇu vīṇā nināditam
translated: Filled with men, elephants and horses, resounding with flutes and lutes,

original: śuśubhe pāṇḍavaṃ sainyaṃ tat tadā bharatarṣabha
analyzed: śuśubhe pāṇḍavam sainyam tat tadā bharata ṛṣabha
translated: the Pandava army shone forth then, O best of the Bharata race.

original: nadītīreṣu ramyeṣu saratsu ca viśāṃ pate
analyzed: nadī tīreṣu ramyeṣu saratsu ca viśām pate
translated: On the banks of rivers, in beautiful and watery places, O lord of the people.

original: vāsān kṛtvā krameṇātha jagmus te kurupuṃgavāḥ
analyzed: vāsān kṛtvā krameṇa atha jagmuḥ te kuru puṃgavāḥ
translated: Having made their abodes in due order, those bulls of the Kuru lineage then went.

original: yuyutsuś ca mahātejā dhaumyaś caiva purohitaḥ
analyzed: yuyutsuḥ ca mahā tejāḥ dhaumyaḥ ca eva purohitaḥ
translated: The greatly energetic Yuyutsu and the priest Dhaumya,

original: yudhiṣṭhirasya vacanāt puraguptiṃ pracakratuḥ
analyzed: yudhiṣṭhirasya vacanāt pura guptim pracakratuḥ
translated: at the behest of Yudhishthira, took up the task of guarding the city.

original: tato yudhiṣṭhiro rājā kurukṣetram avātarat
analyzed: tatas yudhiṣṭhiraḥ rājā kurukṣetram avātarat
translated: Then King Yudhishthira entered Kurukshetra,

original: krameṇottīrya yamunāṃ nadīṃ paramapāvanīm
analyzed: krameṇa uttīrya yamunām nadīm parama pāvanīm
translated: and in due course crossed the Yamuna river, the supremely purifying one.

original: sa dadarśāśramaṃ dūrād rājarṣes tasya dhīmataḥ
analyzed: sa dadarśa āśramam dūrāt rājarṣeḥ tasya dhīmataḥ
translated: From a distance he saw the hermitage of that wise royal sage,

original: śatayūpasya kauravya dhṛtarāṣṭrasya caiva ha
analyzed: śatayūpasya kauravya dhṛtarāṣṭrasya ca eva ha
translated: O descendant of the Kuru lineage, of Shatayupa and Dhritarashtra.

original: tataḥ pramuditaḥ sarvo janas tad vanam añjasā
analyzed: tatas pramuditaḥ sarvaḥ janaḥ tat vanam añjasā
translated: Then the entire people, filled with joy, quickly entered that forest,

original: viveśa sumahānādair āpūrya bharatarṣabha
analyzed: viveśa su mahā nādaiḥ āpūrya bharata ṛṣabha
translated: filling it with great sounds, O bull of the Bharata lineage.

original: vaiśaṃpāyana uvāca
analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: tatas te pāṇḍavā dūrād avatīrya padātayaḥ
analyzed: tatas te pāṇḍavāḥ dūrāt avatīrya padātayaḥ
translated: Then the Pandavas, having descended from a distance on foot,

original: abhijagmur narapater āśramaṃ vinayānatāḥ
analyzed: abhijagmuḥ narapateḥ āśramam vinaya ānatāḥ
translated: approached the hermitage of the king with humility.

original: sa ca paurajanaḥ sarvo ye ca rāṣṭranivāsinaḥ
analyzed: sa ca paura janaḥ sarvaḥ ye ca rāṣṭra nivāsinaḥ
translated: And all the citizens and those residing in the kingdom,

original: striyaś ca kurumukhyānāṃ padbhir evānvayus tadā
analyzed: striyaḥ ca kuru mukhyānām padbhiḥ eva anvayuḥ tadā
translated: and the women of the foremost Kurus, followed on foot at that time.

original: āśramaṃ te tato jagmur dhṛtarāṣṭrasya pāṇḍavāḥ
analyzed: āśramam te tatas jagmuḥ dhṛtarāṣṭrasya pāṇḍavāḥ
translated: Then the Pandavas went to the hermitage of Dhritarashtra,

original: śūnyaṃ mṛgagaṇākīrṇaṃ kadalīvanaśobhitam
analyzed: śūnyam mṛga gaṇa ākīrṇam kadalī vana śobhitam
translated: Empty, filled with herds of deer, and adorned with groves of plantain trees.

original: tatas tatra samājagmus tāpasā vividhavratāḥ
analyzed: tatas tatra samājagmuḥ tāpasāḥ vividha vratāḥ
translated: Then ascetics of various vows gathered there,

original: pāṇḍavān āgatān draṣṭuṃ kautūhalasamanvitāḥ
analyzed: pāṇḍavān āgatān draṣṭum kautūhala samanvitāḥ
translated: Filled with curiosity to see the Pandavas who had arrived.

original: tān apṛcchat tato rājā kvāsau kauravavaṃśabhṛt
analyzed: tān apṛcchat tatas rājā kva asau kaurava vaṃśa bhṛt
translated: The king then asked them, Where has that upholder of the Kuru dynasty gone?

original: pitā jyeṣṭho gato 'smākam iti bāṣpapariplutaḥ
analyzed: pitā jyeṣṭhaḥ gataḥ smākam iti bāṣpa pariplutaḥ
translated: My eldest father has gone. Saying this, he was overwhelmed with tears.

original: tam ūcus te tato vākyaṃ yamunām avagāhitum
analyzed: tam ūcuḥ te tatas vākyam yamunām avagāhitum
translated: They said to him, To bathe in the Yamuna river,

original: puṣpāṇām udakumbhasya cārthe gata iti prabho
analyzed: puṣpāṇām uda kumbhasya ca arthe gate iti prabho
translated: To fetch flowers and a pot of water, O lord.

original: tair ākhyātena mārgeṇa tatas te prayayus tadā
analyzed: taiḥ ākhyātena mārgeṇa tatas te prayayuḥ tadā
translated: Following the path indicated by them, they then proceeded.

original: dadṛśuś cāvidūre tān sarvān atha padātayaḥ
analyzed: dadṛśuḥ ca avidūre tān sarvān atha padātayaḥ
translated: And they saw all those foot soldiers not far away.

original: tatas te satvarā jagmuḥ pitur darśanakāṅkṣiṇaḥ
analyzed: tatas te sa tvarāḥ jagmuḥ pituḥ darśana kāṅkṣiṇaḥ
translated: Then, eager to see their father, they quickly went to him.

original: sahadevas tu vegena prādhāvad yena sā pṛthā
analyzed: sahadevaḥ tu vegena prādhāvat yena sā pṛthā
translated: But Sahadeva ran with speed to where Pritha was.

original: sasvanaṃ prarudan dhīmān mātuḥ pādāv upaspṛśan
analyzed: sa svanam prarudan dhīmān mātuḥ pādau upaspṛśan
translated: The wise one wept aloud and touched the feet of his mother.

original: sā ca bāṣpāvilamukhī pradadarśa priyaṃ sutam
analyzed: sā ca bāṣpa āvila mukhī pradadarśa priyam sutam
translated: She too, with a tear-filled face, saw her beloved son.

original: bāhubhyāṃ saṃpariṣvajya samunnāmya ca putrakam
analyzed: bāhubhyām saṃpariṣvajya samunnāmya ca putrakam
translated: Embracing him with her arms and lifting up her son,

original: gāndhāryāḥ kathayām āsa sahadevam upasthitam
analyzed: gāndhāryāḥ kathayām āsa sahadevam upasthitam
translated: she told Gandhari that Sahadeva had arrived.

original: anantaraṃ ca rājānaṃ bhīmasenam athārjunam
analyzed: anantaram ca rājānam bhīmasenam atha arjunam
translated: Then Pritha saw the king, Bhimasena, Arjuna,

original: nakulaṃ ca pṛthā dṛṣṭvā tvaramāṇopacakrame
analyzed: nakulam ca pṛthā dṛṣṭvā tvaramāṇā upacakrame
translated: and Nakula, and quickly approached them.

original: sā hy agre 'gacchata tayor daṃpatyor hataputrayoḥ
analyzed: sā hi agre gacchata tayoḥ daṃpatyoḥ hata putrayoḥ
translated: She went ahead of the childless couple,

original: karṣantī tau tatas te tāṃ dṛṣṭvā saṃnyapatan bhuvi
analyzed: karṣantī tau tatas te tām dṛṣṭvā saṃnyapatan bhuvi
translated: pulling them along. Seeing her, they fell down on the ground.

original: tayos tu pādayo rājan nyapatan hataputrayoḥ🔽tān rājā svarayogena sparśena ca mahāmanāḥ
analyzed: tayoḥ tu pādayoḥ rājan nyapatan hata putrayoḥ  tān rājā svara yogena sparśena ca mahā manāḥ
translated: But the childless couple fell at her feet, O king.🔽The great-minded king, wise and powerful,

original: pratyabhijñāya medhāvī samāśvāsayata prabhuḥ
analyzed: pratyabhijñāya medhāvī samāśvāsayata prabhuḥ
translated: recognized them by their voices and touch, and comforted them.

original: tatas te bāṣpam utsṛjya gāndhārīsahitaṃ nṛpam
analyzed: tatas te bāṣpam utsṛjya gāndhārī sahitam nṛpam
translated: Then they shed tears and approached the king with Gandhari,

original: upatasthur mahātmāno mātaraṃ ca yathāvidhi
analyzed: upatasthuḥ mahātmānaḥ mātaram ca yathāvidhi
translated: and the great souls duly attended to their mother.

original: sarveṣāṃ toyakalaśāñ jagṛhus te svayaṃ tadā
analyzed: sarveṣām toya kalaśām jagṛhuḥ te svayam tadā
translated: They themselves took water pots for all of them.

original: pāṇḍavā labdhasaṃjñās te mātrā cāśvāsitāḥ punaḥ
analyzed: pāṇḍavāḥ labdha saṃjñāḥ te mātrā ca āśvāsitāḥ punar
translated: The Pandavas, regaining consciousness and comforted by their mother again,

original: tato nāryo nṛsiṃhānāṃ sa ca yodhajanas tadā
analyzed: tatas nāryaḥ nṛ siṃhānām sa ca yodha janaḥ tadā
translated: then the women, the warriors,

original: paurajānapadāś caiva dadṛśus taṃ narādhipam
analyzed: paura jānapadāḥ ca eva dadṛśuḥ tam narādhipam
translated: and the citizens and country people saw that lord of men.

original: nivedayām āsa tadā janaṃ taṃ nāmagotrataḥ
analyzed: nivedayām āsa tadā janam tam nāma gotrataḥ
translated: He announced that assembly by name and family,

original: yudhiṣṭhiro narapatiḥ sa cainān pratyapūjayat
analyzed: yudhiṣṭhiraḥ narapatiḥ sa ca enān pratyapūjayat
translated: and King Yudhishthira honored them all.

original: sa taiḥ parivṛto mene harṣabāṣpāvilekṣaṇaḥ
analyzed: sa taiḥ parivṛtaḥ mene harṣa bāṣpa āvila īkṣaṇaḥ
translated: Surrounded by them, with his eyes filled with tears of joy,

original: rājātmānaṃ gṛhagataṃ pureva gajasāhvaye
analyzed: rāja ātmānam gṛha gatam purā iva gajasāhvaye
translated: he felt like the king himself, as if he were in his own house in the city of Hastināpura.

original: abhivādito vadhūbhiś ca kṛṣṇādyābhiḥ sa pārthivaḥ
analyzed: abhivāditaḥ vadhūbhiḥ ca kṛṣṇa ādyābhiḥ sa pārthivaḥ
translated: The king was greeted by his daughters-in-law, headed by Krishna,

original: gāndhāryā sahito dhīmān kuntyā ca pratyanandata
analyzed: gāndhāryā sahitaḥ dhīmān kuntyā ca pratyanandata
translated: and together with Gandhāri and the wise Kunti, he rejoiced.

original: tataś cāśramam āgacchat siddhacāraṇasevitam
analyzed: tatas ca āśramam āgacchat siddha cāraṇa sevitam
translated: Then he came to the hermitage, frequented by perfected beings and celestial beings,

original: didṛkṣubhiḥ samākīrṇaṃ nabhas tārāgaṇair iva
analyzed: didṛkṣubhiḥ samākīrṇam nabhaḥ tārā gaṇaiḥ iva
translated: crowded with those who wished to see, like the sky with multitudes of stars.

original: vaiśaṃpāyana uvāca
analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: sa taiḥ saha naravyāghrair bhrātṛbhir bharatarṣabha
analyzed: sa taiḥ saha nara vyāghraiḥ bhrātṛbhiḥ bharata ṛṣabha
translated: O best of the Bharata race, the king, with those best of men, his brothers,

original: rājā rucirapadmākṣair āsāṃ cakre tadāśrame
analyzed: rājā rucira padma akṣaiḥ āsām cakre tad āśrame
translated: with eyes like beautiful lotuses, then sat down in the hermitage.

original: tāpasaiś ca mahābhāgair nānādeśasamāgataiḥ
analyzed: tāpasaiḥ ca mahābhāgaiḥ nānā deśa samāgataiḥ
translated: And with the greatly fortunate ascetics who had come from various countries,

original: draṣṭuṃ kurupateḥ putrān pāṇḍavān pṛthuvakṣasaḥ
analyzed: draṣṭum kuru pateḥ putrān pāṇḍavān pṛthu vakṣasaḥ
translated: to see the sons of the lord of the Kurus, the Pāṇḍavas with broad chests.

original: te 'bruvañ jñātum icchāmaḥ katamo 'tra yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
analyzed: te jñātum icchāmaḥ katamaḥ yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
translated: They said, We wish to know, which one here is Yudhiṣṭhira,

original: bhīmārjunayamāś caiva draupadī ca yaśasvinī
analyzed: bhīma arjuna yamāḥ ca eva draupadī ca yaśasvinī
translated: and Bhima, Arjuna, and Y ama, and the illustrious Draupadī?

original: tān ācakhyau tadā sūtaḥ sarvān nāmābhināmataḥ
analyzed: tān ācakhyau tadā sūtaḥ sarvān nāma abhināmataḥ
translated: Then the charioteer announced them all by name,

original: saṃjayo draupadīṃ caiva sarvāś cānyāḥ kurustriyaḥ
analyzed: saṃjayaḥ draupadīm ca eva sarvāḥ ca anyāḥ kuru striyaḥ
translated: and Sañjaya also Draupadī and all the other Kuru women.

original: ya eṣa jāmbūnadaśuddhagaura /
analyzed: yaḥ eṣa jāmbūnada śuddha gaura
translated: This one with a complexion pure like gold,

original: tanur mahāsiṃha iva pravṛddhaḥ
analyzed: tanuḥ mahā siṃhaḥ iva pravṛddhaḥ
translated: His body is like a huge and grown lion,

original: pracaṇḍaghoṇaḥ pṛthudīrghanetras /
translated: with a prominent nose and large, long eyes.

original: tāmrāyatāsyaḥ kururāja eṣaḥ
analyzed: tāmra āyata āsyaḥ kururājaḥ eṣaḥ
translated: This is the king of the Kurus, with copper-red, long lips.

original: ayaṃ punar mattagajendragāmī /
analyzed: ayam punar matta gaja indra gāmī
translated: And this one, walking like a rutting lordly elephant,

original: prataptacāmīkaraśuddhagauraḥ
translated: with a pure, fair complexion like heated gold,

original: pṛthvāyatāṃsaḥ pṛthudīrghabāhur /
analyzed: pṛthu āyata aṃsaḥ pṛthu dīrgha bāhuḥ
translated: with broad shoulders and long, massive arms,

original: vṛkodaraḥ paśyata paśyatainam
analyzed: vṛkodaraḥ paśyata paśyata enam
translated: look at Vrikodara, look at him!

original: yas tv eṣa pārśve 'sya mahādhanuṣmāñ /🔽śyāmo yuvā vāraṇayūthapābhaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ tu eṣa pārśve sya mahā dhanuṣmān  śyāmaḥ yuvā vāraṇa yūthapa ābhaḥ
translated: But this one by his side, with a great bow,🔽dark, youthful, like the leader of a herd of elephants,

original: siṃhonnatāṃso gajakhelagāmī /
translated: with shoulders raised like a lion, walking with the gait of an elephant,

original: padmāyatākṣo 'rjuna eṣa vīraḥ
analyzed: padma āyata akṣaḥ rjunaḥ eṣa vīraḥ
translated: with eyes long like lotus petals, this is the hero Arjuna.

original: kuntīsamīpe puruṣottamau tu /
analyzed: kuntī samīpe puruṣa uttamau tu
translated: But these two best of men near Kunti,

original: yamāv imau viṣṇumahendrakalpau
analyzed: yamau imau viṣṇu mahā indra kalpau
translated: these two twins, equal to Vishnu and Indra,

original: manuṣyaloke sakale samo 'sti /
analyzed: manuṣya loke sakale samaḥ sti
translated: in all the world of men there is none their equal.

original: yayor na rūpe na bale na śīle
analyzed: yayoḥ na rūpe na bale na śīle
translated: In beauty, strength, or character,

original: iyaṃ punaḥ padmadalāyatākṣī /
analyzed: iyam punar padma dala āyata akṣī
translated: This one here, with eyes long like lotus petals,

original: madhyaṃ vayaḥ kiṃ cid iva spṛśantī🔽nīlotpalābhā puradevateva /
analyzed: madhyam vayaḥ kim cit iva spṛśantī  nīlotpala ābhā pura devatā iva
translated: just touching middle age,🔽with a complexion like a blue lotus, like a celestial maiden,

original: kṛṣṇā sthitā mūrtimatīva lakṣmīḥ
analyzed: kṛṣṇā sthitā mūrtimatī iva lakṣmīḥ
translated: Krishna stands, like embodied Lakshmi.

original: asyās tu pārśve kanakottamābhā /
analyzed: asyāḥ tu pārśve kanaka uttama ābhā
translated: But by her side, with a complexion like excellent gold,

original: yaiṣā prabhā mūrtimatīva gaurī
analyzed: yā eṣā prabhā mūrtimatī iva gaurī
translated: this one here, like embodied radiance, like Gauri,

original: madhye sthitaiṣā bhaginī dvijāgryā /
analyzed: madhye sthitā eṣā bhaginī dvijāgryā
translated: stands in the middle, the sister of the best of Brahmins.

original: cakrāyudhasyāpratimasya tasya🔽iyaṃ ca jāmbūnadaśuddhagaurī🔽pārthasya bhāryā bhujagendrakanyā
analyzed: cakra āyudhasya apratimasya tasya  iyam ca jāmbūnada śuddha gaurī  pārthasya bhāryā bhujaga indra kanyā
translated: This one, the daughter of the king of serpents, is the wife of Partha,

original: citrāṅgadā caiva narendrakanyā
analyzed: citrāṅgadā ca eva narendra kanyā
translated: whose complexion is pure like gold from the Jambu river, and also Citrāṅgadā, the daughter of the king.

original: yaiṣā savarṇāgryamadhūkapuṣpaiḥ
analyzed: yā eṣā savarṇā agrya madhūka puṣpaiḥ
translated: This one, whose complexion is like the best of madhuka flowers,

original: iyaṃ svasā rājacamūpates tu /
analyzed: iyam svasā rāja camū pateḥ tu
translated: is the sister of the lord of the army of kings.

original: pravṛddhanīlotpaladāmavarṇā
analyzed: pravṛddha nīlotpala dāma varṇā
translated: Having a complexion like a garland of fully bloomed blue lotuses,

original: paspardha kṛṣṇena nṛpaḥ sadā yo /
analyzed: paspardha kṛṣṇena nṛpaḥ sadā yaḥ
translated: the king who always rivaled Kṛṣṇa,

original: vṛkodarasyaiṣa parigraho 'gryaḥ
analyzed: vṛkodarasya eṣa parigrahaḥ gryaḥ
translated: this is his foremost wife, Vṛkodara's.

original: iyaṃ ca rājño magadhādhipasya /
analyzed: iyam ca rājñaḥ magadha adhipasya
translated: This one is the daughter of the king of Magadha,

original: sutā jarāsaṃdha iti śrutasya🔽yavīyaso mādravatīsutasya /
analyzed: sutā jarāsaṃdhaḥ iti śrutasya  yavīyasaḥ mādravatī sutasya
translated: the younger brother of Jarāsandha, who is known as

original: bhāryā matā campakadāmagaurī🔽indīvaraśyāmatanuḥ sthitā tu /
analyzed: bhāryā matā campaka dāma gaurī  indīvara śyāma tanuḥ sthitā tu
translated: the son of Mādrāvatī, and is considered his wife, having a complexion like a champaka flower garland.

original: yaiṣāparāsannamahītale ca
analyzed: yā eṣā apara āsanna mahī tale ca
translated: This one, having a body dark like a blue lotus,

original: bhāryā matā mādravatīsutasya /
analyzed: bhāryā matā mādravatī sutasya
translated: is the wife of the son of Mādrāvatī, who is near the earth.

original: jyeṣṭhasya seyaṃ kamalāyatākṣī
analyzed: jyeṣṭhasya sā iyam kamala āyata akṣī
translated: This one, having eyes like lotuses, is the wife of the eldest son,

original: iyaṃ tu niṣṭaptasuvarṇagaurī /
analyzed: iyam tu niṣṭapta suvarṇa gaurī
translated: this one, having a complexion like pure gold,

original: rājño virāṭasya sutā saputrā
analyzed: rājñaḥ virāṭasya sutā sa putrā
translated: is the daughter of King Virāṭa, with her son,

original: bhāryābhimanyor nihato raṇe yo /
analyzed: bhāryā abhimanyoḥ nihataḥ raṇe yaḥ
translated: the wife of Abhimanyu, who was killed in battle.

original: droṇādibhis tair viratho rathasthaiḥ
analyzed: droṇa ādibhiḥ taiḥ virathaḥ ratha sthaiḥ
translated: He, who was made chariotless by Drona and others standing on their chariots,

original: etās tu sīmantaśiroruhā yāḥ /
analyzed: etāḥ tu sīmanta śiroruhāḥ yāḥ
translated: these are the ones with hair parted on the head,

original: śuklottarīyā nararājapatnyaḥ
analyzed: śukla uttarīyāḥ nara rāja patnyaḥ
translated: the wives of the king of men, wearing white upper garments,

original: rājño 'sya vṛddhasya paraṃśatākhyāḥ /
analyzed: rājñaḥ sya vṛddhasya paraṃśata ākhyāḥ
translated: The wives of the king, who is now old and has passed a hundred years,

original: snuṣā vivīrā hataputranāthāḥ
analyzed: snuṣāḥ vivīrāḥ hata putra nāthāḥ
translated: The daughters-in-law, who are helpless with their sons killed,

original: etā yathāmukhyam udāhṛtā vo /
analyzed: etāḥ yathāmukhyam udāhṛtāḥ vaḥ
translated: These have been mentioned by me in order of importance.

original: brāhmaṇyabhāvād ṛjubuddhisattvāḥ
analyzed: brāhmaṇya bhāvāt ṛju buddhi sattvāḥ
translated: They are of pure intellect and mind, having the status of Brahmanas,

original: sarvā bhavadbhiḥ paripṛcchyamānā /
analyzed: sarvā bhavadbhiḥ paripṛcchyamānā
translated: When asked by you all,

original: narendrapatnyaḥ suviśuddhasattvāḥ
analyzed: narendra patnyaḥ su viśuddha sattvāḥ
translated: The wives of the king, of pure hearts,

original: evaṃ sa rājā kuruvṛddhavaryaḥ /
analyzed: evam sa rājā kuru vṛddha varyaḥ
translated: Thus the king, the best among the elders of the Kurus,

original: samāgatas tair naradevaputraiḥ
analyzed: samāgataḥ taiḥ naradeva putraiḥ
translated: Having assembled with those sons of the king of men,

original: papraccha sarvān kuśalaṃ tadānīṃ /
analyzed: papraccha sarvān kuśalam tadānīm
translated: Asked them all about their welfare at that time.

original: gateṣu sarveṣv atha tāpaseṣu🔽yodheṣu cāpy āśramamaṇḍalaṃ taṃ /
analyzed: gateṣu sarveṣu atha tāpaseṣu  yodheṣu ca api āśrama maṇḍalam tam
translated: When all the ascetics and the warriors

original: muktvā niviṣṭeṣu vimucya patram
analyzed: muktvā niviṣṭeṣu vimucya patram
translated: Had left the hermitage and settled down, having released the bird,

original: strīvṛddhabāle ca susaṃniviṣṭe /
analyzed: strī vṛddha bāle ca su saṃniviṣṭe
translated: And the women, the elders and the children were well settled,

original: yathārhataḥ kuśalaṃ paryapṛcchat
analyzed: yathārhataḥ kuśalam paryapṛcchat
translated: He asked about their welfare as befitted them.

original: dhṛtarāṣṭra uvāca
analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ uvāca
translated: Dhritarashtra said:

original: yudhiṣṭhira mahābāho kaccit tāta kuśaly asi
analyzed: yudhiṣṭhira mahā bāho kaccit tāta kuśalī asi
translated: O Yudhishthira, O mighty-armed one, I hope you are well, O son,

original: sahito bhrātṛbhiḥ sarvaiḥ paurajānapadais tathā
analyzed: sahitaḥ bhrātṛbhiḥ sarvaiḥ paura jānapadaiḥ tathā
translated: Together with all your brothers, and with the citizens and country people,

original: ye ca tvām upajīvanti kaccit te 'pi nirāmayāḥ
analyzed: ye ca tvām upajīvanti kaccit te pi nirāmayāḥ
translated: And those who depend on you - I hope they are all free from disease.

original: sacivā bhṛtyavargāś ca guravaś caiva te vibho
analyzed: sacivāḥ bhṛtya vargāḥ ca guravaḥ ca eva te vibho
translated: O lord, your ministers, groups of servants and elders,

original: kaccit te 'pi nirātaṅkā vasanti viṣaye tava
analyzed: kaccit te pi nirātaṅkāḥ vasanti viṣaye tava
translated: I hope they too dwell in your kingdom free from anxiety.

original: kaccid vartasi paurāṇīṃ vṛttiṃ rājarṣisevitām🔽kaccid dāyān anucchidya kośas te 'bhiprapūryate
analyzed: kaccit vartasi paurāṇīm vṛttim rājarṣi sevitām  kaccit dāyān an ucchidya kośaḥ te bhiprapūryate
