translated: And so it was for that ascetic royal sage of the Kuru dynasty.

original: katham evaṃvidho mṛtyuḥ praśāsya pṛthivīm imām
analyzed: katham evaṃvidhaḥ mṛtyuḥ praśāsya pṛthivīm imām
translated: How could such a death befall him after ruling this earth?

original: tiṣṭhatsu mantrapūteṣu tasyāgniṣu mahāvane
analyzed: tiṣṭhatsu mantra pūteṣu tasya agniṣu mahā vane
translated: While his fires, consecrated with mantras, were still standing in the great forest,

original: vṛthāgninā samāyukto niṣṭhāṃ prāptaḥ pitā mama
analyzed: vṛthā agninā samāyuktaḥ niṣṭhām prāptaḥ pitā mama
translated: My father, united with a worthless fire, has met his end.

original: manye pṛthā vepamānā kṛśā dhamanisaṃtatā
analyzed: manye pṛthā vepamānā kṛśā dhamani saṃtatā
translated: I think Pritha, emaciated and trembling, her veins standing out,

original: hā tāta dharmarājeti samākrandan mahābhaye🔽bhīma paryāpnuhi bhayād iti caivābhivāśatī
analyzed: hā tāta dharmarāja iti samākrandat mahā bhaye  bhīma paryāpnuhi bhayāt iti ca eva abhivāśatī
translated: Crying out Alas, my son, King Yudhishthira! in that great danger,🔽And saying Bhima, protect me from fear,

original: bhīma māṃ trāhi dāvāgner bhayād ity abhiyācatī
analyzed: bhīma mām trāhi dāva agneḥ bhayāt iti abhiyācatī
translated: And supplicating Bhima, save me from the forest fire,

original: samantataḥ parikṣiptā mātā me 'bhūd davāgninā
analyzed: samantataḥ parikṣiptā mātā me bhūt dava agninā
translated: My mother was completely surrounded by the forest fire.

original: sahadevaḥ priyas tasyāḥ putrebhyo 'dhika eva tu
analyzed: sahadevaḥ priyaḥ tasyāḥ putrebhyaḥ dhikaḥ eva tu
translated: Sahadeva was dearer to her than her own sons.

original: na caināṃ mokṣayām āsa vīro mādravatīsutaḥ
analyzed: na ca enām mokṣayām āsa vīraḥ mādravatī sutaḥ
translated: But the heroic son of Madravati did not release her.

original: tac chrutvā ruruduḥ sarve samāliṅgya parasparam
analyzed: tat śrutvā ruruduḥ sarve samāliṅgya parasparam
translated: Hearing that, all of them wept, embracing each other.

original: pāṇḍavāḥ pañca duḥkhārtā bhūtānīva yugakṣaye🔽teṣāṃ tu puruṣendrāṇāṃ rudatāṃ ruditasvanaḥ
analyzed: pāṇḍavāḥ pañca duḥkha ārtāḥ bhūtāni iva yuga kṣaye  teṣām tu puruṣa indrāṇām rudatām rudita svanaḥ
translated: The five Pandavas, afflicted with grief, were like the elements at the end of a yuga.🔽The weeping sound of those foremost of men

original: prāsādābhogasaṃruddho anvarautsīt sa rodasī
analyzed: prāsāda ābhoga saṃruddhaḥ anvarautsīt sa rodasī
translated: reverberated through the sky and earth, confined by the palace walls.

original: anyonyaṃ vīkṣya vīkṣyaivaṃ smṛtvā mātur upaplavam
analyzed: anyonyam vīkṣya vīkṣya evam smṛtvā mātuḥ upaplavam
translated: Looking at each other again and again, remembering their mother's calamity,

original: sehire na mahīpālā nipetuḥ pṛthivītale
analyzed: sehire na mahīpālāḥ nipetuḥ pṛthivī tale
translated: the kings could not bear it and fell down on the ground.

original: punar utthāya cāliṅgya rudanto viṣamasvanāḥ
analyzed: punar utthāya ca āliṅgya rudantaḥ viṣama svanāḥ
translated: Rising again, embracing each other, weeping with distorted voices,

original: nipetuḥ pāṇḍavāḥ śokād dharmarājasya pādayoḥ
analyzed: nipetuḥ pāṇḍavāḥ śokāt dharmarājasya pādayoḥ
translated: the Pandavas fell down in grief at Dharmaraja's feet.

original: nārada uvāca
analyzed: nāradaḥ uvāca
translated: Narada said:

original: nāsau vṛthāgninā dagdho yathā tatra śrutaṃ mayā
analyzed: na asau vṛthā agninā dagdhaḥ yathā tatra śrutam mayā
translated: I heard there that he was not burned by the useless fire.

original: vaicitravīryo nṛpatis tat te vakṣyāmi bhārata🔽vanaṃ praviśatā tena vāyubhakṣeṇa dhīmatā
analyzed: vaicitravīryaḥ nṛpatiḥ tat te vakṣyāmi bhārata  vanam praviśatā tena vāyubhakṣeṇa dhīmatā
translated: O descendant of Bharata, I will tell you that about King Vichitravirya.🔽It is heard by us that when he entered the forest, that wise one, subsisting on air,

original: agnayaḥ kārayitveṣṭim utsṛṣṭā iti naḥ śrutam
analyzed: agnayaḥ kārayitvā iṣṭim utsṛṣṭāḥ iti naḥ śrutam
translated: had the sacrificial fires carried away and abandoned after performing the sacrifices.

original: yājakās tu tatas tasya tān agnīn nirjane vane
analyzed: yājakāḥ tu tatas tasya tān agnīn nirjane vane
translated: But the priests then, in that deserted forest,

original: samutsṛjya yathākāmaṃ jagmur bharatasattama🔽sa vivṛddhas tadā vahnir vane tasminn abhūt kila
analyzed: samutsṛjya yathākāmam jagmuḥ bharata sattama  sa vivṛddhaḥ tadā vahniḥ vane tasmin abhūt kila
translated: And having abandoned it as they wished, they left, O best of the Bharata lineage.🔽And it is said that the fire grew in that forest then.

original: tena tad vanam ādīptam iti me tāpasābruvan
analyzed: tena tat vanam ādīptam iti me tāpasāḥ bruvan
translated: For that reason, the forest was ablaze, so the ascetics told me.

original: sa rājā jāhnavīkacche yathā te kathitaṃ mayā
analyzed: sa rājā jāhnavī kacche yathā te kathitam mayā
translated: O king, as I have told you, the king was on the banks of the Jahnavi.

original: tenāgninā samāyuktaḥ svenaiva bharatarṣabha
analyzed: tena agninā samāyuktaḥ svena eva bharata ṛṣabha
translated: O bull among the Bharata race, he was united with that fire, his own.

original: evam āvedayām āsur munayas te mamānagha
analyzed: evam āvedayām āsuḥ munayaḥ te mama anagha
translated: Thus, O sinless one, the sages informed me.

original: ye te bhāgīrathītīre mayā dṛṣṭā yudhiṣṭhira
analyzed: ye te bhāgīrathī tīre mayā dṛṣṭāḥ yudhiṣṭhira
translated: Those whom I saw on the banks of the Bhagirathi, O Yudhishthira.

original: evaṃ svenāgninā rājā samāyukto mahīpate
analyzed: evam svena agninā rājā samāyuktaḥ mahīpate
translated: Thus, O lord of the earth, the king was united with his own fire.

original: mā śocithās tvaṃ nṛpatiṃ gataḥ sa paramāṃ gatim
analyzed: mā śocithāḥ tvam nṛpatim gataḥ sa paramām gatim
translated: Do not grieve for the king, he has attained the highest state.

original: guruśuśrūṣayā caiva jananī tava pāṇḍava
analyzed: guru śuśrūṣayā ca eva jananī tava pāṇḍava
translated: And by serving his elders, O son of Pandu, your mother

original: prāptā sumahatīṃ siddhim iti me nātra saṃśayaḥ
analyzed: prāptā su mahatīm siddhim iti me na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: Has attained great success, there is no doubt about it in my mind.

original: kartum arhasi kauravya teṣāṃ tvam udakakriyām
analyzed: kartum arhasi kauravya teṣām tvam udakakriyām
translated: O Kouravya, you should perform the water rites for them.

original: bhrātṛbhiḥ sahitaḥ sarvair etad atra vidhīyatām
analyzed: bhrātṛbhiḥ sahitaḥ sarvaiḥ etat atra vidhīyatām
translated: Do this with all your brothers, let it be done here.

original: vaiśaṃpāyana uvāca
analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: tataḥ sa pṛthivīpālaḥ pāṇḍavānāṃ dhuraṃdharaḥ
analyzed: tatas sa pṛthivīpālaḥ pāṇḍavānām dhuraṃdharaḥ
translated: Then that lord of the earth, the upholder of the Pandavas,

original: niryayau saha sodaryaiḥ sadāro bharatarṣabha
analyzed: niryayau saha sodaryaiḥ sa dāraḥ bharata ṛṣabha
translated: Set out with his brothers and wives, O bull among the Bharata race.

original: paurajānapadāś caiva rājabhaktipuraskṛtāḥ
analyzed: paura jānapadāḥ ca eva rāja bhakti puraskṛtāḥ
translated: The citizens and the people of the country, with devotion to the king,

original: gaṅgāṃ prajagmur abhito vāsasaikena saṃvṛtāḥ
analyzed: gaṅgām prajagmuḥ abhitas vāsasā ekena saṃvṛtāḥ
translated: went to the Ganges, covered with a single garment.

original: tato 'vagāhya salilaṃ sarve te kurupuṃgavāḥ
analyzed: tatas vagāhya salilam sarve te kuru puṃgavāḥ
translated: Then, having entered the water, all those bulls of the Kuru lineage,

original: yuyutsum agrataḥ kṛtvā dadus toyaṃ mahātmane
analyzed: yuyutsum agratas kṛtvā daduḥ toyam mahātmane
translated: with Yuyutsu at the forefront, offered water to the great-souled one.

original: gāndhāryāś ca pṛthāyāś ca vidhivan nāmagotrataḥ
analyzed: gāndhāryāḥ ca pṛthāyāḥ ca vidhivat nāma gotrataḥ
translated: According to the prescribed rites, with the names and gotras of Gandhari and Pritha,

original: śaucaṃ nivartayantas te tatroṣur nagarād bahiḥ🔽preṣayām āsa sa narān vidhijñān āptakāriṇaḥ
analyzed: śaucam nivartayantaḥ te tatra ūṣuḥ nagarāt bahis  preṣayām āsa sa narān vidhi jñān āpta kāriṇaḥ
translated: they performed the purification rites and stayed outside the city.🔽The best of the Kurus, the king, sent reliable men who knew the rituals

original: gaṅgādvāraṃ kuruśreṣṭho yatra dagdho 'bhavan nṛpaḥ
analyzed: gaṅgādvāram kuru śreṣṭhaḥ yatra dagdhaḥ bhavan nṛpaḥ
translated: to the Gangadvara, where the king had been cremated.

original: tatraiva teṣāṃ kulyāni gaṅgādvāre 'nvaśāt tadā
analyzed: tatra eva teṣām kulyāni gaṅgādvāre nu aśāt tadā
translated: There, at the Gangadvara, he ordered the construction of their memorial mounds,

original: kartavyānīti puruṣān dattadeyān mahīpatiḥ
analyzed: kartavyāni iti puruṣān datta deyān mahīpatiḥ
translated: and the king, having given gifts, sent men to do the work.

original: dvādaśe 'hani tebhyaḥ sa kṛtaśauco narādhipaḥ
analyzed: dvādaśe hani tebhyaḥ sa kṛta śaucaḥ narādhipaḥ
translated: On the twelfth day, the king, having become pure,

original: dadau śrāddhāni vidhivad dakṣiṇāvanti pāṇḍavaḥ
analyzed: dadau śrāddhāni vidhivat dakṣiṇāvanti pāṇḍavaḥ
translated: the Pandava duly performed the funeral ceremonies, with gifts.

original: dhṛtarāṣṭraṃ samuddiśya dadau sa pṛthivīpatiḥ
analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭram samuddiśya dadau sa pṛthivīpatiḥ
translated: For Dhritarashtra, the lord of the earth

original: suvarṇaṃ rajataṃ gāś ca śayyāś ca sumahādhanāḥ
analyzed: suvarṇam rajatam gāḥ ca śayyāḥ ca su mahādhanāḥ
translated: gave gold, silver, cows, and extremely expensive beds.

original: gāndhāryāś caiva tejasvī pṛthāyāś ca pṛthak pṛthak
analyzed: gāndhāryāḥ ca eva tejasvī pṛthāyāḥ ca pṛthak pṛthak
translated: The energetic one separately gave to Gandhari and Pritha

original: bahūni caiva ratnāni vāsāṃsi vividhāni ca
analyzed: bahūni ca eva ratnāni vāsāṃsi vividhāni ca
translated: And many jewels and various garments,

original: mahārhāṇi vicitrāṇi dadau kauravanandanaḥ🔽saṃkīrtya nāmanī rājā dadau dānam anuttamam
analyzed: mahārhāṇi vicitrāṇi dadau kaurava nandanaḥ  saṃkīrtya nāmanī rājā dadau dānam anuttamam
translated: The delighter of the Kurus gave.🔽The king, having proclaimed their names, gave the excellent gift.

original: saṃkīrtya nāmāni dadau rājan dānāni pārthivaḥ🔽yo yad icchati yāvac ca tāvat sa labhate dvijaḥ
analyzed: saṃkīrtya nāmāni dadau rājan dānāni pārthivaḥ  yaḥ yat icchati yāvat ca tāvat sa labhate dvijaḥ
translated: The king, having proclaimed their names, gave gifts, O king.🔽Whatever a brahmin desires, to that extent he receives.

original: yāvad icchanti viprās tu tāvanti prāpnuyur dvijāḥ🔽śayanaṃ bhojanaṃ yānaṃ maṇiratnam atho dhanam
analyzed: yāvat icchanti viprāḥ tu tāvanti prāpnuyuḥ dvijāḥ  śayanam bhojanam yānam maṇi ratnam atho dhanam
translated: To that extent the brahmins will obtain, as much as the brahmins desire.🔽Beds, food, vehicles, jewels, gems, and wealth,

original: yānam ācchādanaṃ bhogān dāsīś ca paricārikāḥ
analyzed: yānam ācchādanam bhogān dāsīḥ ca paricārikāḥ
translated: Vehicles, clothes, enjoyments, female slaves, and attendants,

original: dadau rājā samuddiśya tayor mātror mahīpatiḥ
analyzed: dadau rājā samuddiśya tayoḥ mātroḥ mahīpatiḥ
translated: The king gave, designating them for their two mothers, the lord of the earth.

original: tataḥ sa pṛthivīpālo dattvā śrāddhāny anekaśaḥ
analyzed: tatas sa pṛthivīpālaḥ dattvā śrāddhāni anekaśas
translated: Then the lord of the earth, having given many funeral ceremonies,

original: praviveśa punar dhīmān nagaraṃ vāraṇāhvayam
analyzed: praviveśa punar dhīmān nagaram vāraṇa āhvayam
translated: Again entered the city of Hastināpura, the wise one.

original: siktasaṃmārjitapathaṃ patākātoraṇocchritam
analyzed: sikta saṃmārjita patham patākā toraṇa ucchritam
translated: With its roads sprinkled and swept, with flags and arches erected,

original: hṛṣṭapuṣṭajanākīrṇaṃ puraṃ teṣāṃ praveśane
analyzed: hṛṣṭa puṣṭa jana ākīrṇam puram teṣām praveśane
translated: The city was filled with delighted and well-nourished people upon their entry.

original: te cāpi rājavacanāt puruṣā ye gatābhavan
analyzed: te ca api rāja vacanāt puruṣāḥ ye gatāḥ abhavan
translated: And those men who had been sent, by the king's command,

original: dhṛtarāṣṭrasya gāndhāryāḥ kuntyāś cakruś ca saṃghaśaḥ
analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭrasya gāndhāryāḥ kuntyāḥ cakruḥ ca saṃghaśas
translated: They made funeral ceremonies in groups for Dhṛtarāṣṭra, Gāndhārī, and Kuntī.

original: gaṅgādvāre śubhe puṇye yathoddiṣṭaṃ mahātmanā
analyzed: gaṅgādvāre śubhe puṇye yathā uddiṣṭam mahātmanā
translated: At the auspicious and sacred Gangadvara, as directed by the great soul,

original: saṃkalpya teṣāṃ kulyāni punaḥ pratyāgamaṃs tataḥ
analyzed: saṃkalpya teṣām kulyāni punar pratyāgaman tatas
translated: Having created their channels, they returned.

original: mālyair gandhaiś ca vividhaiḥ pūjayitvā yathāvidhi
analyzed: mālyaiḥ gandhaiḥ ca vividhaiḥ pūjayitvā yathāvidhi
translated: Having worshipped with garlands, fragrances and various offerings according to the prescribed rites,

original: kulyāni teṣāṃ saṃyojya tadācakhyur mahīpateḥ
analyzed: kulyāni teṣām saṃyojya tadā ācakhyuḥ mahīpateḥ
translated: Having joined their channels, they then informed the king.

original: samāśvāsya ca rājānaṃ dharmātmānaṃ yudhiṣṭhiram
analyzed: samāśvāsya ca rājānam dharma ātmānam yudhiṣṭhiram
translated: And having comforted King Yudhishthira, the righteous one,

original: nārado 'py agamad rājan paramarṣir yathepsitam
analyzed: nāradaḥ pi agamat rājan parama ṛṣiḥ yathā īpsitam
translated: The great sage Narada then went away, O king, to wherever he desired.

original: dvārakāyāṃ tataḥ kṛṣṇaṃ vāsudevaṃ janārdanam
analyzed: dvārakāyām tatas kṛṣṇam vāsudevam janārdanam
translated: Then in Dvaraka, to Krishna, Vasudeva, Janardana,

original: anādinidhanaṃ viṣṇuṃ śaṅkhacakragadādharam
analyzed: an ādi nidhanam viṣṇum śaṅkha cakra gadā dharam
translated: The beginningless and endless Vishnu, the wielder of conch, discus and mace,

original: rahasyakathane yuktaṃ nārāyaṇam anāmayam
analyzed: rahasya kathane yuktam nārāyaṇam anāmayam
translated: The one fit for secret narration, Narayana, the infallible one,

original: evaṃ varṣāṇy atītāni dhṛtarāṣṭrasya dhīmataḥ
analyzed: evam varṣāṇi atītāni dhṛtarāṣṭrasya dhīmataḥ
translated: Thus the years passed for the wise Dhritarashtra,

original: vanavāse tadā trīṇi nagare daśa pañca ca
analyzed: vana vāse tadā trīṇi nagare daśa pañca ca
translated: Three in the forest and fifteen in the city,

original: hataputrasya saṃgrāme dānāni dadataḥ sadā
analyzed: hata putrasya saṃgrāme dānāni dadataḥ sadā
translated: For the one whose sons were killed in battle, always giving gifts,

original: jñātisaṃbandhimitrāṇāṃ bhrātṝṇāṃ svajanasya ca🔽yudhiṣṭhiras tu nṛpatir nātiprītamanās tadā
analyzed: jñāti saṃbandhi mitrāṇām bhrātṝṇām sva janasya ca  yudhiṣṭhiraḥ tu nṛpatiḥ na ati prīta manāḥ tadā
translated: To relatives, kinsmen, friends, brothers and his own people,🔽But King Yudhishthira was not very pleased at that time,

original: dhārayām āsa tad rājyaṃ nihatajñātibāndhavaḥ
analyzed: dhārayām āsa tat rājyam nihata jñāti bāndhavaḥ
translated: He ruled that kingdom, with his relatives and friends killed.

original: tathāśramavāsike tu parvaṇy api samāhitaḥ
analyzed: tathā āśramavāsike tu parvaṇi api samāhitaḥ
translated: Similarly, on the Ashramavasika Parva, with a concentrated mind,

original: gandhamālyādiyuktaṃ ca haviṣyaṃ bhojayed dvijān
analyzed: gandha mālya ādi yuktam ca haviṣyam bhojayet dvijān
translated: he should feed Brahmins with Havishya along with scents, garlands, etc.
